loans.name: Virginie

texts.en: Virginie is 32 years, married with five children aged between 9 and 14 years. They all go to school. She owns a canteen while her husband has a studio and has been in business for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy baking powder in order to make more cakes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy baking powder in order to make more cakes to sell.

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.ru: Муродчон мужчина 40  лет,  женат, отец четверых  детей. Он с детства работает на поле, ухаживает за домашним скотом, выращивает фрукты и овощи. Муродчон хотел получить высшее образование, но у его родителей не было средств, поэтому он после женитьбы начал заниматься земледелием. Вот уже на протяжение 18 лет Муродчон на своем участке земли выращивает картошку, морковь, пшеницу и хлопок. Он начинал с 2 гектаров земли, и понемногу с годами достиг того,что у него теперь 25 гектаров земли, где он и выращивает свой урожай, который продаёт на рынке. Ему помогает его жена и сыновья. Товар хорошо скупается, потому что Муродчон выращивает его с заботой и любовью. Он берет кредит, чтобы оплодотворить почву на своем участке, но у него нет  полной суммы денег. Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Он надеется, что МДО Арванд откликнется на его просьбу о помощи и выделит нужную сумму.Заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Murodjon is a man of 40 years, is married, and is the father of four children. Since childhood, he has been working in the field, tending domestic livestock, and growing fruits and vegetables. Murodjon would have liked to get a higher education, but his parents did not have the resources and therefore after he got married, he began working in agriculture. For the last 18 years, Murodjon on his own plot of land has been growing potatoes, carrots, wheat and cotton. He started with two hectares of land, and gradually over the years achieved now 25 hectares, where he also grows his crops which he sells at the market. His wife and sons help him. His goods are being bought up well because Murodjon grows them with love and care. He is taking a loan in order to fertilize the soil on his land, but he does not have the full sum. Therefore, he applied to MDO Arvand for financial support. He hopes that MDO Arvand will fulfill his request for assistance and disburse the needed sum. He is grateful in advance for the support and trust.

loans.use: to fertilize the soil.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie is 30 years old. She is married with 4 children aged 1 and 9, 2 of them go to school. She sells food stuffs and she has been in a business for 5 years. Her husband is an electrician. With the loan, she would like to buy more Irish potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build her house.

loans.use: to buy more Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase packages of miscellaneous used clothing in Managua

loans.name: Jóvenes De Chuguexab. Group

texts.es:
Tomás Francisco es el líder del grupo Jóvenes de Chuguexab, tiene 21 años de edad vive en una comunidad de Chichicastenango, tiene una hija de 1 año que se encuentra  aún bajo el cuidado de la mama.
Tomás Francisco (primero del lado derecho de la fotografía con un rebozo rosado en mano) él se casó a una edad muy temprana es por eso que le ha costado mucho salir adelante, él es un muchacho amable y responsable que para generar sus ingresos él se dedica a la elaboración de chumpas casuales esta actividad él lo realiza desde hace 2 años a él le gusta esta actividad porque a través de ello él se relaciona con mucha gente de su comunidad así como también de otros lugares lejanos.
Tomas Francisco quiere ahora mejora la calidad de su producto y la única forma de hacerlo ofrecerle a la clientela, telas de calidad y aun buen precio, es por ello que él ha reunido a un grupo de jóvenes con esa misma iniciativa, para solicitar un prestamo que lo utilizaran para la compra de hilos y telas.
El sueño de Tomás Francisco es hacer que esta inversión le genere a él una buena gancia para poder ayudar a mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Tomás Francisco is the leader of the Jóvenes de Chuguexab [Youth of Chuguexab] group. He is 21 years old and lives in the community of Chichicastenango. He has a 1-year-old daughter who is cared for by her mom.

Tomás Franciso (first from the right, holding a pink shawl) got married at a very young age, so he has run into many challenges. He is a kind and responsible young man who makes casual jackets to make a living. He has been doing this for 2 years, and he likes it because through his work, he gets to know many people from his community as well as from distant places.

Now Tomás Franciso wants to improve his product's quality, and the only way to do that is to offer his customers quality fabric at a good price. For this reason, he has joined a group of young people with the same goal. He is requesting a loan that he will use to buy thread and fabric.

Tomás Franciso's dream to make this investment generate a good return for him so that he can help support his family.

loans.use: to buy cloth and thread

loans.name: Celeste

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Manhiça Província de Maputo tem 60 anos de idade, casada oficialmente mãe de 5 filhos maiores de idade, apenas 1 frequenta a escola, responsabiliza-se pelos seus 7 netos que vivem em sua casa.
É negociante a mais de 15 anos de venda de refeições no mercado informal shoprit, onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Na tentativa de satisfazer os seus clientes solicita um empréstimo para aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo pintos, ração e vitaminas. Este é o seu 8º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende ampliar a sua sala de residência e garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
Born in the Manhiça province of Maputo, she is 60 years old and officially married. She is the mother of five adult children, only one of which goes to school. She is responsible for her seven grandchildren who live in her home. 

She is a merchant who has sold beverages in the informal market, Shoprite, for more than fifteen years. There she ears a sum that she uses for her household expenses. She plans to satisfy her customers by requesting a loan to increase the volume of her business. She will acquire chicks, feed, and vitamins. This is her eighth loan with Hluvuku. 

In the future she plans to expand her homes and ensure that her children get a superior level of education.

loans.use: to acquire chicks, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is 28 years old, married with three children aged between 3 and 8 years old. They all go to school. She sells clothes while her husband is a businessman. With the loan, she would like to buy more trousers and t-shirts to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children, buy food for home consumption and for savings.

loans.use: to buy more trousers and t-shirts to sell.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine, aged 33 years, is married with 2 children aged 10 and 13, who go to school. She sells vegetables and has been in a business for 14 years. Her husband is a local constructor. With the loan, she would like to buy more tomatoes, cabbages and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house for business. In future, she plans to be wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, cabbages and beans to sell.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 35 years old. He is married with four children aged between two and 13. Three of them go to school. He owns a mini market and has been in business for four years. His wife is a businesswoman.

With the loan, he would like to buy items such as milk, cake and sugar to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In future, he wishes to earn at least 100,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: to buy items such as milk, cake and sugar to sell

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 43 years old. She is married with five children aged between six and 17. They all go to school. She sells vegetables and has been in business for six years. Her husband is an entrepreneur.

With the loan, she would like to buy more cabbages, carrots and tomatoes to sell. She will use the profits from the business to improve her welfare and to pay school fees of her school.

loans.use: to buy more cabbages, carrots and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for rent of land.

loans.name: Los Artesanos De Chujulimul L Group

texts.es:
Josefa es una mujer de 35 años de edad está casada, tiene una hija de 10 años que estudia en la escuela de su comunidad, vive junto a su esposo  en Chichicastenango.
Josefa (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía de blusa morada) es una madre de familia muy trabajadora dedicada a su trabajo, ella desde hace 3 años se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica y con los ingresos que genera ayuda a su esposo al mantenimiento de  su casa. Ella ahora quiere mejorar la calidad de sus trajes pero lamentablemente ella no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder hacerlo, pero Josefa es una mujer que lucha por prosperar y busca la manera de cómo hacerlo ahora ella ha decidido juntar a un grupo de personas que también tienen la misma visión de superación para solicitar un prestamo que lo utilizaran para comprar una diversidad de hilos para elaborar los mejores trajes de Chichicastenango. 
El sueño de Josefa es poder tener algún día una tienda donde ella pueda exhibir sus trajes que con tanto amor elabora todos los días.
texts.en:
Josefa is a 35-year-old woman who is married and has a ten-year-old daughter who goes to school in her community. She lives with her husband in Chichicastenango.

Josefa (the one on the left in the photo, with the purple shirt) is a very hard-working mother, who is committed to her work. For three years she has been making traditional clothing and with her income, she helps her husband support the household. She wants to improve the quality of her outfits, but unfortunately she does not have enough money to do so. 

Josefa is a woman who strives to succeed and she finds a way to do it. She has decided to assemble a group of people, who have the same vision of improvement, to ask for a loan that they will use to buy an assortment of thread to make the best outfits in Chichicastenango.

Josefa's dream is to be able to have a store one day, where she can showcase the outfits that she makes each day, with so much love.

loans.use: to buy thread.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en: Epiphanie is 43 years old. She is married with four children aged between two and 18. Three of them go to school. She owns a bar and has been in business for nine years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beer to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Serapio

texts.es:
Serapio tienen 49 años de edad es casado, tiene una linda familia de 9 hijos de las edades de entre 1 y 25 años, vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Serapio para la generación de sus ingresos él se dedica desde hace 20 años a la compra y venta de cebollas por cuerda, Serapio con el deseo de superación ha tomado la decisión de incrementar su negocio y comprar cebollas fuera de Sololá pero Serapio en este momento no cuenta con el capital suficiente para hacerlo es por ello que solicita un prestamo que lo utiliza para compra más cebollas por cuerdas para luego venderlas.
Serapio tienen las esperanzas puestas en este crédito para poderlo invertirlo en el negocio y así poder generar buenas ganancias y seguir ayudando a sus hijos en la escuela.
texts.en:
Serapio is 49 years old and married. He has a beautiful family of 9 children between the ages of 1 and 25. He lives in the community of Sololá.

For the past 20 years, Serapio has made a living buying and selling onions by the cuerda [plot of land 28 meters square].

With the goal of self-improvement, Serapio has decided to grow his business and buy onions from outside of Sololá, but at this time he does not have the necessary capital. For this reason, he is requesting a loan that he will use to buy more onions by the cuerda which he will later sell.

Serapio has placed his hopes in this loan, wanting to invest it in his business and generate a good income to continue helping his children in school.

loans.use: to buy plots of onions

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is 32 years old and married with three children aged between 6 and 17 years who all go to school. She sells clothes and has been in business for 14 years, while her husband is a businessman. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children, make savings and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Samila

texts.en: Samila is 37 years old and the mother of three children aged between 10 and 17 years old. They all go to school. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children, improve her standard of living and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 25 years old. He is married with two children aged two months and three years. They are too young for school. He sells used metals and has been in business for six years. His wife is a businesswoman.

With the loan, he would like to buy more metals to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a vehicle. In future, he wishes to earn at least 100,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: to buy more metals to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn Gabriela

texts.es:
El cantón El Carmen llamado así en honor de la Virgen del Carmen. Posee una considerable riqueza en flora y fauna, siendo una de las fuentes principales de ingreso el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete, que es la principal fuente de ingresos en el cantón. Aquí  se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo  De Crédito Redimidos.
En este lugar vive la señora Evelyn, tiene 26 años de edad y es madre soltera de dos  hijos, uno de 5 años y un bebé de seis meses de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. Ella vive en casa propia.
Doña Evelyn es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica a la venta de perfumes, bisutería, maquillajes y otros productos que le envían de los estados Unidos. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, sus productos se venden muy rápidos  ya que son muy buenos, de esta forma ella logra sus ingresos para el sustento diario.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas  y cosméticos de estados Unidos, ya tiene algunos pedidos por entregar. Tiene un año en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los créditos que tienen interese bien bajos. Sus sueños son tener una familia unida y feliz, y crecer con su negocio.
texts.en:
The canton El Carmen is named in honour of the Virgin of Carmen.  It has considerable richness in flora and fauna.  The principal source of income in the canton is the cultivation of “Barraganete” bananas. It is in this canton that the members of the “Grupo De Credito Redimidos” meet every fifteen days.

Senora Evelyn lives here.  She is 26 years old and is a single mother of two children, one of whom is 5 years old and the other is a six-month-old baby.  The older child is in school.  Evelyn lives in her own home.

Evelyn is a homemaker who, in order to obtain her own funds and be able to support her children, works at selling perfumes, costume jewelry, make-up and other products that come from the United States.  Her form of selling is door-to-door.  She works three days a week from two to three hours a day.  She sells her products on credit and collects payments every eight days.  She has been working at this for two years and it is going very well.  Her products sell very rapidly since they are very good.  In this way she achieves income for her daily household needs.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics from the United States.  She already has some requests for delivery.  She has been with the “Grupo De Credito” for one year and she likes it because the loans have low interest rates.  

Her dream is to have a close-knit, happy family and to have her business grow.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics

loans.name: Violette

texts.en:
Violette is 36 years old. She is married with three children between the ages of two and eight. Two of them go to school. She owns a shop and has been in business for three years. Her husband is a farmer.

With the loan, she would like to buy more items such as rice, sugar and salt to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In future, she aims to earn at least 200,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: to buy more items such as rice, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is 30 years old. He owns a shop and he has been in business for twelve years. With the loan, he would like to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house. In the future he wishes to earn at least 90,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Joana

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 49 anos de idade, viúva mãe de 6 filhos dos quais um menor de idade responsabiliza-se pelos 8 netos que vivem em sua casa. 
É agricultora a mais de 10 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com o valor solicitado pretende adquirir acessórios para a sua viatura como pneus, tintas para pintura da sua viatura. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende adquirir outra viatura de preferência camioneta para o escoamento de produtos na machamba. O seu maior desafio é manter o seu negócio da machamba como uma actividade sustentável.
texts.en:
Born in the Namaacha province of Maputo, she is 49 years old and is a widow. She is also the mother of six children, two of whom are minors. She is responsible for her eight grandchildren who live in her home. 

She has been a farmer for more than ten years and earns a sum that she uses for her household expenses. With the sum she has requested, she plans to acquire parts for her car, such as tires and paint to paint her car. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku. 

In the future she plans to acquire another car, preferably a truck, to transport farm products. Her biggest challenge is maintaining her farming business as a sustainable occupation.

loans.use: to acquire parts for her car, such as tires and paint to paint her car.

loans.name: Lize

texts.pt:
Nasceu  província de Maputo tem 46 anos de idade, solteira mãe de 2 filhos maiores de idade, responsabiliza-se pelos seus afilhados que vivem na casa vizinha.
É avicultora a mais de 8 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com o emprestimo pretende adquirir pinto, ração e vitaminas para ampliar seu negócio.
Futuramente pretende ampliar o seu negócio e iniciar uma obra de construção de uma dependência em sua casa. O seu maior desafio é manter o seu negócio sustentável para responder os encargos incluindo o pagamento de crédito
texts.en:
Born in the province of Maputo, she is 46 years old and single. She is the mother of two adult children and she is responsible for her godchildren who live in the house next door.

She has been a farmer for more than eight years and earns a sum that she uses for her household expenses. With this loan she plans to acquire chicks, feed, and vitamins to expand her business.

In the future she plans to expand her business and start construction on the home of one of her dependents. Her biggest challenge is maintaining a sustainable business in order to meet her responsibilities including the payment of this loan.

loans.use: to acquire chicks, feed, and vitamins to expand her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 56 years old. She is married with three children who are between 14 and 18 years old. They all go to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been in business for 10 years. Her husband is a farmer.

With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, sorghum and local juice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house. In future, she wishes to earns at least 150,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: to buy more beans, sorghum and local juice to sell.

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en:
Claudette is 33 years old. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 6 and 13 years. All of her children go to school.  

Claudette is a tailor, and she has been running her business for 6 years now. With her loan, she would like to buy a location for her business.

The profits from Claudette's business will be used to pay her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to earn at least 100,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: to buy a location for her business.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is 34 years old. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 3 and 12 years. 

Her husband is a businessman while Eugenie owns a mini market and has been running this business for 4 years. With the loan she has requested, she would like to buy different items to sell in her market such as water, soda, snacks, and bread. 

The profits from Eugenie's business will be used to buy a house. In the future she plans to earn at least 3 times what she currently earns with her business.

loans.use: to buy different items such as water, soda, snacks, and bread to sell.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is 42 years old. He is a farmer by nature, and he has worked as a manager on different farms.  Today, thanks to the coming of Kiva lenders and Juhudi Kilimo to his territory, he can dream and aspire to better things for his wife and their children. Christopher is an accomplished farmer from the Litein area of Kenya and commands a lot of respect. He loves and cherishes his family. Christopher and his wife work as a team, supporting each other, and have practiced mixed farming for the past five years. Christopher often says, “I have always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in my blood.” Because of the liking that he has for farming, he has even nicknamed one of his cows, which makes him a very proud farmer, especially when he is milking his cows. From his dairy cow, he is able to get between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day, and this helps him support his family. Christopher also practices crop farming, but he has not been making good profits because of poor farming inputs; that is why he is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. Through the loan, he will be able to buy high quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that he will use to greatly improve his crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques and therefore, using high-quality seeds will assure him of a bumper harvest and increased profit levels. Christopher is very visionary, and his goal for the season is to boost his crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through the lenders’ help and goodwill. Christopher believes that through the loan, he will turn around his family life and be able to give his children a solid education background. This loan will be Christopher’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy high quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that he will use to greatly improve his crop production.

loans.name: Pamie

texts.en:
This is Pamie, 52, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Euberto and a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Pamie operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. 

Pamie dreams that her business will become more established for she desires to help her extended family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional raw materials and supplies she needs to improve her service and earn more.

loans.name: Pheliwe

texts.en:
Pheliwe is a single mother of three: a boy age 19, and two girls ages 14 and 2. 

The 37-year-old distributes health care products to small retailers across Johannesburg.  

She is requesting a loan to buy additional health products to resell. Pheliwe has a wide natural healthcare market and can barely meet the number of orders placed by clients. 

With the loan, she will be able to efficiently meet demands and satisfy her ever-growing client base. Her aspiration is to see people healed and healthy and hopes to one day open a health club.

loans.use: To buy additional health products for resale

loans.name: Fani

texts.es:
La Señora Fani es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, es casada, tiene una familia formada, comenta que tiene un ciber cafe hace trabajos de impresión, trabajos prácticos, proyectos, tesis etc., comenta que se esfuerza con su marido, y que ambos luchan por poder salir adelante.
Ella está esforzándose para que cada día tenga un mejor ingreso, para poder ayudar a su familia y seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de impresoras para poder usarlas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Fani is from the city of San Ignacio. She is married and has a family. She mentions that she has a cyber cafe and does printing jobs like course work, projects, and theses, etc. She says that she and her husband work hard and both of them fight to be able to get ahead.

She is working hard so that each day she has a better income to be able to help her family and loved ones.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of printers to be able to use them in her business.

loans.use: to buy printers for her cyber cafe.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a married woman with four children. They live in a house with five rooms in Bamenda, North West Region in Cameroon. She has faced some problems in life and so this has hindered her a lot. These range from the deaths of her parents, ill health, the taste of poverty and poor sales, not withstanding the loss of her only son.

The new loan she has gone in for is to be used for her restaurant business, to buy raw food items like rice, beans, corn, cocoyams, cassava, vegetables, Maggi seasoning, salt, and banana and palm wines. She is so optimistic that she will succeed because she has run the business for quite some time, and she believes she cooks good food. The community will benefit from this activity in that the people will have delicious food at cheaper prices. She has also trained neighbors in how to run restaurant businesses.

The profit from this loan will be used to increase the size of the business, raise the standards of her family's well-being, and provide for her children's school fees and medication.

She prefers a loan from Ghape because of low interest rates; they also teach how to manage your business capital for success. She also benefits from the ideas exchanged through their bimonthly and monthly meetings, coupled with so much social networking during the meetings.

loans.use: to buy raw food items like rice, beans, corn, cocoyams, cassava, vegetables, Maggi seasoning, salt, and banana and palm wines.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a mother with 3 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old, and all of her 3 children are in school.

Rosemarie has a buy-and-sell coconut business in the Philippines. She has requested a 6,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy additional supplies of coconuts to sell.

Rosemarie has been running her business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a 40-year-old married woman with two children, who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur in the Philippines, and her business is food vending.

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lilibeth has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 54 years old and widowed with four children.

Mary Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like bags, underwear, etc.

Mary Ann has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional income from bicycle transport.

Mary Ann aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like bags and underwear

loans.name: Hyacenth

texts.en:
Hyacenth is 34 years old. She is married with three children who are between eight and 10 years old. They both go to school. She owns a shop and has been in business for five years. Her husband is a businessman.

With the loan, she would like to buy more items such as sugar, salt and soap to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land. In future, she wishes to earn at least 200,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: to buy more items such as sugar, salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 31-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a retail shop, selling items like sugar, soap, beers and sodas, among other things. He faces challenges of low capital, which hinder the progress of his business. However, he has hopes of becoming a wholesaler in his area. Stephen has asked for a loan to buy sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 30 years old. He is married with two children, aged seven and nine, who both go to school. He owns a shop and has been in business for eight years. His wife is a businesswoman.

With the loan, he would like to buy more items such as rice, salt and maize flour to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house. In future, he wishes to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy more items such as rice, salt and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 31 years old. She is married with one child, who is four years old and goes to school. She owns a shop and has been in business for two years. Her husband is a local constructor. With the loan, she would like to buy more items such as soap, Colgate and books to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build her house.

loans.use: to buy more items such as soap, Colgate and books to sell.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en: Forty-nine-year-old Chanthy is living in a rural village in Keo Seima district, Mondulkiri province. She is married and has three children. One of her children is her dependent because he is still in secondary school. To earn a living, Chanthy has been managing a small food stall at home for the last 13 years. Chanthy is a new member of VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Leading her group, she is requesting a 1,000,000 KHR loan for herself in order to buy ingredients and equipment for her stall. She hopes that her business will keep growing and provide her with more income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and equipment for her stall

loans.name: Rufina

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Província de Inhambane, tem 42 anos de idade solteira mãe de 3 filhos dos quais 2 maiores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua neta que vive em sua casa.
Trabalha  num estabelecimento hoteleiro a mais de 8 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com o valor solicitado pretende dar continuidade a sua obra de residência adquirindo material construção como areia, cimento e varões. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende erguer uma dependência para aluguer e garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
Born in the province of Inhambane, she is 42 years old and single. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are adults, and all of them go to school. She is responsible for her granddaughter who lives in her home. 

She has worked in a hotel establishment for more than eight years where she receives a sum that she uses for her household expenses. With the sum she has requested she plans to continue construction on her home by purchasing construction materials like sand, cement, and rods. This is her fifth loan with Hluvuku.

In the future she plans to support a dependent by hiring them and guarantee a superior level of education for two of her children.

loans.use: to acquire construction materials like sand, cement, and rods. This is her fifth loan with Hluvuku.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 6 children and 4 go to school. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.

She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last seven years; she works seven days a week. Mariam has requested a loan of 800,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, flour, rice, cooking oil, peas, and beans.

Mariam's major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university level.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, flour, rice, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional  items to sell like canned goods, coffee, bread, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare his garden and weed his maize.

loans.name: Ma. Liza Lorena

texts.en:
Ma. Liza Lorena is 46 years old and married with nine children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Liza Lorena runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for two years now. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, groceries, etc.

In the future, Ma. Liza Lorena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 48 years old and married with seven children. With four children in school, Susana works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, liquor, groceries, etc.

Susana has been in this business for two years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, liquor, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Tholean's Group

texts.en:
A Prey Prorsorb District villager, Tholean is a 65-year-old divorcee with five children. One of her children is living with her. To support the family, Tholean has been a rice farmer for 38 years. She is also a paid-worker to earn extra income. She manages to earn 5 USD per day. 

This is her second time being a member with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. Leading her group, she is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Cambodia Riel (KHR) for her rice farm. She plans to buy fertilizer and rice seeds. She hopes that her rice farm will produce a higher yield that last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a widow with three children, and they live in a one room house in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced some problems in her life and so this has hindered her a lot ranging from no concern shown by family members after the death of the husband, ill health, and also poor sales.

The new loan will help Racheal to buy items like rice, beans, corn, cocoyam (taro), Irish potatoes, shoes and firewood for sale. Also she will buy charcoal to roast fish for sale. She is optimistic that she will succeed because she has run the business for quite some time, and the demand for firewood is so high.

The community will benefit from this activity in that the people will have ready food items while maintaining the essence of protein through roasted fish. They will also have wood at cheaper prices.

The profit from this loan will be used to increase the size of the business, raise the standards of family well being by building a house, and provide for children's school fees.

Racheal prefers a loan from Ghape because they give out money at very low interest rates with convenient repayment duration; they also teach how to manage your capital for success in business. They also benefit from the ideas exchanged through their weekly and monthly meetings not leaving out the fact that they do follow ups for proper utilization.

loans.use: to buys items like rice, beans, corn, cocoyam, Irish potatoes, shoes and firewood for sale as well as charcoal needed for her fish roasting business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 44 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos. Se dedica a la costura de prendas de vestir y de todo tipo, hace 20 años aproximadamente que realiza sus costuras de propia producción y también servicios de costura para particulares por pedido.
Norma es una persona que se esforzó cada día para poder ir mejorando su vida y poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de telas, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones.
texts.en:
Norma is 44 years old, married, and has 2 children. She works making clothing of all sorts, she has been making her own clothing designs for approximately 20 years, and also provides sewing services for individual orders.

Norma is a person who works hard every day to be able to improve her life and to be able to help her family.

She asks for this loan to purchase fabric, so that she is able to continue with her designs.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23 year old single man from Nablus city. He lives with his family in a simple house. His father has a blacksmith workshop where he earns unstable income due to the demand.

Mohammad is a student in a local university where he studies Economics. He wants to find a job soon and help his family in part of their expenses.

He has taken a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Mohammad to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to pay the high cost of his study.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is an 18-year-old, single man from a village near Nablus city. He lives with his family in a simple house. He is an employee in a hotel where he gets a low income. Mohammad is also a student in a local university where he studies science. He wants to find a job soon and help his family in part of their expenses.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to pay the high cost of his studies.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Imad Eddin

texts.en:
Imad Eddin is 23 years old and single and is from a village near Jerusalem city. He lives with his family in a simple house. His father works as an employee for a local company where he earns a low income. Imad Eddin is a student at a local university where he studies developmental science. He wants to find a job soon and help his family with their expenses.
Imad Eddin took a USD loan from FATEN to help him pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Imad Eddin will be able to continue his studies. He appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with seven children. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 10 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,700,000 Ugandan shillings to buy cooking oil, peas, flour, beans, sweet potatoes and bunches of green bananas. Her major challenge includes seasonality of food. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a refrigerator to start selling cold drinks. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, peas, rice, sweet potatoes, flour, beans, and bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Brenda Marisela

texts.es:
El cantón El Carmen llamado así en honor de la Virgen del Carmen. Posee una considerable riqueza en flora y fauna, siendo una de las fuentes principales de ingreso el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete, que es la principal fuente de ingresos en el cantón. Aquí  se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo  De Crédito Redimidos.
En este lugar vive la señora Brenda, tiene 34 años de edad y es madre soltera de tres  hijos, dos de 15 años 	que son mellizos y uno de 10 años de edad, los mayores  estudian en colegio  y  el menor en escuela. Ella vive en casa de sus padres.
Doña Brenda es una mujer que le gusta ganarse lo suyo para así contribuir con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos ya que es madre y padre a la vez, ella se dedica a la cría de aves de corral en una pequeña granja en su casa,  en temporadas compra una gran cantidad de pollos los cuales los cría durante dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, después de este tiempo los entrega a algunas tiendas en la localidad o también vende por libras por su casa,  lleva más de 8 años dedicada a esta labor con la cual se gana la vida.
Este nuevo crédito es para comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para pollos. Es socia nueva  en el Grupo De Crédito  y está muy contenta porque los intereses son bajos. Sus sueños son tener una granja mucho más grande.
texts.en:
El Carmen Canton, named in honor of the Virgin of Carmen, has considerable wealth of flora and fauna. Its principal source of income is cultivating plantains of the Barraganete variety. Here, every 15 days, members of the Redeemed Credit Group meet.

Brenda resides here. She is 34 years old and the single mother of three children, two of whom are twins, 15 years of age, while one is 10 years old. The older two study at a colegio and the younger studies in a public school. Brenda lives in her parents house. 

Brenda is a woman who likes to earn her own way, to contribute to paying family expenses, and for her children's studies, since she is mother and father at the same time. She raises farm fowl on a small plot at her house. In season, she purchases a large quantity of chicks, then raises them for two to three months, the time needed to get them ready for sale. After this, Brenda delivers them to some of the stores in the locality, or sells them by the pound at her house. She has done this there for over eight years.

This new loan is for purchasing chicks, chicken feed and medicines for her chickens. Brenda is a new member of this Credit Group, and she is quite content because interest rates are very low. Her dream is to have a much larger farm.

loans.use: buy chickens, feed and medicines for her chickens.

loans.name: Jahaira María

texts.es:
El cantón El Carmen llamado así en honor de la Virgen del Carmen. Posee una considerable riqueza en flora y fauna, siendo una de las fuentes principales de ingreso el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete, que es la principal fuente de ingresos en el cantón. Aquí  se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo  De Crédito Redimidos.
En este lugar vive la señorita Jahaira, tiene 35  años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de una tía.
Doña Jahaira trabaja como  asistente doméstica en casa de su tía por lo cual le pagan un sueldo mensual pero para generar más ingresos también se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa por catálogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Sale a vender sus productos en sus ratos desocupados y fines de semana que no labora en casa de la tía, deja a  crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 1 año con esta actividad con la cual se gana algo extra.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de catálogos. Lleva  2 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por el apoyo que le han brindado con los créditos. Le gustaría tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
El Carmen subdivision, named after the Virgin of  El Carmen, has a rich fauna and flora. The main occupation that generates income is the cultivation of the Barraganete bananas.

The members of the Redimido group loan meet every two weeks there. Jahaira lives there. She is 35 years old, single, and has no children. She lives in her aunt's home. Jahaira works as a house maid at her aunt's. She gets paid a monthly salary, but to make more money she does business selling clothes through catalogs, and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories).

She sales her products in her spare time, and during the weekends when she doesn't work. She grants credit, and gets paid every eight days.

She is being doing this for a year, and that is how she makes some extra money. 

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and catalog clothing. She is been a member of the loan group for two years, and she likes it because the help she gets through the loans. 

She would like to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and clothes.

loans.name: Hector Daniel

texts.es:
El cantón El Carmen  llamado así en honor de la Virgen del Carmen. Posee una considerable riqueza en flora y fauna, siendo una de las fuentes principales de ingreso el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete, que es la principal fuente de ingresos en el cantón. Aquí  se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo  De Crédito Redimidos.
En este lugar vive don Héctor, tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre, no tiene hijos. La mujer tiene un local de alquiler de trajes típicos.
El señor Hector es un hombre muy trabajador que le gusta a base de esfuerzo salir adelante, el se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta las 18h00,  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. El hace tiempo tenía un kiosco en el cual vendía hamburguesas, papas fritas, etc.  Con este crédito va a volver a instalar este kiosco para mejora sus ingresos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y víveres para las comidas rápidas y también es para pagar por los arreglos del kiosco. Lleva dos ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por las facilidades que les brindan en la institución. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia ya que viven alquilando.
texts.en:
The canton of El Carmen, named in honor of the Virgen del Carmen, has a considerable richness of flora and fauna, and one of the principal sources of income is the cultivation of Barraganete variety bananas, which is the principal source of income in the canton. Here, the members of the Redimidos communal bank group meet every two weeks. 

Héctor lives in this place. He is 35 years old and is in a common-law marriage and doesn't have any children. His wife has a space where she rents traditional outfits.

Héctor is a very hard-working man who likes to get ahead by his efforts. He works selling all sorts of clothing, and sells from door to door, and also from his house where he has a small retail space.  He works every day from 8:00 to 18:00; he leaves his items on credit with his customers and collects every two weeks. Some time ago, he had a stall where he sold hamburgers, french fries, etc. With this loan, he will open this stall again to increase his income. 

This loan is to purchase clothing and groceries for fast food and also to pay for repairs on the stall. He has been in the communal bank group for two loan cycles and he likes it for the terms the institution offers. His dreams are to have his own house since they are now renting.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, groceries, and to pay for repairs of the stall.

loans.name: Telma Martina

texts.es:
El cantón El Carmen llamado así en honor de la Virgen del Carmen. Posee una considerable riqueza en flora y fauna, siendo una de las fuentes principales de ingreso el cultivo del plátano de la variedad Barraganete, que es la principal fuente de ingresos en el cantón. Aquí  se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo  De Crédito Redimidos.
En este lugar vive la señora Telma, tiene 57  años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre, ella  tuvo dos hijos de otra relación anterior los mismos que ya son mayores de edad  e independientes, con ella vive también su mamá. Su marido es comerciante.
Doña Telma es una mujer trabajadora que siempre le ha gustado ganarse lo suyo para el bien de su familia, ella tiene un almacén en el cual  alquilan trajes para eventos para damas, caballeros  o niños, ella cuanta con muchos trajes para cualquier compromiso social, trabaja todos los días  desde la 8:30 hasta las 20h00, su negocio tiene mucha clientela ya que siempre mantiene trajes a la moda y a gusto de sus clientes a quienes los asesora para que escojan lo mejor, su mamá y el esposo le ayudan en la atención a los clientes, de esta forma ella se gana la vida honradamente.
Este crédito es para comprar  trajes para renovar los que ya tiene ya que necesita incrementar nuevos  modelos. Este es  su tercer ciclo en el Grupo  De Crédito  y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños es mejorar el negocio.
texts.en:
The canton of El Carmen, named in honor of Our Lady of Carmen, has a considerable richness of flora and fauna, and one of the principal sources of income is the cultivation of Barraganete variety bananas, which is the principal source of income in the canton. Here, the members of the Redimidos communal bank group meet every two weeks. 

Telma lives in this place. She is 57 years old and is in a common-law marriage. She had two children in a previous relationship and they are now adults and independent. Her mother also lives with her. Her husband is a businessman.

Telma is a hard-working woman who always has liked to earn her own living for the good of her family. She has a shop where they rent outfits for events for women, men, or children. She has many outfits for whatever social event. She works every day from 8:30 to 20:00. Her business has many customers since she has fashionable outfits to her customers' taste, who she advises so they pick the best ones. Her mother and her husband help her serve the customers. In this way, she earns an honest living. 

This loan is to purchase outfits to update those she already has since she need to increase her new fashions. This is her third loan cycle with the communal bank group and she likes it for the help that the loans offer. Her dreams are to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase outfits.

loans.name: Joweriah

texts.en:
Joweriah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 6 children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. 

Joweriah sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 6 years, working 7 days a week. She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO in order to buy bags of charcoal to sell. 

Joweriah's major challenges include seasonal demand and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to the university level. 

Joweriah lives in a rented house where she and her family have access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is married with four children, and all of them go to school. She has additional family members. She operates a restaurant on a retail basis at the market. She has been in this business for 5 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda Shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy flour, beans, cooking oil, cassava and sweet potatoes. 

She works for seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to buy a plot of land in the future. 

She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because the organization gives timely loans. She lives in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: to buy flour, beans, cooking oil, cassava and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Marilou works hard to support her family.

She has a mat weaving business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Marilou is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her mat weaving business.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for mat weaving

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 50 years old and has three children. Flora is a married woman.

Flora is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Flora requested a 5,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Flora has been in this business for 26 years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Flora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is so pleased that she has chance to cooperate with Kiva and Nor Horizon one more time. Her first loan was very helpful for her farm. She built a new barn for her cattle and bought a lot of fodder for the animals. Svetlana lives in the village of Zovaber, in the Gegharkunik region. She remains busy with her farm, raising cows, heifers, pigs, sheep, lambs and chickens. She also manages her cultivated land, harvesting greens, potatoes, tomatoes and peppers which she sells right from her house.  Farming got her used of working all day long and overcoming hardships. She is ready to develop her farm more and more with great hopes of providing her family members with better living conditions.
This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams will help Svetlana buy diesel fuel, potato seedlings for spring sowing and fodder for her cattle.

loans.use: to buy diesel fuel, potato seedlings for spring sowing and fodder for her cattle

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lucila works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Lucila is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

Lucila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is an ambitious man and looks to a future when he is the leading supplier of milk in his area. He's working 12 to 14 hours a day to fulfill his dream. Nathan lives with his wife and says that they only want to have more children when they are sure that they can raise them without worrying about where their next meal will come from or that the children would be forced to leave school because they can't provide for them.

Nathan owns a small plot of inherited land on which he has been practicing mixed farming for more than five years. He grows a variety of crops and keeps dairy cows and poultry. The income he makes from selling milk, eggs and crops is insufficient to meet his family's expenses. He needs to improve his income level, and that is why he is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow.

Nathan passionately loves dairy farming and, as he likes to put it, “dairy farming is close to my heart.” He plans to buy not just an ordinary cow but a quality breed of cow that will produce between 10-20 litres of milk a day. The additional milk will result in additional income and hence improved living conditions.

The income generated from selling the milk will be used to fully repay the loan and will also go towards the education of his children. He will also benefit from cow manure, which will be used to increase the fertility level of his farm, hence increasing productivity. Through the loan he will also be able to build a biogas digester that will be helpful in saving energy. This loan will completely change his life and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 34-year-old married man who has a poultry farm that generates income for his family. He bought a motorcycle for a transport business to supplement the proceeds from the poultry project. Moses hoped to expand his business and also start up a dairy farm for more income generation, only to be challenged by the high prices of poultry feeds. He needs a credit facility to buy poultry feeds.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds.

loans.name: Buuma Group

texts.fr: Muhindo est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Buuma», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 56 ans, mère 4 enfants dont 1 étudie et 3 sont déjà mariés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des poissons salés  dans le marché central de la ville depuis 25 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en poissons. Elle souhaite accroitre son chiffre d’affaires et scolariser son enfant. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Muhindo is a trader and a member of the credit group "Buuma", client of the IMF Hekima.  She is a widow, aged 56, mother of 4 children, of whom 1 is studying and 3 are already married.  

She started her business with funds received from her husband.  She has been selling salt fish in the town's central market for 25 years.  She is going to stock up with fish.

She hopes to grow her turnover and educate her child.  To finish, she thanks Hekima for the care given to entrepreneurs who cannot access banks.

loans.use: to stock up with fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Santa

texts.es:
Santa es una mujer muy amable y perseverante ella tiene 32 años de edad vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Sololá.
Santa es una mujer que desde muy joven se a dedicado al negocio pues toda su familia se dedica al comercio, ella para generar sus ingresos desde hace 2 años tiene una tienda donde vende todo tipo de producto, pues a ella le ha ayudado mucho este negocio porque  pude cuidar su tienda y realizar otras actividades, para santa este negocio es tan importante pues es su fuente de ingreso es por eso que ella a decidió incrementar este negocio con el afán de superarse pues ella aún no cuenta con familia propia, pero una de las dificultades de santa es que  no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poderlo hacer lo es por eso que  ahora esta solicitando un prestamo que lo utilizara para la compra de abarrotes tales como: huevo, arroz, refrescos, golosinas y muchas otras cosas más.
El sueño de santa es poder contar con este prestamo para poder hacer de su negocio más grande y seguir obteniendo buenas ganancias  y con ello poder comprar un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Santa is a very kind and persevering woman.  She is 32 years old, and she lives with her parents in the community of Solola. 

Ever since she was very young, Santa has worked in business, because her whole family is engaged in commerce.  In order to generate income, she has had a store for 2 years where she sells all types of products.  This has helped her a lot, because she has been able to tend to her store and also carry out other activities.  For Santa, this business is very important as it is her source of income.  This is why she decided to expand the business, as she has a desire to excel, as she does not yet have her own family.  But one of the difficulties she faces is a lack of capital.  This is why she is requesting a loan to buy groceries such as: eggs, rice, drinks, snacks, sweets, and many other items.

Santa's dream is to be able to grow her business with this loan so that she can continue to generate good earnings.  With her earnings she wants to buy some land where she can build a house.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is married with four children and lives in a six-room house in Bamenda North West, region of Cameroon. She is very confident that her business will be successful because she has grasped knowledge about her trading business. She had booming sales during Christmas and benefited from the strategic location of the business. The loan from GHAPE will be used to purchase dresses and shoes as well as poultry and seedlings like high grade corn, beans, cassava, plantains and coco yams. The community will benefit by buying dresses, shoes and raw food items after harvest at cheaper prices. With the profit from the business, Mercy will be able to expand her business, educate her children, look after her health situation, and also cater to the needs of her family. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because it has low interest rates and a new loan can be given as soon as she completes the old one. Also, GHAPE offers non-financial services that includes training and social networking

loans.use: To purchase dresses ands hoes, poultry, and seedlings like high grade corn, beans, cassava, plantains and coco yams

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts, tee shirts, pants, and other clothes.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn runs her sari-sari store in her village. She has been in this type of business for three years. Evelyn sells a variety of grocery items such as breads, noodles, condiments, and drinks. Just like others, Evelyn usually uses her income from the business to meet her family''s needs. Her income also serves to sustain her children's allowances when sending them to school. Now, Evelyn wants to maintain the business and extend the products she sells to increase her income. Hence, she is requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy beverages, powdered milk, canned goods, and coffee. Evelyn hopes to grow the business and invest in other sources of income.

loans.use: to buy beverages, powdered milk, canned goods, and coffee.

loans.name: Mubatiki Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is in her late 40s, married, and has seven children who are all attending school. For the past six years, Elizabeth has been raising and selling chickens and their eggs. She works from 6 am to 6 pm daily and earns a fair monthly profit for her family. 

This is Elizabeth's first loan from Tujijenge. She plans to use it to make her business bigger and better. She hopes this loan will help her earn more profit so she can get closer to achieving her dream of starting another business selling fish. 

Elizabeth will share this loan with her loan group, Mubtiki, which consists of five women who will hold each other responsible for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To improve her business raising and selling chickens

loans.name: T´mixe Group

texts.es:
T´Mixe significa pozo en lengua mazahua. Las integrantes decidieron usar ese nombre ya que representa el lugar de donde obtienen el agua que es fundamental para sus hogares. 

Ellas se conocen desde hace varios años, se apoyan en cualquier situación y son mujeres dedicadas a su familia. Para obtener un poco más de ingresos cada una de ellas desempeña una actividad y necesitan invertir en ellas: Ma de los Ángeles invertirá en su molino; María Luciana, en su tienda de abarrotes; María Albina, Máxima, Ma Francisca y Leticia, en borregos. 

Por su parte, Doña Juana está solicitando el préstamo para comprar las refacciones de su taxi. Ella tiene 46 años de edad, está casada con Sebastián y tiene cinco hijos de los cuales ya solo dos mujeres dependen de ellos: una estudia la preparatoria y otra su carrera profesional.

La idea del servicio de taxi surgió a partir de su propia necesidad. En la comunidad donde anteriormente vivía Doña Juana sólo había un autobús que pasaba dos veces al día y endendía las dificultades que todos sus vecinos enfrentaban con esta falta de transporte. Juana lleva ya varios ciclos solicitando préstamo a VisioFund México, las primeras inversiones las utilizó para criar borregos y con sus ganancias pudo comprar un vehículo de modelo antiguo para usar como taxi. Tiempo después, incluso también compró un auto de modelo reciente. “Todo esto lo logramos gracias al esfuerzo y dedicación de mi esposo que maneja el taxi pero también al apoyo de VisionFund". 

Mientras Don Sebastián trabaja en el taxi  todos los días, en casa Doña Juana se dedica a criar sus borregos y vender productos naturistas para continuar apoyando a sus hijas, pues su más grande sueño es que terminen la universidad y tengan mejores oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
T' Mixe means “well” in the Mazahua language.  The members decided to use this name since it represents the place where they obtain water which is fundamental for their homes.

They have known each other for various years.  They support each other in whatever situation arises and they are women who are dedicated to their families.  In order to obtain a bit more income, each one of them carries out an occupation that they need to invest in:  Ma de los Angeles will invest in her mill; Maria Luciana in her grocery store; Maria Albina, Maxima, Ma Francisca and Leticia in lambs.

For her part, Juana is asking for a loan to buy replacement parts for her taxi. She is 46 years old, married to Sebastian and has five children of which only two depend on them--one daughter who is studying in high school and the other who is studying for her professional degree. 

The idea of a taxi service came up out of necessity. In the community where Juana used to live there was only one bus that came by twice a day and she understood the difficulties that confronted all her neighbours due to this lack of transportation.  Juana has had several loan cycles with VisionFund Mexico.  The first investments she used to raise lambs and with her earnings she was able to buy an old-model vehicle to use as a taxi.  A while later, she even also bought a recent model car.  “All of this we achieved thanks to the efforts and dedication of my husband who drives the taxi but also with the help of VisionFund.”

While Sebastian works with the taxi every day, at home Juana works at raising lambs and selling natural products in order to continue supporting her daughters.  Her greatest dream is that they complete university and have better work opportunities.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for her taxi

location.town: San Lucas, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines.

Lilia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell.

Lilia has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en: Immaculate is a 45-year-old hardworking lady with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a beauty salon and at the same time, owns rental houses that add more income. She is faced with the challenge of low capital that hinders her progress in business. However, she hopes to educate all her children to higher levels of learning. Immaculate needs a loan to buy relaxers and braids to use in her salon.

loans.use: to buy relaxers and braids to use in her salon.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru:
Фируза молодая и энергичная женщина 34 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей.Её мужа зовут Мусо. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина, любит семью и старается для семейного благополучия. Её муж сотрудничает  с МДО Арванд с 2011 года.
В данное время Фируза вместе со своим мужем хотят отремонтировать дом, где они живут, чтобы улучшить условия для проживания. Но собственных средств у них недостаточно. Для этого Фируза обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Она надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Firuza is an energetic young woman, aged 34. She is married and has three children. Her husband's name is Muso. She is a very hardworking woman who loves her family and tries hard to take care of them. Her husband has been collaborating with MDO Arvand since 2011. 

Firuza and her husband want to renovate their home to improve their living conditions, but they do not have enough money.  Firuza applied for a loan with Arvand to buy building materials to renovate their house. She hopes for a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Kana Group

texts.fr: Kambale est commerçante, présidente du groupe solidaire «Kana», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée a un chauffeur, âgée de 40 ans, mère 5 enfants, dont 4 étudient et 1 gosse. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse  des huiles au marché de la ville depuis 10 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en  jutes d’huiles de palmes et végétales. Elle  souhaite accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Kambale is a trader and president of the mutual group "Kana", a client of IMF Hekima.  She is married to a driver, aged 40, mother of 5 children of whom 4 are studying and 1 is an infant.

She started her business with funds received from her husband.  She has been selling oils in the tow'sn market for 10 years.  She is going to stock up with sacks of palm and vegetable oil.  

She hopes to increase her turnover, educate and feed her children.  To finish, she thanks Hekima for the care given to entrepreneurs who cannot access banks.

loans.use: to stock up with sacks of palm and vegetable oils

loans.name: Afavo Maendeleo Group

texts.fr: Catherine est commerçante, trésorière du groupe solidaire Afavo Maendeleo, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, divorcée, âgée de 46 ans, mère de 9 enfants tous  scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu  de ses  parents. Elle est propriétaire d’une boutique avec divers articles manufacturés. Elle va acheter les produits cosmétiques, dentifrices, savons, bougies, sardines, biscuits. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, acheter une parcelle, construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish,  elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Catherine is a shopkeeper and treasurer of the mutual group Afavo Maendeleo, client of IMF Hekima.  She is divorced, aged 46 and mother of 9 children, all educated.

She started her business with funds received from her parents.  She owns a shop with a range of manufactured items.  She is going to buy cosmetic products, toothpaste, soap, candles, sardines and biscuits.

She hopes to obtain further loans in order to increase her turnover, buy a plot of land, build a house, educate and feed her children.  To finish, she thanks Hekima for the care they give to entrepreneurs who cannot access banks.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products, toothpaste, soap, candles, sardines and biscuits.

loans.name: Tuğba

texts.en:
Tuğba is single and lives with her mother. She runs a teashop in a passageway in the central market. She used to work in jewelry but there was a lot of competition so it was hard to earn money. She wanted to have a job with regular customers and decided to go into the food industry and bought her teashop. She started with no customers and attracted them by introducing herself. When she first began people said she wouldn’t succeed because her social circle was very small, but she continued working undaunted and determinedly.

She has succeeded after three years. Her customers are increasing. She also began selling grilled cheese, sandwiches and hot food. She wants to buy a dishwasher with the loan. In the future she wants to expand her business and open a café.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
Tuğba Hanım,bekar annesi ile birlikte yaşamakta. Çarşı merkezde pasaj içinde bir çay ocağı işletiyor. Daha önce bijuteri sektöründe çalışan Tuğba hanım, bu işi bir çok kişinin yapmaya başlamasıyla kazancı azalır. Sabit müşterileri olan bir iş düşünmeye başlar ve gıda sektöründe bir iş yapmaya karar verir. Şu an işletmekte olan çay ocağını satın alır. Sıfır müşteri ile işe başlar ve müşterilerini tek tek bizzat dolaşarak kendini tanıtır. İlk başladığında çevresindekiler kendisinin çok küçük olduğunu bu işi başaramayacağını söylerler. Fakat kendisi yılmaz ve azimle çalışmaya devam eder. Üç senede bu işi başarır. Müşterileri artar. İçeceklerin yanında tost,sandviç,sıcak yemeklerde yapıp satmaya başlar. Aldığı kredi ile dükkanına bir bulaşık makinesi almayı düşünüyor. İlerde de işlerini büyütüp cafe açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy a dishwasher

loans.name: Aksante Mungu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kayembe est une commerçante, membre d’une banque communautaire «Aksante Mungu », âgée de 35 ans, mariée à un ajusteur soudeur, mère de 3 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse de divers matériaux de construction dans une avenue animée de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 1000 blocs ciments et briques. Ainsi, elle souhaite acheter un véhicule camionnette pour le transport de sa marchandise, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux femmes entrepreneuses exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
The client, Kayembe is a trader and member of a community bank "Aksante Mungu".  Aged 35, married to a welder metal worker and mother of 3 children, all in school.  
 
She sells a range of construction materials in a busy avenue of the town. She is seeking a loan from Hekima to grow her business.  She will buy 1000 cement blocks and bricks. 

She hopes to buy a van to transport her merchandise, and to educate and feed her children. She thanks Hekims for the care given to women entrepreneurs who are excluded from the classic banking system.

loans.use: To buy 1000 cement blocks and bricks

loans.name: Hanife Reyhan

texts.en:
Hanife, a married mother of two, has been a hairdresserfor 20 years.  After middle school, she wanted to make her own living with a profession that wouldn't require more education, so she took a hairdressing course. She subsequently worked for years as an apprentice.  When her boss decided she was trained, she opened her own salon. Hanife thinks this is a job that will always be required and that one can always make money at it. 

Hanife husband is also a hairdresser, and together they expanded the salon to offer services in new areas. With her second loan, Hanife will buy products for her salon wholesale.  She wants to expand her work further, and hopes to open a full-service beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy products for her salon.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 32-year-old married man from the city of Nablus. He lives with his wife and two daughters in a simple house. He works as an employee in a local company. Maher would like to improve himself by taking a higher education degree, so he registered in the university. He is now a master student in business administration.

Maher took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Maher will be able to pay the high cost of his studies.

Maher appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Kuña Juky Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Juky se formó en la ciudad de Asunción, es un grupo que se esfuerza para poder ir mejorando, y para que por medio del esfuerzo de cada una también vayan ayudando a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Eulalia es una de las integrantes de este grupo, también es la presidenta, es una mujer que se esfuerza siempre por poder crecer y ayudar a su familia, siempre trata de motivar a sus amigas a poder luchar para crecer  y mejorar cada día.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar cosméticos variados, ya que ella se dedica a este trabajo y es con este emprendimiento puede mejorar sus ingresos para ayudar a sus seres queridos. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder ir mejorando cada día.
texts.en:
The Kuña Juky group was formed in the city of Asunción. They strive for self improvement and to help their families as well through each member's individual effort.

Eulalia is one of the members and she is also the president. This is a woman who always makes efforts to improve and help her family, and always seeks to motivate her friends to grow and improve every day.
