She is requesting the loan to buy a selection of cosmetics to sell. She earns a living through this work and with this undertaking she will be able to improve her income as well as help her loved ones.

Eulalia is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to improve every day.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy commodities to sell in her village.

loans.name: Enid

texts.en: Enid is a hardworking widowed woman who needs a credit facility to pay school fees for her children. She lives in the town of Masindi-Uganda with three children and all attend school. Enid used her previous loan to buy clothes to sell during the peak season of Christmas, where she managed to make profits as she fully utilized the available market. She sells clothes and has got rental houses that generate more income to support her family. She wishes to educate her children to University level, however she is challenged by inadequate capital alongside constant changes in fashions and designs.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Zula

texts.en:
Zula lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and three of her children are in school. She has no additional family members. She lives in her own house and her family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

Zula sells secondhand clothes on a door-to-door basis. She has been in this business for the last nine years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. Her major business challenge is the rainy season which hinders her movement. Her goals and aspirations are to get a permanent business premise where her customers can find her.

loans.use: to buy more bales of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Zawadi Group

texts.fr: Gakuru est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Zawadi», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 23 ans, mère 3 enfants dont 1 étudie et 2 sont encore gosses. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des souliers plastics dans un marché de la ville depuis 4 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en souliers plastics. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir son enfant. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Gakuru is a retailer and a member of loaning group «Zawadi», a client of IMF Hekima. She is married, twenty-three, and a mother of three. One of her children goes to school, and two are still little.

She started her business with capital received from her husband. She has sold plastic shoes at one of the city’s markets for four years. She will procure plastic shoes.

She wants to buy a parcel of land, send her children to school, and feed them. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting entrepreneurs excluded from traditional banking.

loans.use: to procure plastic shoes.

loans.name: Raghad Group

texts.en:
Zeinab is the featured borrower of Raghad group, she got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends, and they work hard to improve their living and look forward to a brighter future.

Zeinab is the first lady at the far right side of the picture.  She is an 18-year-old single lady, who has been working as a tutor from her house for five months to make sure she can cover her living expenses and most of her college needs. She is studying to be a Kindergarten teacher to open her own nursery in the future. Her acquired loan will be invested in paying for her college tuition fees and stationary supplies for requested projects.

As for the other group members, Fatima is the lady at the center (20, single) and Raghad at the far left side (19, single) both of them are requesting the acquired loan to pay for their university tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for her college tuition fees and stationary supplies for requested  projects.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn, who resides in Pan-taon, Ozamiz City, is married and blessed with three children. She is 40 years old and has managed a sari-sari (variety) store business for 10 years. She joined GDMPC in 2007. Jocelyn recently borrowed PHP 12,000 to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store to increase her store inventory and have more sales to earn more income. Jocelyn's plan for the future is to sustain the education of her children, supported by her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Tropia Group

texts.en:
Catherine is in her late 20s and a single mother of one child who attends school. For the past two years, she has been selling soft drinks to earn an income. She works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and earns a minimal monthly profit. 

This is Catherine's first loan from Tujijenge. She plans to use the loan to help improve her business selling soft drinks. She hopes the loan will help her earn more profit so she can continue to expand. She dreams of owning a big and successful business. 

Catherine will be sharing this loan with her loan group, Tropia, which consists of eight people who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To improve her business selling soft drinks

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Wesley is an enterprising man, a dreamer, a creative person who, with only a little, has achieved great things. He hails from the Litein area of Kenya, an area that is a city of champions because of producing so many elite athletes. Being the bread winner of his family comes with lots of responsibility, and feeding this large family requires a lot of hard work; hence, Wesley has to put in extra efforts to comfortably take care of his family. 

Wesley started farming just after finishing high school since he never advanced his education. Because of the high unemployment rate, he ventured into farming, and he has never regretted this because of the profits he has been making. Wesley practices mixed farming and is regarded as one of the hardworking farmers in his village because he is able to juggle between keeping dairy cows and also doing banana and other crop farming. 

Wesley is a visionary and enterprising person and has always wanted to do dairy farming on a large scale, but one of the challenges he has faced is lack of enough capital. That is why he is kindly seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. Through the loan Wesley is confident that his life will be transformed and his dream of providing a secure future for his siblings will be achieved. Wesley is relieved to know that his life can be secured through partners such as Kiva lenders who help small-scale and aspiring men such as Wesley.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty needs credit to buy school bags and hand bags to sell. She is a hard-working woman who sells bags in a retail shop. She lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda and also does farming to boost her income. These businesses generate income to support her well being. Betty wishes to expand her business but faces a challenge of insufficient funds to buy more stock.

loans.use: to buy school bags and hand bags to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 60-year-old married father of three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is in the transport business and also raises poultry and grows bananas that contribute to his income. He is faced with challenges of high competition that hinders the growth of his business. Besides that, he has hopes of improving his business by expanding to new areas. James needs a loan to buy materials like stones to construct a house.

loans.use: to buy material like stones to construct a house.

loans.name: St Lucy Rwenguhyo Group

texts.en: Victoria is a 59 year old hard working widowed woman with six children. She is a member of St Lucy Rwenguhyo group living in Kasese, Uganda. Victoria operates a textile shop of new clothes and has been in that business for 25 years. She also practices farming, rearing cattle and goats to get additional income. She has a dream of finishing her residential house. However, she is limited by capital. Victoria wants money to buy dresses, skirts and babies clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy dresses, skirts and babies clothes for selling.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married mother of four children, all in school. She owns at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Hellen operates a stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of seasonality and transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Larissa

texts.es:
Larissa es de la ciudad de Pilar, es peluquera, y comenta que se esta esforzando para poder ayudar a su familia, e ir creciendo poco a poco por medio de su esfuerzo y lucha diaria. Ella comenta que su prestamos anterior lo uso en la compra de insumos para su negocio, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Ella agradece por la oportunidad que recibe nuevamente de poder acceder a este préstamo. Larissa pide este préstamo para poder comprar nuevamente insumos para su peluquería, como ser tintes, tijeras, shampoo, enjuagues, gel, spray y demás, lo cual le permitirá nuevamente seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
Larissa is from the city of Pilar. She is a hairdresser and says that she is making an effort to be able to help her family. She is growing little by little through her effort and fight everyday. She says that her previous loans were used to buy supplies for her business, which were very helpful.

She is thankful for the opportunity she has to be able to access this loan. Larissa asks for this loan to be able to buy supplies again for her hair salon, including dyes, scissors, shampoo, rinses, gel, spray, and other things. This will allow her to continue improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dyes, scissors, shampoo, rinses, gel, spray, and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy gears, chains, pinions, axles, and other things.

loans.name: Madinah

texts.en: Madinah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and three go to school. She has no additional members. She makes liquid soap from home on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last four years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from making table mats. She has requested for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT–SACCO to buy materials for making liquid soap. Her major challenge includes high prices for materials. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy materials for making liquid soap.

loans.name: , Lolito .

texts.en: Lolito is a 50 years old, married and has five children. He has been in rice production for 10 years. His family also earns a living from their farm. He joined the GDMPC last 2009. Last January 2015 he decided take a loan amounting P 17,000.00 to purchase organic fertilizer and to pay for the labor costs of his workers in the rice field. Lolito's future plan is to sustain the education of his children and give his children better lives.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and pay for the labor costs for his workers.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is a 29-year-old man. He was raised in the countryside with the good traditions of hard work, love for family, religious beliefs, and protective instincts towards his family. 

Through dairy farming and keeping poultry, he has been able to produce milk and eggs. Mathew is a very dedicated farmer, who has a never-say-die attitude and enjoys every bit of farming because, through farming, he is able to take care of his family’s needs and wants. Although he experiences challenges in farming, Mathew's attitude keeps him going. He enjoys what he does, and has even nicknamed his cow. 

Mathew is seeking a 60,000 KES loan to buy a chaff cutter. A chaff cutter is a mechanical device that is used to cut hay into small pieces before being mixed with other forage. This assists the animal in digestion and prevents the animal from rejecting any part of the food. With the loan, he will be able to increase his milk production, which will increase his income levels. 

Mathew’s biggest dream is to get out of poverty, and this loan will be a stepping stone toward improving the living standards of his family, and increasing his income level. Assist an enterprising Kenyan farmer!

loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Therese

texts.en:
Therese is a 39-year-old married woman with 3 children, between the ages of 6 and 14, all of whom go to school. 

Therese sells vegetables, and has been in this business for 4 years. Her husband is a carpenter. 

With this loan, Therese would like to buy different items, such as beans and sorghum, to sell. She will use the profits from the business to build a house. In the future, Therese hopes to earn at least 30,000 per month.

loans.use: To buy different items, such as beans and sorghum, to sell.

loans.name: Calvin

texts.en: Calvin is a forty -year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She used the previous loan to buy books, papers and pens to sell in her retail shop of general merchandise which she has operated for the last five years. She is now requesting for a loan to invest in her textile shop. Her hardships are market competition and high taxes. She has a dream of completing her residential house and educating her children. Her business goal is expanding her business into new markets. Calvin wants money to buy sand and cement to plaster her residential house.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement to plaster her residential house.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a 48 year old hard working married man with five children, living in Kasese-Uganda. He has been a salt miner for three years and again sells crude salt working six days a week and ten hours a day. He began the business to generate income for his family. As a hard working man Wilson had to buy a motorcycle transport to help him earn a living during the bad seasons. He needs money to buy crude salt to sell. Wilson hopes to educate his children. However, seasonal changes and high license fees are the difficulties he faces.

loans.use: to buy salt to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Deniz

texts.en:
Deniz lives with her parents and together with her mother she is helping to support her father’s lens making business. During her summers she has worked in the shop to learn the trade. With her first credit she bought eye glass frames and was able to make a profit. With the second credit she was able to buy more eyeglass products and develop their business. With the third credit she would like to buy glass lenses and hopes with this she can improve sales and support the economy of the family.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Deniz hanım annesi ile beraber yaşıyor. Baba mesleği olan, gözlükçü işi ile uğraşıyor. Çocukluğunda yaz tatillerinde çalıştığı dükkan, ilerleyen yıllarda mesleği oluyor. Aldığı ilk kredi ile optik malzemesi gözlük çerçevesi alarak para kazandı. Ikinci kredi ile de optik malzemesi aldı ve işlerini geliştirdi.  Üçüncü kredi ile de gözlük camları aldı. Ve satış yaparak işini geliştirmek istiyor. Calışarak aile ekonomisine ve ülke ekonomisine katkı sağlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy glass lenses

loans.name: Ayşe

texts.en:
Ayşe is a married mother of five. She earns a living through working in network marketing. She has built a team within her multilevel marketing system and this has given other people the opportunity to earn money as well. With the loan from Maya, she has purchased products. She wants to sell the products to earn money. Her goal is to pave the way for a good future for her children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Ayşe hanım evli beş çocuk annesi.  Evden network sistemi yaparak geçimini sağlıyor.  Yaptığı sistemde ekip kurmuş diğer insanlarında para kazanmalarına vesile olmuş.  Aldığı kredi ile network sisteminden ürün aldı.  Aldığı ürünleri satarak para kazanmak istiyor.  Hedefleri çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek hazırlamak.

loans.use: to buy products.

loans.name: Elif

texts.en:
Elif is married and has two children. Because her kids are little, she is unable to work a regular job. She contributes to the family income by taking orders for cakes, pastries and other baked goods and making them at home. With the loan from Maya, she purchased baking supplies, which she’ll use to make baked goods and sell them. She wants to earn money and for her children to have a bright future.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Elif hanım evli iki çocuk annesi, çocukları küçük olduğunda devamlı bir işyerinde çalışamıyor.  Evde siparişle pasta börek gibi hamur işleri yaparak aile bütçesine katkı sağlıyor.  Aldığı kredi ile pastacılık malzemeleri aldı üretip satarak para kazanmak istiyor.  Çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek hazırlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Rehema has operated a food stall for the past four years, selling to the community and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and transportation as major challenges in her business.

With the loan of 30,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil, for resale. Rehema hopes to earn money to pay school fees for her children. She decided to join Yehu to access financial aid, with which to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil, for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase ready made women's clothes and incense to sell alongside her business.

loans.name: Makhsud

texts.ru:
Махсуд житель кишлака Гулистан Шахристанского района. Ему 32 года. По профессии он водитель. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Махсуд с детства любит животных. Махсуд начиная с месяца марта 2014 года сотрудничает с МДО Арванд. 
У него есть мечта, Махсуд хочет построить большой дом для своей семьи. Но для этого ему необходимы денежные средства. То, что он зарабатывает не достаточно, чтобы позволить себе построение нового дома. Поэтому Махсуд обратился в Арванд и  хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для построения дома. Махсуд надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд  за поддержку.
texts.en:
Makhsud lives in the small village of Gulistan in the Shahriston district of Tajikistan.  He is 32 years old and a professional driver.  He is married and the father of three children.  Makhsud has always loved animals.  He has also been a client of MDO Arvand since March 2014.

Makhsud has a dream:  he wants to build a big house for his family, but such a project requires a lot of money. His income is not sufficient to allow him to build a new house.  For this reason, Makhsud has turned to MDO Arvand and would like to receive a loan to buy building materials to build a house.  Makhsud is hoping for a positive outcome and thanks MDO Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a house.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La señora Florentina es de la ciudad de Santaní, es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, quien se dedica a las ventas, tiene una despensa, con varios años de funcionamiento, su marido es vendedor ambulante y comenta que ambos se ayudan para poder sustentar el hogar.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, carnes, bebidas, y otros, de manera a poder seguir cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Florentina is from the city of Santaní. She is a very hard-working and enterprising person, who is dedicated to her sales. She has a store, which has been open for several years. Her husband is a traveling salesman. She says that both of them help to be able to support their home.

She asks for this loan to be able to invest in buying supplies for her store, including vegetables, fruits, meat, drinks, and other things. In this way, she will be able to continue fulfilling her clients’ requests.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, meat, drinks, and other things.

loans.name: Zainagul

texts.ru: Зайнагул, 49 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование-среднее, с 1996 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством. Супруг и дети Зайнагул помогают по хозяйству. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 15 овец, 5 лошадей. На участке Зайнагул мерою 2,04 Га собственной и 1,0 Га арендованной земли она выращивает картофель, пшеницу, люцерну и ячмень для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья и приобретение корма для животных. Доходы от кредита Зайнагул планирует вложить в покупку породистых дойных коров.
texts.en: Zainagul is 49 years old, married, and she has three children.  She has a secondary education and has been involved in farming and animal husbandry since 1996.  Her husband and children help with the farm work.  Zainagul currently has four cows, 15 sheep and five horses on her farm.  She also grows potatoes, wheat, alfalfa and barley for domestic consumption and resale on 2.04 hectares of her own land and one hectare of leased land.  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy additional cattle and increase the size of her herd, and also to buy animal feed.  Zainagul is planning to use the earnings from her loan to buy pure-bred dairy cows.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and feed in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a widow with three children and lives in a four-room’ house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced a lot of problems in her life including failures, theft, unwanted pregnancy, fire, and the sudden death of her husband.
She is very optimistic that the loan to buy books, exercise books, pens, rulers, pencils will help her retail business grow. She has been in business for some time now and has been very successful. She has gained much knowledge about the book business and has had many special orders from steady customers. 
With profits resulting from this loan, Justine intends to expand her business by buying more machines. She will help the community by providing books. 
She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of low interest rates and the favorable repayment schedule. She also appreciates the non-financial services offered which include loan management and social networking.

loans.use: To buy text books, exercise books, pens, rulers, pencils

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима проживает на районе Рудаки. В Таджикистане многие улицы, районы и города переименовывают в честь великих писателей и ученых таджикского народа. Фотима в течение двух лет предоставляет услуги портнихи у себя дома. Фотиме всего 21 год. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Сыну 2 года, девочке 5 месяцев. Ее муж работает в пекарне пекарем. Фотима чтобы помочь мужу берет заказы на шитье одежды и параллельно следит за маленькими детьми. Сейчас ей необходимо приобрести новую швейную машинку. Ее старая машинка скоро совсем сломается и Фотиме чтобы не лишиться источника дохода она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы приобрести машинку.
texts.en: Fotima lives in the Rudaki district.  In Tajikistan, many streets, districts and cities are named in honor of famous writers and scientists of the Tajik people (Rudaki is the name of a famous 9th-century Persian poet).  Fotima has been providing sewing services at home for the past two years.  She is only 21 years old.  She is married and she has two children: a son who is 2 and a little girl who is five months old.  Her husband works as a baker in a bakery.  In order to help her husband, Fotima takes orders to sew clothes at home and also takes care of her young children.  At the moment, she really needs a new sewing machine.  Her old machine will soon break down and Fotima has applied for a loan to buy a new machine, so that she doesn't have to lose her source of income.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and keep her source of income.

loans.name: Manduara Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Manduará, se formó en la ciudad de Asunción, está integrado con 22 integrantes, donde cada una está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder salir adelante. Ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza con el cual podrán conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder ir mejorando cada día.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Bernarda, ella es muy buena en lo que hace y comenta que ya tiene muy buena clientela, gracias a sus buenos trabajos de confecciones que hace. Ella se define a si misma como una persona muy luchadora y trabajadora que se esfuerza cada día para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida para ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, botones, cierres y otros, de manera a poder cumplir con sus clientes y con las demandas de estos. Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben que les permitirá ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This group is called “Manduará”. It was formed in the city of Asunción and has 22 members, each of whom is putting the greatest effort into getting ahead in life. They are part of the “Poverty Stoplight” program, which enables each member to identify their life situation and keep improving it every day.

One of the members is Bernarda. She is very good at what she does and she says that she already has a good clientele, thanks to the good sewing work that she does. She describes herself as a very determined and hard-working person who strives every day to improve her living conditions and help her family.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy fabrics, threads, buttons, fasteners/zips, and other supplies so she can fill her clients’ orders. All the members are grateful for the opportunity they are receiving, which will enable them to continue improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, buttons, fasteners/zips, and other sewing supplies

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Victoria está en su ciclo número 17 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4 integrantes se encuentran en una situación de pobreza extrema.
La Sra. Eusebia a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de su servicio en su peluquería viene mejorando cada día. Comenta que con mucho esfuerzo pudo montar su negocio y con sacrificio ha ido creciendo y mejorando su negocio. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y muy buena en lo que hace, es por ello que tiene una muy buena clientela.
Eusebia pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su peluquería, como ser tintes, tijeras, cremas. Shampoo, enjuagues y demás, de manera a poder seguir creciendo y dando un buen servicio a sus clientes. Todas y cada una de ellas está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vidas y las de su familias.
texts.en:
The group “La Victoria” (“The Victory”) is on their 17th loan cycle. They all work towards getting ahead in life, and they help each other with this. They are doing the “Poverty Stoplight” program, and four of the members are in a situation of extreme poverty.

Through great effort and her continuing hairdressing work, Eusebia’s situation is improving a little each day. She says that, with a lot of effort, she was able to set up her business and that it has been growing and improving, with some sacrifice on her part. She is a very hard-working and enterprising person and she is very good at what she does; for this reason, she has a very good clientele. 

Eusebia is requesting this loan so she can buy some supplies for her hairdressing business, such as dyes, scissors, creams, shampoos, and rinses. In this way, she will be able to continue growing in her business and giving her clients good service. Each and every one of the members is doing their best to improve their living conditions, as well as of those of their families.

loans.use: to buy dyes, scissors, creams, shampoo, rinses, and other supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Les Chérubins Group

texts.fr: Nambula est propriétaire d’un cabinet de change de la monnaie dans le centre ville depuis 7, membre du groupe de crédit Les Chérubins, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 34 ans, mère de 4 enfants tous vont à l’école. Elle commença avec de fonds de reçu  de son mari. Son conjoint est ingénieur. Elle va acheter les devises étrangères. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Nambula has been the owner of a money exchange office downtown for 7 [months, years]. A member of the loan group Les Chérubins, she is a client of the microfinance institution Hekima and is married, 34 years old, and the mother of four children, all going to school. She started with funds from her husband, an engineer. 

Nambula is going to buy foreign currency. She would like to obtain more loans, increase her turnover, and provide education and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy foreign currency

loans.name: Nyota Group

texts.fr: La cliente Marie est une commerçante, membre d’un collectif de crédits «Nyota», âgée de 37 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants dont 6 scolarisés et 1 est un bébé. Elle est vendeuse divers modèles de pagnes et bijoux au marché de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter des pagnes et bijoux. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux femmes entrepreneuses exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: This client, Marie, is a merchant and a member of the loan collective “Nyota”. She is 37 years old and a married mother of seven children, of whom 6 have had schooling, and 1 is a baby. Marie is a vendor of various styles of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and jewelry at the market in town. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to grow her business. Thus, she would like to build [a house] and provide schooling and food for her children. She thanks Hekima for its support of women entrepreneurs excluded from the classic banking system.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth and jewelry

loans.name: Eda

texts.en:
Eda is a married mother of three. She was formerly a worker at a factory but when she had her children she couldn't keep working at the factory. So, she started selling products like Turkish delight (candy) from her home, making sales through network marketing.  With the loan from Maya, she bought products.to sell to earn money.  She wants her children to have a good future.


Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Eda hanım evli üç çocuk annesi.  Fabrikada işçi olarak çalışmış.  Çocukları olunca çalışmayı bırakmış.  Evden ürün alıp satarak çalışmaya başlamış, lokum alıp satmış, Network sistemi ile satışlar yapıyor.  Aldığı kredi ile network ürünleri aldı.  Satış yaparak para kazanmayı planlıyor.  Çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek hazırlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy products such as candy to sell.

loans.name: Derya

texts.en:
Derya is a married mother of three children.  She started knitting at home and selling to her close friends to support her children’s education costs.  She also sold olives from her home and made some money from that.  Later on, she bought more olives with the money she earned to support her family. She is planning to provide a better future for her children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Derya hanım evli üç çocuk annesi.  Evde örgü örerek yakınlarına satış yapmaya başlamış, aldığı minik paralarla okuyan çocuklarına destek olmuş.  Bulunduğu yörede zeytin yetişiyor ve zeytin satmaya da başlıyor, zeytinden de para kazanıyor.  Aldığı para ile toplu zeytin alıyor ve para kazanmaya başlıyor.  Aile ekonomisine ve ülke ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor.   Çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek sağlamayı planlıyor.

loans.use: to buy olives to sell.

loans.name: Miralis

texts.es: Miralis: Es una joven emprendedora de 18 años de edad, soltera. Vive en la comunidad de Nazaret, que se localiza a 65 kilómetros de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Con el propósito de apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar y a sus hermanos en sus estudios, desde hace 8 años inicio colaborando en la pulpería de sus padres. Sin embargo por problemas de salud de sus papas, actualmente ella es la responsable de atender el pequeño negocio. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar en Puerto Cabezas: granos básicos, aceites, chiverías, pan, gaseosas, entre otros productos de uso domestico. Ella sueña con mejorar la infraestructura de su pequeño negocio.
texts.en: Miralis is an enterprising young woman. She is 18 years old and single. She lives in the community of Nazaret, which is located 65 kilometres away from the city of Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. With the goal of helping her parents with the household expenses and her siblings with their studies, she has been working in her parents’ grocery store for eight years. However, due to some health problems that her parents have, currently it is Miralis that is responsible for looking after the small business. She is requesting her first loan in order to buy the following things in Puerto Cabezas: staple grains, oil, snacks, bread, soft drinks, and other domestic products. She dreams of improving the infrastructure of her small business.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, oil, snacks, bread, soft drinks, and other household products

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 28-year-old married father of three from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and children in a simple house. Ahmad works as an employee in a local company where he earns a low income. Ahmad is also a student at a local university where he studies business administration. He wants to find a job soon and improve the family's living conditions.
Ahmad took out a USD loan from FATEN to help him to buy a new laptop computer for his studies. By taking out this loan, Ahmad will be able to do his homework and write the reports easily.
Ahmad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop computer for his studies.

loans.name: 23 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran este grupo llamado 23 de octubre, donde todas son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, que se unieron para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida con el apoyo de las capacitaciones, y por medio de la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, y el programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una persona que se esfuerza mucho y que pone todo de si es la Sra. Epifania, una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora que se dedica a la venta de comidas muy variadas que ella misma hace. Empieza su trabajo desde muy temprano, se levanta a preparar ella misma sus comidas, y luego los vende de manera ambulante. Epifania está muy contenta por esta oportunidad que recibe, ya que a través de las capacitaciones que les brinda la fundación paraguaya puede ir mejorando cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, de manera a poder seguir luchando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
This group is called "23 de Octubre" and is made up 17 women who are all friends and neighbors, and who got together to improve their living conditions with the help of training and through the poverty elimination survey, and the poverty elimination program.

One member who makes every effort and gives all she's got to get ahead, is Epifania, a woman who is selfless and determined. She makes a living selling a variety of home-cooked food. She starts work very early, getting up to prepare the meals that she then sells as street vendor.

Epifania is very happy with this opportunity, since the training that Fundacion Paraguaya provides them, allows her to improve herself every day.

She's requesting this loan to buy ingredients to prepare her meals, such as vegetables, meat, condiments, and leafy greens. She will then be able to continue striving as she has to date.

loans.use: to buy food items such as vegetables, meat, condiments, leafy greens, and more.

loans.name: Fares

texts.en:
Fares is a 33-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and two children in a simple house. 

Fares works as an employee at a local company, where he earns a low income. Fares is also a student at a local university, where he studies business administration. He wants to find a better job and improve the family living conditions.

Fares took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Fares will be able to do his homework and write reports easily.

Fares appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben vive en la ciudad de San Ignacio, se dedica a la construcción de todo tipo de obras, comenta que siempre le fue muy bien, ya que sus trabajos son muy buenos y sus clientes siempre quedan conformes.
Él es una persona que se esfuerza siempre para poder crecer e ir mejorando en el servicio que hace, es por ello que se pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de herramientas que le será útil en su profesión de constructor.
texts.en:
Ruben lives in the city of San Ignacio; he makes a living doing all kinds of construction work.
He mentions that things have always gone well for him, since the work he performs is very good and his clients are always satisfied.
He is the kind of person that works hard to be able to grow and improve upon the services he provides, this being the reason he is asking for a loan, to invest in the purchase of tools that he will utilize in his construction work.

loans.use: purchase tools for construction services

loans.name: Sabira

texts.ru: Сабира, 29 лет, замужем, 3 детей. Образование среднее, на протяжении 11 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав бизнес с суммы 13,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Сабиры в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 5 коров, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 14,000 сом (KGS). Сабира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. На полученные доходы от кредита Сабира планирует и дальше увеличивать поголовье скота.
texts.en: Sabira is 29 years old, married, and she has three children.  She has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture for the past 11 years, starting her own business with an initial capital of 13,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has five cows and ten sheep on her farm and she makes a monthly income of about 14,000 som (KGS).  Sabira has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy some sheep.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase the size of her herd.

loans.use: to buy some sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Qurbonoy

texts.ru:
Курбоной трудолюбивая женщина 52 лет. Она замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Её мужа  зовут  Абдурахим. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина, любит семью и старается для семейного благополучия. Она занимается куплей продажей национальной одежды на базаре. Её муж таксист. Он занимается частным извозом. Она сотрудничает с МДО Арванд  с 2012 года.
Сейчас Курбоной собирается выдать замуж свою дочь. Она готовиться к свадебному мероприятию. Для этого нужно купить очень много вещей для приданного. Но у Курбоной не хватает денежных средств, которые она накопила для свадьбы. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку приданного для свадьбы дочери. Курбоной очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку
texts.en:
Qurbonoy is a very hardworking 52-year-old woman.  She is married and she has had one child.  Her husband's name is Abdurakhim.  Qurbonoy loves to work, loves her family and does everything to ensure her family's well-being.  At the moment she buys and sells traditional Tajik clothes at the market.  Her husband works as a private taxi driver and has been a client of MDO Arvand since 2012.

Qurbonoy's daughter will get married soon, so Qurbonnoy is now planning her daughter's wedding ceremony. For this occasion, she needs to buy many things to prepare a dowry.  However, although Qurbonnoy has saved some money for the wedding, she still does not have enough money to prepare her daughter's dowry.  For this reason, she has turned to MDO Arvand and applied for a loan to buy a dowry for her daughter's wedding.  Qurbonoy is looking forward to a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's dowry.

loans.name: Amkeni Group

texts.fr: veronique est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise Amkeni, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 41 ans, mère de 8 enfants dont 6 scolarisés et 2 sont grands. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari qui est chauffeur. Elle est vendeuse des articles manufacturés dans une boutique. Elle va acheter des huiles végétales,dentifrices, savons, bougies, sardines, biscuits. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Veronique is a merchant and a member of the 'banc villageois' called Akeni. She is a client of the microfinance institution Hekima who is married, 41 years old, and a mother of eight children, of whom 6 have had schooling, and 2 are adults. 

Veronique started her business with funds from her husband, who is a driver. She sells manufactured products in a store. She is going to purchase some vegetable oil, toothpaste, soaps, candles, sardines, and cookies. She would like to obtain more loans and provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable oil, toothpaste, soaps, candles, sardines, and cookies.

loans.name: Nurzhamal

texts.ru: Нуржамал, 44 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. У Нуржамал среднее образование. В настоящее время занимается животноводством и полеводством, по хозяйству помогает муж и дети. Нуржамал с большой ответственностью относится к своему делу. Ежегодно обрабатывает 1,0 Га земли, выращивает люцерну, в хозяйстве есть 7 коров и 7 овец. Нуржамал обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для покупки скота. Доходы от кредита она направит на дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Nurzhamal is 44 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  She has a secondary education.  She currently works in animal husbandry and crop farming.  Her husband and children help her with the farm work.  Nurzhamal takes her work very seriously: she grows alfalfa annually on one hectare of land, and she now has seven cows and seven sheep on her farm.  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock.  She will use the earnings from her loan to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Tuamuke Group

texts.fr: Vumilia est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Tuamuke», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée a un agent de l’Etat, âgée de 54 ans, mère 8 enfants tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des poissons salés  dans le marché central de la ville depuis 12 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en poissons. Elle souhaite accroitre son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser, nourrir et vêtir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Vumilia is a merchant and a member of the loan group “Tuamuke”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 54 years old, married to a government representative, and the mother of eight children, all students. She started her business with funds from her husband. 

Vumilia has been a vendor of salted fish at the town’s central market for twelve years. She is going to stock up on fish. She would like to grow her sales and provide schooling, food, and clothing for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up on fish

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar is 41 years old, and a married woman. She is a mother of three children. Her husband has been doing a business of animal purchase and sale for many years. 

Kosar fully supports and assists her husband with his work. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Aamina

texts.en:
Aamina is a 45-year-old married woman who has been doing a business of animal purchases and sales, with the help of her husband, for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. 

She is a mother of four children. She is very motivated to provide for them a beautiful life, with a good education, food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan to purchase more baby goats and calves in order to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married with three children and lives in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many problems in life, like the death of her family members, especially that of her parents. She still stands firm and thinks her business will succeed because she has been in the business for a very long time, with training from GHAPE and advice from other agricultural organizations.

With this new loan requested, she plans to rent a piece of land, buy yam seedlings, and pay for temporal manual labor, weeding and harvesting, and transportation of the produce to the market. This business will actively help the community in that people around her will not need to travel far distances again to buy yams.

The profits from the business will be used to increase the size of the farm, provide for education for her children and provide medication for the family in case of ill health. 

She prefers a loan from GHAPE because the interest rate is low, the method of repayment is very simple and the rules are easy to follow. A new loan can be obtained as soon as you finish repaying the previous one, coupled with the fact that GHAPE offers non-financial services, including training, before loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to rent a farm, buy yam seedlings, and to pay for clearing, tilling and transportation of produce to the market.

loans.name: Naji

texts.en:
Naji is a 31-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and two children in a simple house. Naji works as an employee at a local company, where he earns a low income. He is also a student at a local university, where he studies general administration. He wants to find a better job and improve the family's living conditions.

Naji took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Naji will be able to do his homework and write reports easily.

Naji appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 56-year-old married man with six children, living in Fort Portal Uganda. He is a dairy farmer, the business he does daily, and works seven hours every day. He started this business with an aim of earning more income as he supplies to major dairies in Fort Portal town. He is faced with the challenge of unpredictable weather changes which cause low milk production. Besides that, he is working very hard in order to get a bright future. Charles has asked for a loan to buy barbed wire, poles and nails to fence his farm.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, poles and nails to fence his farm.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru: Чамиле 53 года. У нее нет мужа, но есть сын. Его зовут Умед, ему 30 лет. Он живет заграницей на заработках. Чамила живет в городе Душанбе и здесь же работает. Она занимается продажей кондитерских изделий в одном из рынков города. Чамила держится за свою работу, потому что каждый день она общается с новыми людьми и со своими коллегами-продавцами. Чамила как любая мать тоскует по своему сыну, и ее работа намного отвлекает ее от мыслей. Чамила всего год работает в этой сфере деятельности, но научилась тонкостям своей работы. Она старается обслужить клиентов качественно и быстро. Чамила хочет расширить деятельность и потому она обратилась за кредитом. Благодаря кредиту, она сможет увеличить товарооборот и соответственно доход. Чамила без заемных средств не сможет осуществить свой план и единственный выход она видит в получении кредита.
texts.en: Jamila is 53 years old.  She is not married but she has a son, Umed, who is now 30 years old.  Umed is currently making a living abroad.  Jamila herself lives and works in the city of Dushanbe.  She sells confectionery items at a market, in town.  Jamila enjoys her work, her relationships with the other market vendors, and the fact that she gets to meet new people every day.  Like all caring mothers, Jamila misses her son, but she finds some comfort and distraction in her work.  Jamila has only been working in this field for a year, but she has gained a good deal of experience.  She particularly strives to provide a fast and quality service to her customers.  Jamila would like to expand her activity, and for this reason, she has applied for a loan.  Thanks to this loan, she will be able to increase her turnover and consequently, her income.  Getting a loan is the only way she can improve her business, as she would not be able to achieve her goal without borrowing some money.

loans.use: to buy confectionery items for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a hardworking Ugandan married man of 52 years with three children living in Masindi, Uganda. He sells honey as his major business and also earns extra income from ghee trading. He is challenged by weather that doesn't favor the bees to freely make honey, thus making it hard to reach his point of turnover as far as profits are concerned. He needs a credit facility to buy more jerrycans of honey to sell.

loans.use: to buy more jerrycans of honey to sell.

loans.name: Aliman

texts.ru: Алиман 20 лет, замужем, есть годовалый сын. У Алиман - средне-специальное образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Алиман с мужем занимаются животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 коров, 15 овец. На участке мерою 2,0 Га собственной земли, она выращивает клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 30,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Алиман обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Алиман планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Aliman is 20 years old, married, and the mother of a one-year-old son.  She has a specialized secondary education.  As an additional source of income for the family, Aliman and her husband are involved in animal husbandry and crop farming.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has five cows and 15 sheep on her farm.  She also grows clover on two hectares of her own land.  She makes up to 30,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further grow her farming business, Aliman has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep and increase her livestock headcount.  Aliman is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her number of domestic animals.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Nighat

texts.en: Nighat is 31 years old and married. She is running a business selling milk with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Nighat’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Nighat has requested 50,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers and provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers and provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en: Zaina needs a credit facility to buy a refrigerator for her restaurant. She is a hardworking married woman with five children. She lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda and runs a restaurant that generates income for her family. Zaina wishes to have an improved restaurant, but she faces a challenge of competition.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her restaurant

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 21-year-old single lady from a village near Ramallah city. Her father works as a construction worker where he gets a low and unstable income. Fatmeh is a student where she studies business administration. She wants to complete her study and find a job to help her family in part of their expenses.

Fatmeh took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Fatmeh will complete her study faster.

Fatmeh appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay her university installments for this semester

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en: Zawadi is a married woman. She has seven children with ages ranging from 3 years to 15 years old. She describes herself to be visionary. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a trading center and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. She hopes that in the future, the business will create employment. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a dairy farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy another dairy cow. Her business goal is to have a large scale business within five years. This is her fourth loan with loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows tea. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. 

She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to have a large-scale business within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to have a large-scale business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Amber

texts.en: Amber, 29 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store along with her husband who is also shown in the photo. They offer a variety of daily use products and have a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Amber needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demands. She has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc. to consistently meet the increasing demands at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, and juices to consistently meet the increasing demands at her store and make better earnings.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz is 51 years old, married and a mother of six children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of selling milk. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a 56-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Leyte, Philippines. Letecia earns a living through her sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and food items to the people in her place. 

Letecia is requesting to take a loan to buy more stock such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, rice, bread and biscuits, among other items. This loan will enable her to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store. 

In the future, Letecia dreams of making her business more profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, rice, bread and biscuits, among other items

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married mother of 3 children. She describes herself as an honest woman. 

Mary operates a dairy farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. 

Even though her business is located in a busy area, Mary's biggest challenge remains to be inadequate funds. 

Mary will use her 20,000 KES loan to repair the shelter for her dairy cows. Her business goal is to have a large scale business within 5 years. 

This is Mary's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to repair the shelter for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. The man shown in the photo is one of her sons. 

Perveen and her family faced a difficult time after her husband's business failure, so she decided to start her stitching business two years ago to support her family. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to meet her family's expenses. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. She is currently in her fifth loan cycle and has borrowed 45,000 PKR from Kashf to buy stitching materials, including spools of threads of different colors, laces, zips, etc., to create a means of increasing revenue so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy stitching materials, including spools of threads of different colors, laces, zips, etc.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a strategic place. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to have a large-scale business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Vano

texts.en:
Vano is a 50-year-old married man from Zugdidi city. He lives with his wife, who is a housekeeper, and 2-year-old daughter. Vano earns his family's living with a taxi service. He works as a taxi driver and serves local people. His salary, however, is not enough to meet the basic needs of his family. 

As it becomes harder to earn a living over time, Vano wants to start an additional business in order to more effectively meet the daily costs of the family. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial condition and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Vano applied for the credit from MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva permitting the rural poor to start or restart businesses. 

With the loan, Vano plans to purchase all the needed tools and equipment and start furniture making. He has a small workshop near the house and will expand it for making more various kinds of furniture. Vano will get private orders and will sell his handmade items at the local market. 

He is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure his daughter has a good education for progressing in life. This credit will be a great support for the family. Vano is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to start his own business and make furniture

loans.name: Shad

texts.en:
Shad is a 50-year-old widow. She has been running her shoe-making business for the past 8 years along with her son, who is also shown in the photo above. 

Shad is a mother of 9 children. She is responsible for her family's basic needs including food, health, and clothing. She is an energetic woman and eager to support her family. Her children also help her with her business. 

Now, Shad has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy additional shoe-making materials including leather, artificial leather, plastic soles, etc. In this way, she can fulfill the growing demand for her shoes in the market and earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional shoe-making materials including leather, artificial leather, plastic soles, etc.

loans.name: Inginio

texts.es: INGINIO: Es un hombre amable, originario de Siuna, desde hace 12 años se traslado a la comunidad de Nazaret, territorio de Tasbapri, que en  miskito significa (tierra libre). Esta comunidad pertenece al municipio de Puerto Cabezas, se localiza a 65 kilómetros de Bilwi. Con el propósito de dedicarse actividades agrícolas y pecuarias. Tiene 64 años de edad, casado con 4 hijos adolescentes. Su esposa atiende una pequeña pulpería. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar productos de uso del hogar para la pulpería de su esposa y comprar cerdos lechones, engordarlos y comercializarlos. Su sueño es tener una finca con cultivos diversificados, con buenos rendimientos y manejo agronómico, que le generen buenos ingresos también, para crear mejores condiciones para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Inginio is a nice man. A native of Siuna, he moved to the community of Nazaret 12 years ago in order to farm and raise livestock.  It is in the territory of Tasba Pri, which means “free land” in Miskito.  This community, which belongs to the municipality of Puerto Cabezas, is located 65 kilometers from Bilwi.

He is 64 years old and married with four adolescent children. His wife runs a little corner store.  He is requesting his first loan in order to purchase household products for his wife’s little store, and to purchase piglets to fatten and sell. 

His dream is to have a farm with diversified crops and good yields, that with good farming methods may generate income also, in order to create better conditions for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase household products for his wife's little corner store, and piglets to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Leyte, Philippines. She is engaged in retail sales of bed foam, closet dividers and other items. Helen has been in the business for more than four years now. This is the source of her income. Helen is asking to take a loan to buy more stocks to sell like bed foam, closet dividers, rice cookers and other furniture. This loan will help her improve her stocks, allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Helen hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like bed foam, closet dividers, rice cookers and other furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 51-year-old divorcee. She is a mother of one and a grandmother of three. 

Joyce was a care worker in a retirement home. While there, she learned about natural health products and understood the importance of living a healthy life. She then decided to spread the importance of health by distributing natural health products within her community.

Joyce buys the health products in bulk and then resells to small retailers such as cosmetic shops and hair salons within her area.

She is requesting a loan to buy additional supplies of the health products, as demand has grown rapidly and she is currently unable to fulfill all her clients' orders. With the loan, she will be able to buy the products in bulk directly from the manufacturer and expand her clientele.

She says that she feels great when people are healed and living healthy because of her products, and aspires to establish a distribution channel expanding into other regions of the country.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of health products

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem and her husband (also shown in the photo) have successfully built their business of manufacturing cement tiles with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time they have attained a good number of customers and make a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

Previously, with the help of Kiva, they were able to expand their business. Now Naseem is in her eighth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase more stock of cement and tools necessary to manufacture tiles. This will enable them to increase their sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of cement and tools necessary to manufacture tiles

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is 35 years old; she is a married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals in order to increase her sales. 

She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Giuli

texts.en:
Giuli is a 47-year-old married woman. She lives with her family in Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. Giuli works as a cashier and earns a small monthly income. Her husband is an artisan and repairs cars to generate income. 

Giuli is very hardworking woman and wants to start additional business in order to generate more income.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 5,000 USD to start a new business. With the received loan, she plans to open a market in Tbilisi. She already has chosen a place where she plans to open a market. She needs money to purchase all the needed materials for opening the store and the stock of products to sell. 

Giuli is very motivated and ready to tackle all the difficulties connected to the new business starting up.

loans.use: to open a market.

loans.name: Mastoor

texts.en:
Mastoor is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she started her business of selling milk. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her community. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo in order to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo in order to increase her sales and earn profits.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 37 years old, a married woman and a mother of four children. She is working hard to fulfill the needs of her family, including food, health, clothing, and education.   

She, with her husband, has been doing agricultural work for some years. They grow different vegetables and fruit and sell them in the local market. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

In order to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Asia has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops, which ultimately would help in generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has four children whose ages range from three to 15 years. David describes himself as focused. He operates a retail business where he sells vegetables and cereals, and has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a reliable place and his primary customers are locals. 

David describes his biggest business challenge to be storage. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of cereals. His business goal is to own a cereals store within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his standard of living. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La Sra. Irma es de la ciudad de Pilar, tiene alquileres de salones , se dedica a esta actividad  hace más de 10 años, comenta que por medio de sus alquileres tiene los medio para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Es una persona  muy trabajadora y emprendedora y muy conocida en el barrio por ser buen amable.
Pide este préstamo para la compra y colocación de aires acondicionados en sus salones, de manera a poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Irma is from the city of Pilar. She has reception halls that she rents out.  She has been doing this for more than 10 years, and she comments that it is by means of her rentals that she is able to help her family and her loved ones.

She is a very hardworking and enterprising person, and well-known in the neighborhood for being very nice.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase and installation of air conditioners in her reception halls, so that she can continue providing good service to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase air conditioners to install in reception halls.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a married man and has one child. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. Geoffrey's business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are of all types. 

Geoffrey describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. He will use this 40,000 KES loan to service and maintain his motorcycle. His business goal is to own a big bus within five years. This is Geoffrey's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Muqadas

texts.en:
Muqadas is 28 years old and a single lady. She is a hardworking woman who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for the past six years, and she knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue the operation of her business, she has requested for a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy stock of threads in different colors and packs of zips, buttons, etc. to meet the increasing demands of her customers. She hopes that increasing the production capacity will help her to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads in different colors and packs of zips, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna lives in Nalbandyan village with her husband. They are farmers. Currently, the couple is involved in the cultivation of tomatoes, eggplant and peppers. Ruzanna also takes care of their grape orchard which is located near their house. 

To be able to purchase materials for the renovation of her greenhouse where she organizes the cultivation of vegetables, Ruzanna has applied for this loan. As this is Ruzanna's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for materials to renovate her greenhouse.

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en: Shanti is 51-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of available funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors plus packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will help her to create a means of increasing revenue so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. Shanti is in her fifth loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors plus packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Wallace

texts.en:
Wallace is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells bags. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. 

He will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy more stock of bags. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bags

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is from Armavir town. She lives there with her husband, son and daughter. Her daughter is a teacher at a local secondary school, and her son and husband help Laura with Javel water production and sales. They are specialized in that work and get high quality Javel water, which is highly demanded locally. 

Laura asks for this loan to purchase tools and raw materials for the production and sale of Javel water. 

She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately, wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to the hard work during the recent times, Laura was able to run her production business in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools and raw materials for production and sale of Javel water

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be determined and strong. She operates a retail business where she sells second-hand clothes. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals.
 
She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of clothes. 

She will use the 100,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. This will enable her to increase her stock, hence have more profits. Her business goal is to expand the business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be rich. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is a 53-year-old married woman. She works in her home as a tailor. She has six years of experience and is proud to be contributing to her family’s income. 

Her family faced a financial crisis because her husband was the only bread earner, and after his second marriage, he stopped providing for his family; therefore, it compelled her to use her stitching skills. 

Noreen is a brave and hardworking woman, and she has a good list of clients, but now she is facing difficulty in fulfilling large orders from customers. Therefore, she has requested 50,000 PKR to purchase a new stitching machine, a pack of threads, laces, zips and stitching material in order to boost her earnings and to provide s good education to her four children.
