loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine, a pack of threads, laces, zips and stitching material

loans.name: Jozfain

texts.en:
Jozfain is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been doing a business of cloth trade for the last four years. Her collection is very famous in her town. She offers a variety of cloth in different colors to her customers and makes enough money for her family to lead a decent life.

She is a mother of four children. She is responsible to provide them with good food, health and education. She has steadily improved her business by taking loans from Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy more cloth in various colors and designs. She hopes that it will increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy more cloth in various colors and designs

loans.name: Amado

texts.es:
La Sra. Amada tiene 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Caacupé, se inició siendo muy joven realizando trabajos de demolición con su tío y luego aprendió en oficio de constructor.
Actualmente trabaja de forma independiente .Gracias a dicha actividad puede llevar una vida digna y mantenerle a su familia .Comenta siempre tiene trabajos por realizar .Amado es una persona muy responsable  y honesta.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de una maquina mezcladora, que le será de mucha ayuda a la hora de poder cumplir con sus clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Señor Amado is 33 years old. He lives in the city of Caacupé. When he was vary young, he began doing demolition work with his uncle, and then he learned the construction trade.

He now works independently. Thanks to this activity, he is able to provide a dignified life and support his family. He comments that he always has work to do. Amado is a very responsible and honest person.

He is applying for this loan to purchase a cement mixer, which will be of great help to him to satisfy his customers. He is grateful for the opportunity that he is receiving and that will be of much help to him.

loans.use: to buy a cement mixer.

loans.name: Santo Rey Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Unidas está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Edhita quien a través del esfuerzo, sacrificio y lucha diaria ha ido creciendo y mejorando para poder ayudar a su familia, y a sus seres queridos. Ella se dedica a vender prendas varias que hace de manera ambulante, y mediante los ingresos que tiene ha ido superando su situación de pobreza.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias para la venta, para que de esa forma pueda cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes y luchado por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Unidas (United Women) is in its 6th loan cycle in the women's committee program, where all the members work and help each other to advance. They are doing the survey on the elimination of poverty, where three members are below the poverty line, that is, in extreme poverty. 

One of the members is Señora Edhita, who, through her effort, sacrifice, and daily hard work, has been growing and improving to be able to help her family and her loved ones. She sells various articles of clothing, which she does as a street vendor, and through the income that she has, she has been overcoming her situation of poverty.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy various articles of clothing to sell, so that in this way she can fill the requests of her customers and work to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy various articles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Edin Fran

texts.es:
Edin tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa familiar en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte, realiza esta actividad desde hace 01 año y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Solicita préstamo para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Edin espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Edin is 22 years old, single, and lives in a house in a rural area of the Oyotun district, which is found in the province of Chiclayo, the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. People in the community work in agriculture, livestock raising, and shopkeeping.

Edin makes his living in transportation. He has done this work for a year and has a lot of good personal and work references in his district. He asks for this loan to do repair and maintenance on his vehicle, which is currently in a bad state. With this, Edin hopes to offer better service to his clients, which will allow him to raise his level of income and thus improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to do repair and maintenance on his vehicle, which is currently in a bad state.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be determined and strong. He operates a transport buisness where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be high fuel costs. 

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be rich. 

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to open a grocery store for his wife.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be understanding. He operates a retail business where he sells electronics. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in an area with potential. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. 

He will use the 60,000 KES loan to buy more stock of electronics. 

His business goal is to expand his business within five years. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of electronics

loans.name: Chrispine

texts.en:
Chrispine is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be a risk taker. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, milk, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive area, and his primary customers are the general public. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. 

He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, salt, flour, bread and other items. His business goal is to own a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will make more profits and improve his living standards. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, salt, flour, bread and other items

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be competitive. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy market, and his primary customers are the general public. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be bad weather. 

He will use the 30,000 KES loan to service his motorcycle. He hopes that in the future, he will prosper. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle

loans.name: Melanya

texts.en:
Melanya is from Nalbandyan village, where she lives with her husband and elder son. Melany's second son currently serves in the army.
 
The family is occupied in agricultural work. They specifically cultivate tomatoes, eggplant and sunflowers. Melanya also owns a grape orchard, which she takes care of with great pleasure. 

The farm currently needs some improvements to be done, so Melanya has applied for this loan. She asks lenders to support her with purchasing seeds and fertilizer, hiring workers for land cultivation and purchasing a polyethylene cover and fuel for the greenhouse. 

She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately, wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to the hard work during the recent times, Melanya was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizer, hire workers for land cultivation, and purchase a polyethylene cover and fuel for the greenhouse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of tyres.

loans.name: Annick

texts.en:
Annick is aged 37. His wife works at an insurance company, Radiant. He is married, with two children aged 2 and 6 years. They both go to school.

He is a decorator and has been in a business for two years. With the loan, he would like to buy more tents and chairs for decoration sales.

The profits from the business will be used to save in the same business. In the future, he wishes to earn at least 200,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: to buy more tents and chairs for decoration.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
Benita, de 67 años de edad,  no estudio debido a la falta de recursos económicos, es viuda y tiene dos hijos.

Benita, trabaja la agricultura desde los 12 años de edad, participaba en las actividades de cultivo de huertos, recogía leña, cuidaba de los animales, cocinaba, cuidaba sus hermanos y realizaba todas las tareas domésticas de su hogar.- Todas estas actividades las aprendió de su madre y de su abuela, quienes le inculcaron buenos principios y son los que ha puesto en práctica, para ser una mujer de éxito y ejemplo para sus hijos y su comunidad.   

El dinero será utilizado para pagar el arrendamiento de una máquina desgranadora de maíz, ella necesita el moler el maíz y preparar harina de alimento para su ganado, de esta manera estará mejorando su producción y podrá garantizar la alimentación y nutrición a su familia.  

Benita, sueña con ver a sus nietos graduados de la universidad, ya que se encuentran estudiando último año de educación básica, en la escuela de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Benita, who is 67 years old, didn't go to school due to the lack of economic resources. She is a widow and has two children.

Benita has worked in agriculture since she was 12 years old. She participated in the activities of working in the vegetable garden, gathering firewood, caring for the animals, cooking, caring for her siblings, and doing all the household domestic tasks. She learned all this work from her mother and from her grandmother, who inculcated good principles in her, and they are the ones she has put into practice to be a successful woman and an example for her children and her community.

The money will be used to pay to rent a machine to shell corn. She needs to grind the corn and prepare meal to feed her livestock. In this way she will be improving their production, and she will be able to guarantee the food and nutrition for her family.

Benita dreams of seeing her grandchildren graduate from the university, since they are in the last year of their basic education in the school in their community

loans.use: to pay to rent a machine to shell corn

loans.name: Nanci

texts.es:
Nanci tiene 26 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su esposo y su menor hija de 08 años en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos y cerdos, cuenta con más de 08 meses de experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El crédito que solicita será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, con esto Nanci espera ofrecer mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Nanci is 26, has a domestic partnership, and lives with her husband and her young, 8 year old daughter in the district of Pucara, which is located in the province of Jaen, region of Cajamarca, in northern Peru. Life in this district is calm, and the people there work in agriculture, shopkeeping, and raising livestock.

She makes her living selling animals such as hens, ducks, turkeys, and pigs. She has more than eight months of experience in this trade and regular clients who provide great personal and work references for her. The loan she's asking for will be for buying a larger quantity of animals, as well as nutritious feed to fatten them. With this, Nanci hopes to offer a greater variety of animals for her clients, which will have a positive impact on her level of income and thus improve the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals as well as nutritious feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a retail business where she sells fruits. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area fit for the business, and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances.

She will use the KES 99,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits. This will enable her to have enough stock to sell, hence increasing her profits.

Her business goal is to have a business with high returns within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will open a wholesale shop. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be optimistic.

She operates a restaurant where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances.

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

Her business goal is to have a hotel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Jedidah

texts.en:
Jedidah is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a farm where she grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to hire land to plant more vegetables.

She hopes that in the future, she will have a large-scale business. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to hire land to plant more vegetables.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He describes himself to be a risk-taker.

He operates a poultry farm. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transport challenges. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy a motorcycle for transporting poultry.

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transporting poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand the production area for beans, diversify his products, and plant corn and vegetables.

loans.name: Yahoska  De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Carismática, amistosa, generosa y perspicaz, son algunas de las cualidades de Yahoska, que la impulsaron a estudiar Tecnología Médica, pues desde esta área puede ayudar a las demás personas que sufren problemas de salud y, porque sin esta rama de la medicina, sería complicado diagnosticar con certeza.  Por eso, se esmera en aprender las herramientas necesarias en la universidad, ya que es una carrera que ama y además la hace crecer como persona. 

Yahoska cursa su último año universitario, gracias al apoyo de su papa y de su esposo, que la animan a mejorar la calidad de vida que lleva, pues también es madre de dos niños. Ella solicita el crédito para pagar los últimos módulos de titulación, que le permitirán ser  egresada. En consecuencia, podrá empezar su vida profesional y comenzar a recibir los frutos de todo su esfuerzo y dedicación.
texts.en:
Charismatic, friendly, generous, and insightful are some of Yahoska's qualities that motivated her to study medical technology, since from this area she can help other people who suffer from health problems, and because without this branch of medicine, it would be complicated to diagnose with certainty. For this reason, she has made a great effort to learn the necessary tools at the university, since it is a program that she loves, and furthermore it makes her grow as a person.

Yahoska is studying in her last year of the university, thanks to the support of her father and her husband, who encourage her to improve the quality of life that she lives, since she is also the mother of two children. She is applying for the loan to pay for the last courses for her degree, which will allow her to graduate. As a result, she will be able to begin her professional life and begin to receive the fruits of all her effort and dedication.

loans.use: to pay for the final courses for her degree

loans.name: Marina De La Paz

texts.es: Marina de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 5 años su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal, tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Marina is 62 years old. She lives in her own home with family members. For the past five years she has sold clothing. Her business is located in the municipal market. She has a number of regular clients because of the quality of clothing and good prices. With the sales she makes she is able to cover a few of the household expenses she has. Marina is requesting this loan to purchase more clothing in bulk, in order to be able to continue making her sales and thereby earning greater income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Unice

texts.en:
Unice is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be loyal. She operates a beauty salon. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with potential. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the price fluctuation of beauty products. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products. 

Her business goal is to open more business branches within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand the business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Franciscah

texts.en:
Franciscah is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be loyal. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. 

Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 3 years to 6 years. She describes herself to be loyal. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in an area with potential for growth, and her primary customers are regular. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a married man. He has six children, with ages ranging from 10 years to 30 years. He describes himself to be good. He operates a dairy farm where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for 30 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be climate change. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a dairy cow. 

He hopes that in the future he will improve his standard of living. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia is an 18-year-old single lady from Bethlehem city. She lives with her parents and three brothers and sisters in a simple house. Her father works as an employee in a local hotel. This is the only source of income for the family. Dalia is a university student where she studies Press and Media. She wants to complete her study and find a job to help her family with part of their expenses.

Dalia took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Dalia will complete her study faster.

Dalia appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Mayra Gisela

texts.es:
Mayra, de 34  años de edad, está casada y es madre de 1 hijo de 10 años de edad, que se encuentran estudiando educación básica.

Mayra, se dedica al comercio, es propietaria de un comedor que funciona todos los días de semana, en horario de 6:00 a.m. a 8:00 p.m. el cual es administrado por ella y su madre.- Mayra, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, tiene un excelente historial crediticio, es muy reconocida por las personas de su barrio, tiene mucha experiencia en el comercio, ya que cuando era muy joven, trabajo como empleada en una comercial y fue allí donde adquirió experiencia.- Posteriormente, decidió colocar su propio negocio, impulsado por su esposo y su padre; hasta el día de hoy se mantiene trabajando y con ayuda de su esposo llevan el sustento diario a su familia y garantizan los derechos fundamentales a su hijo.

Mayra, posee 10 años de experiencia en el comercio, tiene espíritu emprendedor, es una buena administradora, con la ayuda de créditos anteriores, ha logrado montar su segundo negocio, el cual es un bazar, donde vende ropa y productos de belleza.

El dinero de este préstamo será invertido para ampliar su negocio y comprar más mercadería, porque se acercan las fiestas patronales de su municipio, en donde llega mucha gente y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad para vender más producto.

Los sueños de Mayra son, ver a su hijo graduado de la universidad como ingeniero civil, porque esa es la profesión que su hijo quiere estudiar.
texts.en:
Mayra, 34 years old, is married and the mother of one son who is 10 years old and in school.

Mayra works in business. She is the owner of an eatery that is open every day of the week from 6:00am to 8:00pm and she and her mother run it. Mayra is a very hardworking and responsible person. She has an excellent credit history, is very recognized by the people of her neighborhood, and has a lot of business experience since when she was very young she worked as an employee at a store and it was there that she acquired her experience. Later, she decided to make her own business, driven by her husband and her father. To this day she keeps working and with the help of her husband they meet the daily needs of their family and guarantee the basic rights of their son.

Mayra has 10 years of experience in business, has an entrepreneurial spirit, and is a good manager. With the help of previous loans, she has been able to start her second business, which is a shop where she sells clothing and beauty products.

The money from this loan will be invested to expand her business and buy more merchandise because her town’s patronage festivals are coming up, a time when many people come, and she wants to take advantage of this opportunity to sell more product.

Mayra’s dreams are to see her son graduate from university as a civil engineer because that is the profession that her son wants to study.

loans.use: to expand her business and buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Jared

texts.en: Jared is a single man. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, rice, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inflation. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour, cooking fat and other items. He hopes that in the future, he will open more shops. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour, cooking fat and other items

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia is a married woman. She has eight children with ages ranging from two to 18 years old. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a retail business where she sells coconuts. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a busy market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to hire a pick-up to transport coconuts. Her business goal is to be the best coconut supplier in the region within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own her own pick up. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to hire a pick-up to transport coconuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en: Tabu is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be competent. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food to sell. Her business goal is to open a restaurant within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food to sell

loans.name: Marina Estella

texts.es: Marina de 63 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa de cama desde hace 20 años vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias, tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Marina vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa de cama por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Marina, 63 years old, has worked selling bed linens for 20 years on the streets of different towns. She has many regular customers for the quality of her linens and the good prices. With the sales she makes she is able to cover some of her household expenses. Marina lives in her own home with her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more wholesale bed linens in order to be able to continue selling and in that way have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale bed linens.

loans.name: Helida

texts.en: Helida is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be prosperous. She operates a chemist where she sells medicine. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of medicine. Her business goal is to have more shops within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of medicine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of auto spare parts

loans.name: Maqsood

texts.en: Maqsood has successfully built her business of animal sales and selling milk with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her sixth loan and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another cow. This will enable her to increase her milk sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to increase her milk sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.name: Parandzem

texts.en:
Parandzem is a nice woman from Pshatavan village, Armavir region. She lives there with her husband and four children: three daughters and a son. Her four children attend the local school and Parandzem and her husband run a farm. They keep livestock of six cows, 11 calves, 19 piglets and hens, and they cultivate apricots and grapes. Parandzem's husband helps her to sell the gathered harvest locally. 

To purchase seeds, fertilizer and forage for feeding the livestock, Parandzem has applied for this loan. 
 
She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, Parandzem was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to take an English course.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor, de 36 años de edad, está egresada de la carrera de Medicina de una universidad, está soltera, creció con su madre quien le inculco buenos principios y prácticas.

Flor, estudia específicamente la carrera de Odontología, de lunes a viernes realiza su servicio social y los días libres se dedica trabajar en un consultorio de odontología, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, que cuenta con un excelente historial de crédito, ya que gracias a los financiamientos anteriores ha podido salir adelante con sus estudios.

Flor, tiene 2 años de experiencia en la realización de trabajos de odontológicos, ya que mientras se encontraba realizando su cuarto año de estudio, tuvo la oportunidad de un trabajo de medio tiempo, en una clínica que se encuentra en su municipio. 

El dinero de este crédito será para pagar los gastos de graduación y para comprar equipo odontológico, ya que ha comenzado a montar su propia clínica, en la cual pretende poner a disposición de sus servicios, para generar sus propios ingresos, además, cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana menor, que ya es enfermera.  

El sueño de Flor es, de equipar por completo su clínica odontológica, para poder prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. También, desea apoyar a sus padres en la reconstrucción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Flor, 36 years old, is a university graduate in the field of medicine. She is single and was raised by her mother who instilled good principles and practices in her.

Flor specifically studies dentistry. From Monday to Friday she does her social service and on her free days she works in a dental office. She is a very hardworking and responsible person who has an excellent credit history, since thanks to the previous funding she has been able to get ahead in her studies.

Flor has two years of experience in dental work, since when she was completing her fourth year of study she had the opportunity of a part-time job in a clinic in her town.

The money from this loan will be to pay her graduation expenses and to buy dental equipment, since she has started to put together her own clinic in which she hopes to offer her services to make her own income. In addition, she has the support of her younger sister who is already a nurse.

Flor’s dream is to completely equip her dental clinic to be able to provide better service to her customers. Also, she wants to support her parents in the rebuilding of their home.

loans.use: to pay her graduation expenses and buy dental equipment.

loans.name: Yesu Anaweza Group

texts.fr: Chibalonza est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise «Yesu Anaweza», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée a un commerçant, âgée de 42 ans, mère 10 enfants dont 8 étudient et 2 sont gosses. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des poissons frais dans le marché central de la ville depuis 10 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en poissons. Elle souhaite augmenter le capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Chibalonza is a shopkeeper and a member of the “Yesu Anaweza” banc villageois, a client of IMF Hekima. 

She is married to another shopkeeper who is 42 years old. She is the mother of 10 children, 8 of whom go to school, and 2 of whom are too young. She started her business with funds received from her husband. 

She has been selling fresh fish in the city's central market for 10 years. She will buy fish. She would like to increase her capital and educate and feed her children. 

She thanks Hekima for the support given to entrepreneurs who are not served by the traditional banking system.

loans.use: buy fish.

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel, de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, actualmente está acompañado y su pareja vende tamales y empanadas; tiene 3 hijos pero solo uno vive con él.

Daniel, trabaja como albañil y tambien es pescador desde hace más de 10 años, está actividad la aprendió de su hermano mayor.

El crédito es para comprar arena y cemento para construir un corredor en su casa.

Sus sueños son comprar un pickup para poder trasladar sus herramientas de trabajo y apoyar a su hijo para que estudie.
texts.en:
Daniel, 44 years old, studied until the seventh grade. Now he is married and his wife sells tamales and empanadas. He has three children but only one lives with him.

Daniel works as a builder and has also been a fisherman for over 10 years. He learned this business from his older brother.

The loan is to buy sand and cement to build a hallway in his house.

His dreams are to buy a pickup to be able to move his work tools, and to support his son in his studies.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement to build a hallway in his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Masa

texts.en:
Masa is a 25-year-old married woman from Nablus city. She lives with her husband and one small son. Her husband is an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income is barely covering all their family needs. 

Masa is a student in a local college where she studies nursing. This is her last year, and she will graduate and be able to find a job. 

Masa has applied for a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university fee installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Masa will be able to complete her studies and find a job faster.

loans.use: to pay the university fee installments for this semester.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a secure, convenient place, and her primary customers are regular. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be the rainy season, which affects business. She will use the 80,000 KES loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to open more businesses within five years. She hopes that in the future, the business will be able to cater for the family's needs. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Carlos David

texts.es:
Carlos, de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, el motivo por el cual ya no continuo estudiando, fue porque su padre era una persona de edad muy avanzada y su salud comenzó a empeorar hasta que falleció, fue desde ese momento que tomo la responsabilidad de su casa, para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.- Desde entonces se dedicó a los trabajos de agricultura y al destazo de cerdos. 

Carlos, tiene 15 años de experiencia de trabajar en la agricultura, esta actividad la aprendió de su padre, quien con mucho orgullo trabajaba y cultivaba la tierra.- En la actualidad, se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras y productos básicos, todos los fines de semana se dedica al destazo de cerdo, la cual se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, con ayuda de su pareja y sus 2 hijos.

El dinero será utilizado para ampliar su negocio de venta de verduras, de esta forma mejorara su negocio y sus ingresos. 

Carlos, sueña con tener un vehículo que le sirva para trasportar su mercadería y salir a vender verduras a otros caseríos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 44 years old and studied until the 4th grade.  The reason that he didn't continue studying after that is that his father was elderly and his health started to deteriorate until he died.  From that moment, he took responsibility for the household to satisfy the needs of his family.  Since then, he has made a living farming and butchering pigs.  

Carlos has 15 years of experience farming and he learned the business from his father who very proudly worked and cultivated the land.  Presently, he makes a living buying and selling vegetables and basic products.  On the weekends, he butchers pigs, which has turned into his principal source of income, with the help of his partner and their 2 children.

The money from the loan will be used to expand his vegetable selling business and therefore improve his business and his income.  

Carlos dreams of having a vehicle that he could use to transport his merchandise and go out to sell vegetables in other small villages.

loans.use: to expand his vegetable selling business

loans.name: Zakiya

texts.en:
Zakiya is a Kiva borrower. She has four children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a residential area, and her primary customers are locals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation of prices. 

She will use the 80,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to have a retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a comfortable life. 

This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a favourable area, and his primary customers are of all types. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in weather. 

He will use the 25,000 KES loan to repair his motorcycle. His business goal is to be self-reliant within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Jehan

texts.en:
Jehan is a 25-year-old single lady from a village near Jenin city. She lives with her parents in a simple house. Her father works as a teacher in a public school where he earns a very low income. Jehan is a university student where she studies social science. She wants to complete her studies and find a job to help her family with part of their expenses.

Jehan took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Jehan will complete her studies faster.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Rosa Alba

texts.es:
Rosa, desempeña como actividad económica cultivo de granos básicos y crianza de ganado, es divorciada, vive con su hijo de 13 años, solo él depende de ella, trabaja de seis de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, para realizar alguno de sus trabajos en ocasiones contrata mozos, ya tiene mucha experiencia en el negocio, lo aprendió dentro de su familia desde que tenía 15 años de edad, hasta la fecha no representa dificultades.
Comprará un ternero, cerdos y concentrado para alimentar a los animales, fortalecerá el negocio y pondrá en práctica la crianza de cerdos en busca de nuevos ingresos para ir cambiando el estilo de vida familiar y cancelar su deuda. El riesgo son enfermedades de las cuales pueden llegar a contagiarse los animales.
Rosa sueña con ver a su hijo convertido en un profesional y mantener con vida su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa grows basic grains and raises livestock for a living.  She is divorced and she lives with her 13-year-old son, who is the only one who depends on her.  She works from 6 in the morning to 4 in the afternoon, and occasionally she hires young people to carry out some of her work.  She has a lot of experience with this business and she started learning it from her family when she was 15 years old.  To date she has not had any difficulty with it.  

She will buy a calf, pigs, and feed for the animals to strengthen her business and start raising pigs to seek out more income so that she can go about changing the lifestyle of her family and eliminating her debt.  The risk involved comes from the fact that the animals could possibly get sick.  

Rosa dreams of seeing her son become a professional and keeping her business alive.

loans.use: to buy a calf, pigs, and feed for the animals, strengthening her business and allowing her to seek out a new source of income

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахнозе 35 лет. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Дочери 14 лет, сыну 7 лет. Шахноза работает бухгалтером в государственных органах Республики. Параллельно она дома занимается шитьем. Шахноза на данный момент учится в Государственном Университете Торговли Таджикистана на четвертом курсе на экономиста. Шахноза прекрасно знает свою работу и хочет получить диплом по своей деятельности, чтобы сохранить работу. Ее обучение в Университете является платным и Шахноза не имеет достаточно средств для оплаты учебы, потому она обратилась за кредитом. Если она не оплатит учебный контракт, она не будет допущена к учебе. Шахноза надеется, что ей помогут сохранить учебу и работу.
texts.en: Shahnoza is 35 years old and she is married with two children.  Her daughter is 14 and her son is seven.  She works as a bookkeeper in a government office of her republic and she also works as a seamstress from home.  Shahnoza is currently a fourth-year economics student at the Tajik State Trade University.  She knows her work very well and wants to earn a diploma in her speciality so she can maintain this work.  Her studies at the university are on a fee-paying basis and Shahnoza doesn't have enough money to pay her tuition, which is why she has asked for a loan.  If she doesn't pay her tuition, she won't be able to keep up with her studies.  Shahnoza hopes that she will receive help to continue her studies and her work.

loans.use: to pay her tuition

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is a married woman. She has four children. She operates a farm where she grows coffee, tea, and cereals. Her business is located in a favorable area. She describes her biggest business challenge as changes in weather. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will prosper. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Ulder

texts.en:
Ulder is a married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 12 years to 22 years. She describes herself as dedicated. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 17 years. Her business is located in a suitable place and her primary customers are of all kinds. 

She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that, in the future, she will succeed in business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as kind. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. 

She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of shoes. Her business goal is to have a large shoe store within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will grow her business and educate her children. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more shoes

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 3 years to 14 years. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are locals. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to be a cereals supplier within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Hurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед  молодой человек который живет со своими родителями. Ему 29 лет и он еще не женат.  Занимается Хуршед разведением и выращиванием скота.  Доход от своего занятие он тратит на жизнь и по немногу хочет  увеличить поголовье скота для того , чтобы увеличить доход своей семьи и для того чтобы улучшить жилищьные условия чтобы создать  свою семью.   Зима подходит к концу и накопленные запасы кормов заканчиваются и Хуршед хочет взять кредит для приобретения кормов  до наступления весны. Хуршед по совету знакомых обратился в «Арванд». Суммы 500 сомони ему будет достаточно чтобы закупить корма.
texts.en: Hurshed is a young man who lives with his parents.  He is 29 years old and not yet married.  He breeds and raises livestock.  Hurshed uses the income from this work to support himself and he wants to make a slight increase in his head of livestock so he can increase his family's income and so he can improve their living conditions so he will be able to start his own family.  Winter is coming to an end and his feed stores are dwindling, so Hurshed wants to get a loan to buy some feed for the spring.  He turned to Arvand on the advice of friends.  A sum of 500 somoni will be enough for him to buy feed.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Nasriddin

texts.ru: Насриддин не молодой житель района Шахритус. Ему 51 год. Насриддин вместе с сыном занимаются ремонтом домов и растениеводством. Насриддин хочет заниматься купля продажей скотин, чтобы приносить дополнительный доход. Семья Насриддина живет в доме без условий и находятся в тяжелом финансовом положении. Он и так работает на двух работах и теперь хочет купить 2 бычков, откормить их и перепродать с наценкой через месяц. Насриддин старается, чтобы его семья была сыта и тепло одета. Он очень надеется, что ему не откажут в кредите, и он сможет купить бычков и принести в дом источник дохода.
texts.en: Nasriddin is an elderly resident of Shahrituz.  He is 51 years old and he repairs houses and raises crops with his son.  He wants to buy and sell livestock as a means of earning extra income.  Nasriddin's family lives at home without any resources and they are in dire financial straits.  As such, Nasriddin works two jobs and now he wants to buy two bulls to fatten and resell at a markup after a month.  He works hard to make sure his family is fed and well-clothed and he sincerely hopes that he won't be refused for a loan so that he will be able to buy bulls to bring a new source of income to his family.

loans.use: to start a new business and buy bulls

loans.name: Margaritas De La 16 Group

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer de 46 años de edad, soltera, tiene 1 hijo varón de 10 años y 3 hijas mujeres de 25, 20 y 15 años, y su negocio es la venta de viveres y otros artículos de cocina.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, amable, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en diferentes ferias de la ciudad como ‘la feria 16 de julio’ un área considerada las más grande del país, se remonta a los años 60 junto con la migración campesina y minera que se registró más de dos décadas antes de que fuera catalogada como ciudad. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Sandra es de tez morena, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, ojos obscuros, complexión física robusta, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español para el comercio (al centro en la fila de atrás, usa chompa verde y blusa negra). Su vida la comparte con sus 4 hijos, las hijas mayores trabajan y estudian, los hijos menores estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su sueño por mejorar su negocio la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de quinua, venta de comida, librería, tienda de barrio y carnicería para solicitar un préstamo y cumplir sus metas de superación. Su negocio es la venta de víveres y artículos de cocina como; harina, aceite, arroz, azúcar, ollas, sartenes, juego de cubiertos, etc., labor que realiza en diferentes ferias dela ciudad a diferentes horas del día y también realiza entregas a  domicilio. “en época de lluvias me es difícil desplazarme por la ciudad a entregar mi mercadería, después mi negocio es bastante tranquilo…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes y vender por mayor, ella desea aumentar su oferta de productos realizando la compra de variedad de abarrotes por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Sandra solicita un préstamo para aumentar la oferta de productos en su negocio y algún día cumplir su sueño de tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 46-year-old single mother who has a 10-year-old son and 3 daughters who are 25, 20, and 15 years old.  Her business is selling supplies and other kitchen goods.  She is a good mother and entrepreneur who is independent, friendly, responsible, and hard-working.  She carries out her business at different markets in the city such as the 16th of June Market, and area considered one of the largest in the country.  It dates back to the migration of farmers and miners in the 60s and was recorded more than 2 decades before the area was classified as a city.  The climate is cold and dry with a temperature that varies during the day from 0 to 12°C.

Sandra has a dark complexion, long brown hair that she ties up in a ponytail, and dark eyes, with a sturdy build and short stature.  Her maternal tongue is Aymará, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish when doing business.  In the photo, she is in the center of the back line wearing a black blouse and a green sweater.  She shares her life with her 4 children.  The older daughters work and study and the younger children study at school.  They live in a rented apartment with potable water, electricity, gas and plumbing.

Her dream of improving her business led her to head a bank made up of business owners so that she could take out a loan and fulfill her goal of improvement.   Some members are involved in clothing sales, cosmetics sales, and quinoa sales and others run a bookstore, corner store and butcher shop. Her business is selling supplies and kitchen goods such as flour, oil, rice, sugar, pots, pans, and cutlery sets, among other things, which she has been doing in various city markets at different times of the day.  She also makes home deliveries.  She comments that except for during the rainy season when it's difficult for her to get around the city to deliver her merchandise, the business is fairly calm.  Her dream is to have a grocery store and sell wholesale.  She is requesting a loan to increase the amount of products that she offers in her business and buy a variety of wholesale grocery items.  One day she would like to fulfill her goal of owning a store.  This is her first cycle of loans with the institution in the 15 years that she has been doing this business.

loans.use: to increase the amount of products that she offers in her business and one day accomplish her dream of having a store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a farm where he grows crops and keeps dairy cows. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

He will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more farm inputs. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will own a big farm. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more farm inputs

loans.name: Jenerica

texts.en:
Jenerica is a married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 17 years to 29 years. She describes herself to be honest. 

She operates a restaurant where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to own a big restaurant within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Las experiencias buenas siempre nos conducen a sentirnos felices; ese es el caso de Elsa, una mujer que a sus 36 años ha sabido salir adelante para lograr el bienestar de su familia. Ella agradece a Kiva y a Mi Crédito porque gracias al crédito que se le brindo pudo invertir en la compra de productos para su pulpería, entre ellos, arroz, azúcar, aceite, dulces, jugos, etc. esto con el objetivo de atraer a más clientes y obtener más ganancias. 
Una vez más, Elsa solicita el crédito para surtir la mercadería  de su negocio, y esta vez, comprar papel higiénico, huevos, productos lácteos, etc. siempre con el objetivo de crecer y tener una economía prospera. Elsa, pretende al finalizar los pagos de su crédito optar a otro crédito para la mejora de su vivienda con el objetivo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Good experiences always make us feel happy.  This is true in the case of Elsa, a 36-year-old woman who has known how to get ahead and secure the wellbeing of her family.  She is thankful to Kiva and Mi Crédito because thanks to the loan that they provided she was able to make an investment in her business and buy products for her grocery store such as rice, sugar, oil, candy, and juice, with the objective of attracting more clients and increasing her earnings.  

Once again, she is requesting a loan to supply her business with merchandise, and this time she wants to buy toilet paper, eggs, and dairy products, among other things, always with the intention of growing her business and a supporting a prosperous economy.  Elsa intends to finish the payments on her loan and opt for another loan for the improvement of her home so that she can benefit from better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy toilet paper, eggs, and dairy products, among other things

loans.name: Bety Maritza

texts.es:
Bety, vive con su familia integrada por su madre y sus hijos, con el compromiso de sacar a sus hijos adelante hace mucho tiempo decidió fundar una pupusería, de esa forma estaría generando ingresos para costear los gastos de su hogar, ella trabaja todos los días sin un horario establecido.
El crédito que solicita lo utilizara para comprar una plancha más grande para aumentar la productividad de pupusas, esto le servirá para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes en menor tiempo, espera que su situación financiera tenga un cambio positivo y que sea de beneficio para toda la familia.
Bety anhela brindar a su familia una vida más digna y contar siempre con su negocio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Bety lives with her family, which is made up of her mother and her children.  With the commitment of getting her children ahead in life, she decided a long time ago to open a pupusería to bring in income to pay for household expenses.  She works every day without an established schedule.  

She will use the loan that she is requesting to buy a bigger grill to increase the productivity of her pupusa-making operation. A pupusa is a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans.  This will allow her to fulfill the demand of her clients in the short-term.  She hopes that there will be a positive change in her financial situation and that it will be beneficial for her whole family.  Bety longs to provide her family with a more dignified life and to always be able count on her business at the market.

loans.use: to buy a bigger grill to increase the productivity of her pupusa-making operation

loans.name: Emmaculate

texts.en:
Emmaculate is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a suitable place, and her primary customers are the general public. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a  Kiva borrower. She has three children. She describes herself to be faithful. She operates a carpentry business where she sells furniture. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are regular. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the 70,000 KES loan to buy more stock of carpentry materials. Her business goal is to open more business outlets within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of carpentry materials

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 43 years old. She lives with her family in the small village of Dighomi, near the capital of Georgia. Her husband's salary is the only source of income for the family; he is working as a physical worker. The family decided to build a greenhouse and grow tomatoes, but they could not finish the building process. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,500 GEL. With the received credit, Tamar will purchase all the needed materials to finish the building process and will also purchase a cow. 

As the greenhouse is built, she will grow tomatoes there to sell. Tamar will also milk the cow and produce dairy products every day. This will give her a chance to generate income and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to finish building the greenhouse and purchase a cow

loans.name: Charo

texts.en:
Charo is a married man. He describes himself to be honest and God-fearing. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a marketable place, and his primary customers are individuals. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. 

He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a successful business and family. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. 

He will use the anticipated profits to expand to a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 43 años de edad se dedica desde hace 30 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y maicillo, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en casa propia, Jorge está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jorge is 43 years old and for 30 years has made a living in farming. He grows corn and sorghum, selling his products in the different markets near to his home. Jorge lives with his wife and two children in a house owned by the family.

Jorge is applying for a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-pest treatments and more to improve his land, shown in the photograph. This loan will allow Jorge to continue with his work and to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-pest treatments and more to improve his land.

loans.name: Nuevo Avance Group

texts.es:
Rebeca es una mujer de 49 años de edad, vive con su pareja, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de desayunos, jugos de fruta y empanadas.
Ella es emprendedora, paciente, optimista, solidaria, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en un mercado de la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por el crecimiento constante de su población; originarios de tribus nómadas del lugar como ‘Los Ayoreos’ y mineros relocalizados del occidente del país que hicieron de este sitio su hogar y que en su segunda generación abarrotaron un comercio y manufactura constante en todas las áreas, de clima cálido tropical, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-38 grados centígrados.
Rebeca es de tez negra, cabello negro corto rizado, estatura mediana, ojos negros, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el ayoreo que habla en familia y habla español por el comercio que realiza (sentada al centro, usa blusa amarilla y mandil celeste). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de comida, servicio de transporte, venta de verduras, taller de cerrajería, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de pollo frito y panadería, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus actividades económicas. Su negocio es la venta de desayunos, cada mañana antes de que salga el sol ella se ocupa de preparar sus típicos desayunos como; el tujuré hecho a base de maíz y acompañado por un cuñapé a base de harina de arroz con queso todo se sirve caliente, o en su defecto un somó a base de maíz, se sirve frio y con una empanada de queso, la oferta es muy atractiva para sus clientes que se sirven las bebidas de pie si es que no encuentran donde sentarse. “los desayunos son parte de la tradición lugareña, ya sea frio o caliente, se terminan todo lo que preparo a diario…” comenta. Su sueño es abrir un snack grande en su mismo domicilio, ella desea realizar la compra de mesas, sillas e insumos de cocina como maíz, harina y otros para ampliar su negocio e incrementar sus ventas. Esta es la 6 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Rebeca solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas, sillas e insumos de cocina para incrementar sus ventas y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rebeca is 49 years old and lives with her partner. She has no children. Rebeca has a business selling breakfasts, fruit juices, and pastries.

Rebeca is enterprising, patient, optimistic, supportive, responsible and hard-working. She runs her business at a market in the “Plan 3000” area of Santa Cruz, which has a population size that is constantly growing. Originally populated by nomadic tribes, such as “Los Ayoreos”, miners who relocated to Santa Cruz from the west of Bolivia have had children, and this second generation began trading and manufacturing work. With a tropical climate, the daily temperature here oscillates between 18 and 38º Celsius.

Rebeca has dark skin, and short, frizzy black hair. She is of medium height and has dark eyes and a robust physique. Her native language is Ayoreo, which she speaks with her family. She also speaks Spanish for her work. In the photo, Rebeca is wearing a yellow shirt and blue apron.

Rebeca shares her life with her partner, a builder. The couple lives in a room built with bricks, and with a roof made of metal sheeting. Their home has running water, electricity, and is connected to the sewer system.

Rebeca’s desire to get ahead has brought her to lead a communal bank, comprising members who have the following businesses: transport services, selling vegetables, a locksmith’s workshp, selling second-hand clothing, selling fried chicken, and a bakery. The group has come together in order to apply for a loan and for the members to expand their businesses.

Rebeca herself makes a living selling breakfasts. Every morning, before the sun comes up, Rebeca is busy preparing typical breakfasts, such as “tujuré” (a corn-based drink), served with a “cunñapé” (a small roll made with rice flour and cheese, and served hot). This is a popular item for customers, who eat and drink standing up, as there is nowhere to sit.

Rebeca says, “Breakfasts are part of local tradition, and, whether it is hot or cold, I always sell out.” Rebeca’s dream is to open a big eatery in her house. 

Rebeca wants to buy chairs, tables and ingredients, such as corn and flour, to increase sales and expand her business.

This is Rebeca’s sixth loan with Emprender in the five years that she has been doing this work.

Rebeca is applying for a loan in order to buy chairs, tables and kitchen supplies to increase sales and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables and ingredients to increase sales and expand her business.

loans.name: Ana Dilia

texts.es:
Ana, vive solo con una hija, tiene más hijos pero ellos ya no dependen de ella porque tienen su propia fuente de ingresos, se encuentra soltera, tiene un comedor desde hace cinco años, la ubicación del negocio es muy favorable para las ventas, cuenta con dos empleadas que le ayudan a servir la comida, la amabilidad con que atienden a sus clientes hace que ellos se mantengan fiel a su negocio.
Invertirá en pollo, carnes, frijoles, arroz, pastas, verduras, bebidas, etc., para ofrecer nuevos platillos de comida a sus clientes, espera contar con la satisfacción de los clientes, incrementar sus ventas y utilidades para reducir las necesidades de su familia y lograr tener buena calificación en el uso de créditos.
Ana aspira a contratar más empleados y tener un negocio que cubra las demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana lives with one of her daughters. She has other children but they now earn their own income and do not depend on their mother. Ana is single. She has had a restaurant for five years. Well-located and with good sales, Ana has two employees who help to serve the meals. Ana’s friendliness with customers makes them loyal to her business.

Ana will use this loan to buy chicken, meat, beans, rice, pastas, vegetables, soft drinks and more in order to offer new types of meals to customers. Ana hopes that customers will be satisfied. She wants to increase sales and profits in order to cover family expenses and to obtain a good credit rating. 

Ana aspires to hiring more employees and of having a business where she can meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, beans, rice, pastas, vegetables, soft drinks and more in order to offer new types of meals to customers.

loans.name: Ana Yamileth

texts.es:
Ana, de 24 años de edad, es una joven con excelentes principios morales, estudio hasta noveno grado y está soltera. 

Ana, se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su hogar, también a la venta de yuca, enchiladas, pastelitos, turrones y frescos naturales por las mañanas, en la unidad de salud de su comunidad.- Además, los fines de semana hace pupusas para vender, actualmente vive junto a sus padres, quienes son personas muy humildes y trabajadoras, que se dedican a la venta de tortillas.

Ana, tiene 10 años de experiencia en realizar ventas y hacer pupusas, esta actividad la aprendió de su madre, de esta forma ella ha podido salir adelante y ha podido costear sus propios gastos y ser independiente de sus padres.

El dinero será utilizado para la compra de una refrigeradora, para guardar los productos de su venta, ya que con créditos anteriores ha equipado su cocina y los ha pagado de una marera muy responsable y puntual.    
 
Los sueños y metas de Ana son, montar una venta de comida que funcione de lunes a viernes, lo hará con ayuda de su madre.- También, desea  apoyar a su sobrina con sus estudios hasta que finalice.
texts.en:
Ana is 24 years old and has strong moral principles. She has a ninth grade education, and is single.

Ana looks after the household chores at her home. She also makes a living selling yucca, enchiladas, pastries, sweets, and fresh juices at her local health centre in the morning. In addition, Ana sells “pupusas” (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans) at the weekends. 

Ana lives with her parents, humble and hard-working people who earn a living selling tortillas.

Ana has ten years’ experience preparing and selling “pupusas”. She learned the trade from her mother and, with it, she has been able to get ahead, cover her own expenses, and be independent from her parents.

This loan will be used to buy a fridge to store her products. Ana has used previous loans to equip her kitchen, paying back her loans responsibly and on time.

Ana’s goals and dreams are to start a business selling meals. The business would be open from Monday to Friday and Ana would work with the help of her mother. Ana also wants to support her niece with her education.

loans.use: to buy a fridge to store her products.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 38 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 6 filhos maiores de idade, apenas 1 frequenta a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém. 
Trabalha como segurança a mais de 9 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Na tentativa de satisfazer os seus clientes solicita um empréstimo para aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo mantas (cobertores) para venda. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo na hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior. O seu maior desafio é terminar com a sua obra.
texts.en:
The borrower is 38 years old and was born in Maputo's Namaacha province. He is a married father to six grown-up children, of which only 1 attends school, and he is not financially responsible for anyone else.
He has worked as a security guard for more than 9 years and he uses his income from this role to cover the family's domestic expenses. He is applying for a loan to buy blankets to sell as part of his side-business in an attempt to satisfy his customers' requirements. This is his third loan with Hluvuku and, in the future, he hopes to ensure that his children will be able to complete their college education. The greatest challenge that he faces is finishing the building work he has already started on his home.

loans.use: to buy blankets to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Inhambane tem 72 anos de idade, vive maritalmente mãe de 3 filhos todos maiores de idade, responsabiliza-se pelos seus 2 netos que vivem em sua casa.
É avicultura a mais de 8 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Solicita o presente empréstimo para aumentar o volume do seu negócio de criação de frangos adquirindo pintos, ração e vitaminas.
Futuramente pretende ampliar o volume do seu negócio de criação de frangos e de flores.
texts.en: Born in Inhambane, Rosa is a 72 year old married mother to 3 grown-up children and she has financial responsibility for her 2 grandchildren who live with her. She has been raising chickens for the last 8 years and she uses the income from this work to cover her domestic expenses. She is applying for this loan so that she can increase the size of her business by buying chicks, feed and vitamins. In the future, she hopes to further expand the size of her business by raising more chickens and growing more flowers to sell.

loans.use: to buy chicks, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Adriano

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Maputo tem 38 anos de idade, casado oficialmente pai de 5 filhos menores de idade, responsabiliza-se pela sua sobrinha, tia, e prima que vivem em sua casa. 
Trabalha num Colégio como auxiliar a mais de 6 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com o valor solicitado pretende dar continuidade a sua obra de residência adquirindo material de construção como: areia, cimento, pedras e varões. 
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência e garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
Adriano was born in Maputo and is 38 years old. He is a married father to 5 young children and he is also financially responsible for his aunt, his niece and his cousin who live with him.
He has worked as an office assistant in a college for the last 6 years where he earns a wage which covers his household expenses. He plans to use this loan to buy building materials, such as sand, cement, stone and rods to continue with the building work that he has started on his home. In the future, he hopes to finish the building work and ensure that his children go on to complete their college education.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as sand, cement, stone and rods.

loans.name: Rinoris

texts.es: Rinoris recibe una renta mensual por concepto de arrendamiento de dos apartamentos de su propiedad. De allí genera ingresoa para el sostenieminto de ella y su familia, conformada por ella y sus tres hijos adultos.  Desde hace 23 años inició este negocio cuando ocurrió la separación de su esposo, pues debió generar ingresos para lograr el bienestar de su hogar. Inicialmente se fue a vivir donde sus padres y puso un aviso : "Se arrienda" en la casa donde habitaba, la cual posteriormente dividió en dos apartamentos que alquiló generando mas ingresos. Estos bienes deben mantenerse en condiciones optimas protegiendo la imagen y seguridad de los inquilinos actuales y potenciales. En la actualidad está aplicando a unc redikiva, primer finaciamiento  que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materiales de construcción, para hacer adecuaciones locativas en sus bienes y con ello despertar el deseo de habitar en ellos y conservarlos, en clientes reales y potenciales. Rinoris en condicion de mujer separada vivió su máximo desafio de vida y fue justamente en el moemnto en el cual se separó de su cónyuge. Hoy ha salido poco a poco adelante observando sus propios recursos y poniendolos a funcionar de manera independiente. Actualmente tiene el gran sueño de que sus hijos se profesionalicen y tengan éxito y es porque ellos son justamente el motor de su vida.
texts.en:
Rinoris receives monthly rent from two apartments she rents out on her propriety.  This is how she receives enough income to sustain herself and her family. Her family is made up of herself and her three, adult children.  She started this business 23 years ago, which is when she got separated from her husband.
