She had to generate an income to ensure the well-being of her family. Initially, she went to live with her parents and put a "For Rent" sign on the house where she lived.  Later, she divided the space into two apartments to generate more income.  These apartments need to stay in perfect conditions to maintain a good image and safety for her current and future tenants.

Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing she does with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which she is doing to buy construction materials. She will use the materials to renovate the apartments and that way awaken the desire to live in these homes and to maintain them for the real and potential clients. 

Rinoris, as a separated woman, lived the biggest challenge of her live, which was when she got separated from her spouse. Today, she has moved forward little by little, taking care of her resources and making them work independently. Currently, her dream is that her children become professionals and are successful, as they are the motor of her life.

loans.use: to buy consturction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 5 años a la pesca artesanal, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de redes y trasmallos para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young woman whose face is pixelated in this photo is 29 years old and lives in a high risk area. For five years she has earned a living with traditional fishing. She sells her produce in the different markets close to her house. She lives in her own house with her partner and she is asking for this loan to buy nets and trammel nets in order to earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy nets and trammel nets.

loans.name: Jesus Evelyn

texts.es:
La socia Jesus Evelyn pertenece al banco comunal VELASCO ASTETE, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Jesús  Evelyn continua con su  negocio de venta de  productos de belleza como colonias, cremas, perfumes entre otros, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo a  pedido a sus amistades, familiares, entre otros siendo de esta manera que la socia saca  adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para  la compra de colonias para su negocio.
texts.en:
Communal bank member Jesus Evelyn belongs to the communal bank "Velasco Astete." The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.

Member Jesús Evelyn continues with her business of selling beauty products such as colognes, creams, and perfumes, among other items. She feels grateful for the loan granted and she promises to make the established payments. She continues selling on demand to her friends and family members, among others, since this is the way she is raising her family.

She applied for the loan to purchase colognes for her business.

loans.use: to buy colognes for her business.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio de 47 años de edad desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar la tierra, por lo que se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijol desde hace varios años, el vive con sus dos hijos en casa propia, Antonio desea invertir en insumos para su cultivo, ya que a su trabajo es como logra salir adelante, para ello solicita un crédito para la compra de semillas, controles de plagas, fertilizante, abono, herbicidas y mejorar el terreno donde desea hacer sus siembras que es el que muestra la fotografía, y así poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Antonio is 47 years old. From a young age he learned to work the land and so for years he has earned a living growing corn and beans. He lives with his two children in his own house. Antonio wants to invest in supplies for his farming as his work helps him to get ahead in life, so for this he is asking for a loan to buy seeds, infestation controls, fertiliser, manure, weed-killers and to improve the land where he hopes to sow the seeds, the land that is shown in this photo. This way he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, infestation controls, fertiliser, manure, weed-killer and to improve his land.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PRIMAVERA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Justina ella es soltera y tiene 67 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de internet, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de farmacia.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the 'PRIMAVERA' communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, also in the province and department of Cusco.

One of the members is Justina, she is single and is 67 years old and has two children. She works in the grocery store business. She sells basic products such as rice, sugar, milk and biscuits. She works from 8am to 7pm and she has been doing this for 5 years and the business is going well. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. She is asking for this loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and biscuits.

The other members earn a living selling clothes, in internet sales, in a grocery store and in a pharmacy. 

This member thanks those who form part of her dream through these means and is committed to making the repayments in the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and biscuits.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La socia Florentina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere que sus hijos que terminen de estudiar, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant grande. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras, arroz y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Florentina continues working in her business selling meals. She is an enterprising woman who, through her business, wants her children to finish their schooling. The member's dream is to have a large restaurant. She asks for the loan to purchase chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.

Yony continues working at her business selling clothing and her business selling furniture. She is a hard-working woman who, through this business, wants to get ahead. She asks for the loan to purchase jackets, blouses, and pants.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to purchase jackets, blouses, and pants.

La socia Mizraim Frecia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos naturales, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora y por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de productos naturales. El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Hugo continues to work at his transportation business, he provides taxi service. He is a hard-working person who, through his work, gets his family ahead. His dream is to purchase a van. The member asks for the loan to purchase tires for his car.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to make the payments.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Agripina continues working selling food supplements. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman and, through this business, she wants to get ahead. She asks for the loan to purchase food supplements.

loans.name: Sol Y Luna Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL Y LUNA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mercedes ella es soltero y tiene 48 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maiz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de fotocopiadora, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Sol y Luna" communal bank group. This bank is located in Cusco district, part of Cusco province and Cusco department. 

Mercedes is single and is 48 years old with 4 children. She works in a business selling grains. She sells corn, wheat, and quinoa, and works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. She has been in this business for 4 years and it is going well for her. The member's dream is to have a retail space where she can sell her grains. She asks for the loan to purchase wheat, corn, and quinoa. 

The other members work in a photocopy business, a grocery store, and selling meals. 

She is grateful to those who form a part of this dream through this platform and promises to make her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, corn and quinoa.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia Juana  se sigue dedicando al negocio de artesania,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora y por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde pueda vender las artesanias. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana continues with her craft business. She is an enterprising and determined woman and, through this business, wants to get ahead. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her crafts. She asks for the loan to purchase woven fabric, sweaters, and weaving.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to purchase woven fabrics, sweaters, and weaving.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
La socia Zenaida  se sigue dedicando al negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelnate a su familia, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Zenaida is still working in her artisan crafts business. She sells fabric, sweaters, blankets, and looms. With this business, she wants to provide for her family. Her dream is to expand her business selling fabric and looms. She is applying for a loan to buy fabric, sweaters, and looms.

She is happy about this loan and she promises to comply with her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy fabric, sweaters, and looms.

texts.es:
El socio Zenon se sigue dedicando al negocio de artesania, el socio vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, el socio vende diferentes tejidos, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.


El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Zenon is still working in his artisan crafts business. He sells fabric, sweaters, blankets, and looms. He sells various types of fabric. He works from 8:00am to 7:00pm. He has had this business for 8 years and it is going very well. His dream is to expand his business selling fabric and looms. He is applying for a loan to buy fabric, sweaters, and looms.

He is happy about this loan and he promises to comply with his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy fabric, sweaters and looms.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia Francisca se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cigarros y champus,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora y por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cigarros y champus.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Francisca is still working in her business selling cigars and "champus", a drink made of corn and fruit. She is an enterprising, hardworking woman. With this business, she wants to get ahead. Her dream is to have a grocery store. She is applying for a loan to buy cigars and champus.

She is happy about this loan and she promises to comply with her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy cigars and "champus" drinks.

loans.name: Musingi Bora Group

texts.fr: Songoro est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire «Musingi Bora», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un commerçant, âgée de 22 ans, mère 3 enfants dont 2 étudient et 1 est gosse. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des poissons fretins dans le marché central de la ville depuis 12 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner un sac de fretins. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish,  elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Songoro is a saleswoman and a member of the community bank "Musingi Bora". She is a client at IMF Hekima, 22 years old and married with three children of whom two go to school and one is a baby. Her husband is a salesman. She started her business with money that her husband gave to her. She has been selling small fried fish at the central market of the town for 12 years. She would like to buy a sack of small fish. She hopes to buy a plot of land, feed her children and send them to school. Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support of non bankable traders.

loans.use: To buy a sack of small fish.

loans.name: Yhasmany

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cigarrillos,el socio por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia.El socio solicita el credito para comprar cigarrillos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is still working in his business selling cigarettes. With this business, he wants to provide for his family. He is applying for a loan to buy cigarettes.

He is happy with this loan and he promises to comply with his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes.

loans.name: Plamedi Group

texts.fr: Nabuhindo est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Plamedi», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 23 ans, mère 3 enfants dont 1 étudie et 2 sont gosses. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse de friperies dans un marché de la ville depuis 2 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en un ballon de friperies. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses  enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en: Nabuhindo is a saleswoman and a member of the credit group "Plamedi". She is a client at IMF Hekima, 23 years old and married with three children of whom one goes to school and two are babies. She started her business with money that her husband gave to her. She has been selling secondhand clothing at a market in the town for two years. She intends to buy a bale of secondhand clothing. She hopes to increase her capital, feed her children and send them to school. Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support for non bankable traders. Please note that this client is carrying her baby.

loans.use: To stock up with a bale of secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Richard Jesus

texts.es:
El socio se dedica al negocio de mecanico,el socio arregla carros, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es abrir un taller de mecanica.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar aceites y parabrisas para arreglar los carros.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.

This borrower works in the business of auto maintenance. He repairs cars. He works from 8:00am until 5:00pm. He has already been in this business for several years and it is going very well. His dream is to open a mechanic shop. He is applying for a loan to buy oils and windshields to repair cars.

He is happy with this loan and he promises to comply with his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy oil and windshields to repair cars.

loans.name: Veronica

La socia Veronica se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos naturales,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora y por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos naturales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Veronica is still working in her business selling natural products. She is an enterprising, hardworking woman who wants to provide for her family with this business. She is applying for a loan to buy natural products.

She is happy with this loan and she promises to comply with her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Crisologo

texts.es:
El socio Crisologo se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa, el socio es una persona responsable que por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar casacas, blusas y pantalones.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Crisologo is still working in his business selling clothing. He is a responsible person who wants to get ahead with his business. He is applying for a loan to buy dress coats, shirts, and pants.

He is happy with this loan and promises to comply with his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy dress coats, shirts, and pants.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia Yolanda se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de materiales de escritorio como cuadernos, lapiceros y libros, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de útiles de escritorio. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuadernos, libros y lapiceros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yolanda is still working in her business selling office supplies such as notebooks, pencils, and books. She has had this business for several years and it is going very well. Her dream is to expand her business selling office materials. She is applying for a loan to buy notebooks, books, and pencils.

She is happy with this loan and she promises to comply with her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, books, and pencils.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
La socia Monica se sigue dedicando al negocio de asesora de inmobiliaria, la socia ya tiene varios años en este trabajo, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener un negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Monica is still working in her real estate consultancy business. She has had this job for several years. With this business, she wants to get ahead. Her dream is to have a business selling clothing. She is applying for a loan to buy a television for her house.

She is happy with this loan and she promises to comply with her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy a television for her house.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a married man. He has one child. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are of all types. 

He will use the 15,000 Kenya Shilling (KES) loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. His business goal is to open another business within five years. 

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Salama Group

texts.fr: La cliente Marie est une commerçante, conseillère d’un collectif de crédits «Salama», âgée de 58 ans, veuve, mère de 11 enfants dont 2 scolarisés et 9 sont mariés. Elle est vendeuse  des boissons, chez elle à domicile dans le centre ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter  des bieres Primus, Amstell et sucrées. Ainsi, elle souhaite renforcer son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux femmes entrepreneuses exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Marie is a saleswoman and the counsellor of a credit community named "Salama". She is 58 years old, a widow, and has 11 children of whom two go to school and nine are married. She sells beverages from her home in the town centre. She requests a loan from Hekima to expand her business. She will buy Primus and Amstell beers and sweet drinks. In this way she hopes to reinforce her capital and educate and feed her children. She thanks Hekima for their support of businesswomen who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: To buy Primus and Amstell beer and sweet beverages.

loans.name: Iem Virunga Group

texts.fr: Muluhirwa est un commerçant, membre d’une plateforme de credits «IEM Virunga», âgé de 40 ans, marié, père de 4 enfants dont 2 scolarisés et 2 sont gosses. Il est vendeur divers matériels de construction dans une avenue animée de la ville. Il sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Il va acheter des tôles, clous, fer a béton, vernis, etc. Ainsi, il souhaite continuer à scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Il remercie Hekima pour le soutien  apporté aux petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Muluhirwa is a tradesman and a member of the credit group named "IEM Virunga". He is 40 years old, married, and has four children of whom two go to school and two are babies. He sells various construction materials in a busy street in the town. He requests a loan from Hekima to expand his business. He will buy sheet metal, nails, irons for concrete, varnish, etc. In this way he hopes to continue educating and feeding his children. He thanks Hekima for their support for small businesses who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: To buy sheet metal, nails, irons for concrete, varnish, etc.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a married man. He has three children. 

He operates a retail business where he sells sufurias, basins, plates, and cups. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenya Shilling (KES) loan to buy more stock of basins, plates, cups, and other items. His business goal is to be a supplier of the items he sells to retailers within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of basins, plates, cups and other items

loans.name: Hope Group

texts.fr: La cliente Maliro est une commerçante, trésorière d’un groupe solidaire «Hope», âgée de 34 ans, mariée, mère de 2 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse divers appareils électroniques dans un magasin de la ville et s’entraide avec son mari. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour renforcer son capital. Elle va acheter  des postes radios, téléviseurs, chaines musicales, lecteurs DVD, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux femmes entrepreneuses exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Maliro is a saleswoman, and treasurer of the credit group named "Hope". She is 34 years old, married, and has two children who both go to school. She sells various electric appliances in a shop in the town and helps her husband. She requests a loan from Hekima to reinforce her capital. She will buy radios, televisions, hi-fi systems, DVD players, etc. In this way she hopes to buy a plot of land and educate and feed her children. She thanks Hekima for their support for businesswomen who are excluded from the classic banking system.

loans.use: to buy radios, televisions, hi-fi systems, DVD players, etc.

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en: Cyrus is a married man with six children who describes himself to be honest. He operates a tailoring shop where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for six years and his primary customers are private individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. Cyrus will use the 25,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy tailoring materials. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, having successfully repaid his previous loans.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 40 de años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 20 años Cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos así como muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarlos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa,  Manuel está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Manuel is 40 years old and lives in his own house with his two children. He has worked growing corn for 20 years. When his harvest is ready he stores it in sacks as shown in the photograph to later sell them in the various markets close to his house. Manuel is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc. to be able to continue with his work and have greater income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest. 

He operates a restaurant where he cooks food to sell. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a strategic place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances.

He will use the 80,000 Kenya Shilling (KES) loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food to sell. This is his sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food to sell

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 35-year-old hard-working married man. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda with his four children, two of whom attend primary school. He operates a retail shop as his major source of income and supplements this income with bodaboda (motorcycle) transport. Julius hopes to expand his shop into a wholesale store, though he faces the challenge of high transport costs.

He is requesting a loan to buy more stock such as wraps, bars of soap, jelly and torches.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his store

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en: Mamuka is 51 years old. He is married and lives with his wife, Ketevan, and his three school-aged children, in Dighomi, near the capital city of Georgia. Ketevan stays at home and looks after the children. Mamuka was working as a driver, but nowadays he is unemployed. The family are in the "subsistence poor" category as they have no source of income and live in poverty. This means that Mamuka lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, since this requires a stable income and business experience. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Mamuka to get a loan of 3,000 GEL to build a greenhouse. Once the greenhouse is built, Mamuka will grow tomatoes and resell them to generate income. With the support of the Start Up program, Mamuka will have the opportunity to be involved in his own business and tackle his financial difficulties.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Bergerie Group

texts.fr: Bebe est commerçante, présidente du groupe de crédits «Bergerie», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 38 ans, mère 7 enfants dont 5 étudient et 2 sont gosses. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse de friperies  dans un  marché de la ville depuis 10 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en friperie des sacs à mains. Son conjoint est un mécanicien. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses  enfants. Au finish,  elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Bebe is a saleswoman, and president of the credit group named "Bergerie". She is a client of IMF Hekima, 38 years old, married, and has seven children of whom five go to school and two are babies. She started her business with funds that her husband gave to her. She has been selling secondhand clothing in a market in the town for ten years. She intends to stock up on secondhand handbags. Her husband is a mechanic. She would like to increase her capital and educate and feed her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support for entrepreneurs who are excluded from the classic banking system.

loans.use: To stock up on secondhand handbags.

loans.name: Atuwezeshe Group

texts.fr: Kiroko est commerçante qui s’entraide avec son mari, membre du groupe de crédits «Atuwezeshe», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 28 ans, mère 4 enfants dont 1 étudie et 3 sont gosses. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse de tomates et huiles à domicile dans une avenue de la ville depuis 2 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 20 litres d’huiles et 1 panier de tomates. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Kiroko is a saleswoman, who helps her husband who is a member of the credit group named "Atuwezeshe". She is a client of IMF Hekima, 28 years old, and has four children of whom one goes to school and three are babies. She started her business with funds that her husband gave her. She has been selling tomatoes and oil from home in an avenue in the town for two years. She intends to stock up on twenty litres of oil and one basket of tomatoes. She would like to increase her capital and educate and feed her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support for entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to stock up on twenty litres of oil and one basket of tomatoes.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be strong willed. 

She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the 80,000 Kenya Shilling (KES) loan to buy tailoring materials. 

Her business goal is to open a boutique within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Felicien

texts.en:
Felicien is a hardworking married man. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He deals in cattle fattening and owns a milling machine where he has been able to earn more income to support his family. He loves to have a reasonable farm of cattle but he is limited by bad weather that affects the health and productivity of his cattle. 
 
He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for fattening in his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening in his farm.

loans.name: Changamuka Group

texts.fr: Riziki est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise «Changamuka», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 35 ans, mère 4 enfants tous étudient. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse de souliers usagés a domicile dans une avenue animée de la ville depuis 2 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 30 paires de souliers. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses  enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Riziki is a saleswoman, and a member of the banque villageoise named "Changamuka". She is a client of IMF Hekima, 35 years old, and married with four children all of whom go to school. She started her business with funds that her husband gave her. She has been selling secondhand shoes from home in a busy avenue in the town for two years. She intends to stock up on thirty pairs of shoes. She hopes to increase her capital and send her children to school  and feed them. Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support for entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: To buy 30 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Satik

texts.en:
Satik has been involved in land cultivation for ten years. She lives with her husband, three sons and daughter-in-law. All her family members help Satik with the farm. She has now applied for this loan to buy two cows, forage for feeding the livestock and fertilizer. 

As this is Satik's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who do not have access to other forms of credit because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for two cows, livestock feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a married man with three children who all attend school. He owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. His biggest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

He has operated soft drink business for the past seven years. He mentioned seasonality as the major challenge in his business.

With the loan of 40,000 KES he wants to purchase a stock of soft drinks for resale. He decided to join Yehu to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Mario Ernesto

texts.es:
Mario, tiene como negocio la venta de gas propano, vive con su grupo familiar, es padre de un niño de 3 años de edad, su negocio nace por la necesidad de generar recursos económicos con los que aporta a los gastos familiares, no tiene un horario establecido y ya tiene clientes que prefieren sus servicios.
Invertirá en la compra de más cilindros de gas propano para aumentar su inventario y espera que sus demandas crezcan cada día, su meta es ir teniendo más ingresos para salir adelante con su familia y pagar la deuda adquirida.
Sus sueños son diversificar más su negocio para atraer a otro tipo de clientes y ofrecer a su hijo un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Mario has a business of selling propane gas. He lives with his family and he is the father of a 3 year old child. His business grew from the necessity to create economic resources with which to support the household expenses. He has no set timetable and has clients who prefer his services.

He will invest in the purchase of more propane gas cylinders to increase his inventory and hope that his demand grows daily. His goal is to obtain more income to get ahead with his family and pay off his acquired debt. His dream is to diversify his business more to attract other types of clients and offer his son a better future.

loans.use: to invest in buying more cylinders of propane gas to increase his inventory and hope that his demand grows each day.

loans.name: Glenda Oneyda

texts.es:
Doña Glenda, es una mujer que no se deja vencer por la adversidad y las cosas que muchos consideran negativas ella las ve como una bendición. Es madre de dos hijos y la menor de 16 años sufre una discapacidad, ellos son la más importante en su vida y es por quienes lucha día a día junto con su esposo. Doña Glenda desde hace 3 años posee una pequeña pulpería, la cual es el medio con el que ayuda a sostener a su familia y genera ingresos para el hogar.
Doña Glenda solicita el crédito debido a que desea invertir en mercadería para surtir su pulpería y de esta manera comprar productos como: arroz, aceite, gaseosa, etc. Sus deseos son poder crecer en su negocio y tener más clientela para obtener más ganancias. Sus planes son seguir luchando porque su hija tenga una vida feliz.
texts.en:
Glenda is a woman who will not give up because of adversity and the things that many consider to be negatives she views as blessings. She is the mother of two children and the youngest who is 16 years old has a disability.. They are her most important opportunity in her life and she struggles for them each day along with her husband.

Glenda has had a small store for the past 3 years which is her means to support her family and generate income for her household. Glenda is requesting a loan as she wants to invest in merchandise to stock her store and in this way buy products like rice, oil, soft drinks, etc. Her wish is to be able to expand her business and have more clients in order to obtain more income. Her plan is to continue to struggle so that her daughter has a happy life.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, oil, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Yessika Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Yessika de 30 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en una casa de alquiler,  en una comunidad al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de Tortillas, sus clientes son todos sus vecinos amistades  y la prefieren por su buena atención y su buen producto.
Doña Yessika es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de maíz, leña y cal. que son los productos más necesarios para la elaboración de tortillas,  con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente que ya ha tenido varios prestamos con Prisma.
Su sueño es aumentar  su clientela para mejorar sus ingresos y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Enero del 2015.
texts.en:
Yessika is 30 years old and lives with her husband and children in a rented house in a community in the south of Honduras. For 10 years she has worked in her business of selling tortillas. Her clients are all her friends and neighbors who prefer her for her good service and her good product.

Yessica is an enterprising woman with the desire to get ahead and struggles each day to improve her quality of living. She is requesting a loan to buy corn, wood and lime which are the products she needs to make tortillas. With the help of this loan she plans to increase her income and also her quality of living.

She has had various loans with Prisma. Her dream is to increase her clientele to improve her income and at the same time improve her future together with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- January 2015.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood and lime for her business.

loans.name: Amelida

texts.es: Amelida tiene 64 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer emprendedora quien desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la venta  de pescado, pollo y verduras. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Amelida desea mejorar sus ingresos por medio de la venta de sus productos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de verduras, pescado y pollo. Espera poder contar con dicho financiamiento y de esta forma mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en: Amelida is 64 years old and lives in her own house together with her family. She is an enterprising woman who has worked for a long time selling fish, chicken and vegetables. This is how she earns her living and brings income to her household. Amelida wants to increase her income by selling her products. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to FUSAI to buy a variety of vegetables, fish and chicken. She hopes to obtain this loan and in this way improve her life conditions and those of her family's.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables, fish and chicken to sell.

loans.name: Yajayda

texts.es:
La socia Yajayda se sigue dedicando al trabajo como profesor de un colegio,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la sociao por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener un colegio. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Yajayda continues working as a professor at a college. She works from 8 am until 2 pm. Through her work she has been able to get ahead. Her dream is to have her own school. She is requesting a loan to buy a television for her house. She is happy for the loan and promises to comply with the payments of her loan.

loans.use: to buy a television for her house.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick owns a produce store. He is 39 years old and still strong. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He also has a coffee plantation, which helps him meet family monetary demands. 

His vision is having a bigger store of produce in the near future but he has been faced with a challenge of stiff completion from richer traders, which affects the performance of his business. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more produce like bags of maize, beans, simsim (sesame), groundnuts and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more produce like bags of maize, beans, simsim, groundnuts and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a 32-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He is a farmer who also gets additional income from rearing pigs. 

He wishes to have a big coffee plantation in his area, but his main challenge is unfavorable weather that affects the quality and quantity of output from his garden. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more manure, mulch and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more manure, mulch and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en:
Godwin is a 34-year-old man, married and living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He deals in cattle fattening and also practices general gardening, where he has been able to get food for his family. 

He intends to have a very good and big farm of cattle, but he is limited by bad weather that affects the productivity of his cattle.  

He needs a loan to buy more cattle for fattening in his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening in his farm.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is aged 27, a married hardworking man charged with the responsibility of taking care of two children in Hoima, Uganda. 

He deals in produce, mainly buying and selling maize, rice, and beans among other items. He gets additional income from farming. 

He desires to expand and develop his business. He will use the loan facility to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is from Vedi town, where she lives with her husband and two sons, ages 22 and 15. 

Liana runs a farm. She has been involved in agribusiness for 15 years, and over those years was able to have a successful farm. Liana's farm includes livestock of three cows, 16 sheep and hens. The gathered agricultural products Liana's son and husband sell in local markets. 

This is LIana's first loan. She plans to purchase four oxen, ten sheep and forage for feeding the livestock. The loan has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for four oxen, ten sheep and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 37 years old. He lives in Rustavi district with his wife and three children. His wife is unemployed and she stays home and raises the children.

Zurab works as a security guard at the railway station and gets a small monthly income, which is not enough to cover everyday costs. 

Zurab decided to start a trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,500 USD. With the received credit, he will purchase a car online and will resell it in Rustavi to generate income. 

Zurab is very motivated to generate more income in order to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy a car to resell.

loans.name: Zabel

texts.en:
Zabel lives with her husband in Armash village. Their two sons are migrant workers in Russia, trying to support their parents financially. 

Zabel is involved in agriculture. She cultivates watermelon in arable land near the house where they live.
 
To be able to increase watermelon production, Zabel applied for this loan. She needs money to pay for cultivation work to be prepared for spring cultivation season.
 
This is her first loan, so it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for cultivation work to be prepared for spring.

loans.name: Yona

texts.en:
Yona is a 38-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a farmer and operates a retail shop where he gets supplementary income for his family. 

He intends to expand and improve his farm, but he faces a challenge of bad weather in the form of prolonged droughts that affect the growth of the crops. 

He has asked for a loan to buy fertilizers to apply on the farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to apply on the farm.

loans.name: Josael Armando

texts.es:
Josael, de 21 años de edad, está soltero, está estudiando y al mismo tiempo se dedica a trabaja en una foto-estudio los días libres, se desempeña como técnico en reparación de equipos informáticos.

Josael, vive con sus abuelos, porque sus padres decidieron viajar hacia otro país, en busca de mejores empleos y oportunidades para poder apoyar en  la realización de los sueños de sus hijos.- Josael, tiene excelentes referencias personales, se destaca como un joven muy responsable con sus compromisos y por su participación en proyectos sociales en su comunidad.  

El dinero será utilizado para comprar herramientas para la reparación de equipos informáticos, ya que está comenzando a colocar su propio taller de reparaciones de equipos informáticos, también quiere montar un cybers café, ya que en su comunidad existe mucha demanda, por parte de los estudiantes de la escuela.- De esta manera tendrá un mejor ingreso económico.

Las metas que tiene a futuro son, tener una vivienda propia, tener una familia y tener un negocio rentable que le permita emplear a uno de sus mejores amigos.
texts.en:
Josael is 21 years old and single. He is studying and at the same time works in a photo studio on his free days. He works as a technician in repairing computer equipment.

Josael lives with his grandparents as his parents decided to travel to another country looking for better work and opportunities to be able to support achieving their children's dreams. Josael has excellent personal references. He stands out as a youth who is very responsible with his compromises and for his participation in social projects in his community.

The money will be used to buy tools to repair computer equipment as he has started to open his own computer repair workshop. He also wants to open an internet cafe as there is much demand in his community from school students. In this way he will have greater economic income. The goals that he has for the future are to have his own house, a family and a profitable business that allows him to hire one of his best friends.

loans.use: to buy tools to repair electronic equipment.

loans.name: Réussite Group

texts.fr: Kanzaki est propriétaire d’un cabinet de change de la monnaie a l’entrée du marché de la ville depuis 19 ans, présidente du groupe de crédit «Réussite», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 56 ans, mère de 3 enfants scolarisés. Elle commença  avec de fonds de reçu de son mari lors de son vivant. Elle va acheter les devises étrangères. Elle souhaite renforcer son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Kanzaki has been the owner of a foreign exchange office at the entrance to the town market for 19 years, and is president of the credit group "Réussite". She is a client of IMF Hekima. She is a 56 year old widow with three children who go to school. She started her business with money that her husband gave her when he was alive. She buys foreign currency. She hopes to reinforce her capital, and educate and feed her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support for entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: To buy foreign currency.

loans.name: Tuliza Group

texts.fr: Sango est une commerçante, présidente d’un collectif de crédits «Tuliza», âgée de 46ans, mariée à un technicien, mère de 2 enfants scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse  divers drap de lit dans un magasin de la ville depuis 9 ans. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 60 paires de drap de lit. Ainsi, elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux femmes entrepreneuses exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Sango is a saleswoman, and president of the credit group "Tuliza". She is 46 years old, married to a technician, and has two children who go to school. She is a saleswoman of various products and has been selling bed linen in a shop in the town for nine years. She requests a loan from Hekima to expand her business. She intends to buy 60 pairs of bed sheets. She hopes to increase her capital and educate and feed her children. She thanks Hekima for their support for businesswomen who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: To buy 60 pairs of bed sheets.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a hardworking married woman with five children, four of whom attend school, in Hoima Uganda. She deals in textiles, mainly selling clothes, and she supplements her income by owning rentals. Florence hopes to develop her business and pay school fees for her children, although she complains of unpredictable weather changes, especially during the rainy season when customer turnout is low. She will use this loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Saphan

texts.en: Saphan lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is married and has six children, four of whom attend school. Saphan started his business of tea growing slowly, using his previous loan, and he supplements his income with cattle keeping. He dreams of being self-supporting in the future and he will use this loan to buy more tea seedlings for planting.

loans.use: to buy more tea seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Silvester

texts.en:
Silvester is a 52-year-old hard working man.  He is married and has 5 children that range in age from 6 to 15 years and all attend school.  He deals mainly in farming and supplements this activity by buying and selling produce like maize and beans. 

Silvester wants to develop his business and also educate his children.  He will use the loan to set up 10 acres of maize.  Inadequate capital is his main challenge.

loans.use: to set up a 10 acre maize garden.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Ruth has operated a retail shop for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business

With this loan of KES 50,000, Ruth wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Atieno

texts.en:
Atieno is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, Atieno has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With this KES 20,000 loan, Atieno wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine, who is a 36-year-old married woman, lives in the village of Kintsvisi. She has a husband and a pensioner mother. Irine has a high education and works at a local public school, where she earns a small monthly income. She also works hard to generate additional income and takes care of cattle. However, her family has poor living conditions because they have no significant source of income. According to Credo's estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Irine requested a loan from Credo to open a general store. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisions for business start-ups and re-startup credits with reasonable conditions for the country's rural poor, who are regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income and who do not have access to traditional credit products. With this loan, Irine will purchase food supplies for her general store and have money for working capital. Her husband will help also help her. This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase her family's income and her family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase food supplies and open a general store

loans.name: Shoghik

texts.en:
The sunny lady in the photo is Shoghik, who is from Vosketap village. She lives with her parents and her retired grandmother. The whole family is involved in farming. They own two greenhouses where they grow different types of vegetables. Their farm is 15 years old and over those years it has become profitable and beautiful due to the hard work of Shoghik and her family.

To be able to purchase two oxen, forage for feeding the livestock, supplies for greenhouse renovation (wires and polyethylene cover), and cucumber seeds, Shoghik has applied for this loan. Because this is Shoghik's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who have not had access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen, forage for feeding the livestock, supplies for greenhouse renovation (wires and polyethylene cover), and cucumber seeds

loans.name: Gyulizar

texts.en:
Gyulizar is an agronomist from Mkhchyan village. She lives there with her husband and two grown children. Gyulizar has a beautiful farm, where she cultivates a large variety of vegetables and fruits. On the farm, she owns two greenhouses. 

Gyulizar needs to renovate her greenhouses and that's the reason she applied for this loan. As this is Gyulizar's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who have not had access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of two greenhouses

loans.name: Virgen De Lourdes Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN DE LOURDES, la socia Gabina tiene 60 años de edad es separada y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pan y pasto, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la  socia vende de  forma ambulatoria, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma s seguir apoyando a su familia.
Los demás socios se dedican al negocio de venta de zapatos, comida, tienda de abarrotes, cereales y otros brindan servicios profesionales. 
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pasto y pan.
Los socios en general agradecen  el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con  sus cuotas establecidas.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Gabina is a member of the community bank VIRGEN DE LOURDES. She is 60 years old, and she is separated with 3 children. This member goes about her daily activities while managing her business selling bread and pasta. She has had this business for awhile, and it has gone well for her thanks to the determined effort that she puts towards her business everyday. Gabina sells her products while traveling throughout the area. This member wants to be able to keep working in order to continue to support her family.

The other members make a living through various businesses such as shoe sales, food sales, a convenience store, cereal sales, and others provide professional services. 

Gabina is requesting a loan to buy pasta and bread.

The members in general are thankful for the approved loan, and they promise to fulfill their loan payments. The members that appear in separate photos at the bottom asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting for work-related reasons.

loans.use: to buy pasta and bread.

loans.name: Sayuni Group

texts.fr: Nabakazi est commerçante mariée à un taximan moto, membre de la banque communautaire «Sayuni», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 54 ans, mère de 8 enfants dont 4 scolarisés et 4 n’étudient pas. Elle est vendeuse des  aliments grillés dans un restaurant à domicile dans une avenue de la ville depuis 20 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de ses parents. Elle va s’approvisionner en 1 sac de pommes de terre, 5kg de viande, les huiles, mayonnaise, etc. Elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Nabakazi is a saleswoman married to a motorbike taxi man. She is a member of the «Sayuni», banque communautaire and client of Hekima. She is 54 years old with eight children of whom four go to school and four do not. She has been selling grilled foods in a restaurant from her home in a street in the town for 20 years. She started her business with money that her parents gave her. She intends to buy one sack of potatoes, 5kg of meat, oil, mayonnaise, etc. She hopes to educate and feed her children. Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support for entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to stock up on one sack of potatoes, 5kg of meat, oil, mayonnaise, etc.

loans.name: Consolate

texts.en: Consolate lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is a 38-year-old single mother charged with the responsibility of taking care of two children, ages 3 and 1. Consolate operates a retail shop, mainly selling salt, sugar, and cooking oil, among other items, alongside additional income from farming. She hopes to grow and expand her business as well as educate her children. Consolate will use this loan to buy more stock like soap and sugar. She faces the challenges of inadequate capital and price fluctuations.

loans.use: to buy more stock like soap and sugar

loans.name: Kyakudupa Kweterana Group

texts.en:
Mary, a member of Kyakudupa Kweterana group where members guarantee each other, is aged 65 with 3 children, and living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She sells fresh fruits like passion fruit, oranges, and watermelon, among others, and at the same time rears pigs and grows food crops like sweet potatoes.  In her business, she faces challenges of her stock going bad since its highly perishable, hence lowering her sales.  Besides that, she hopes to expand her business to new areas. 

Mary has asked for a loan to buy fruits such as passion fruit to sell.  Out of the 10 members in the photo, only 9 are active borrowers, one member is resting hoping to borrow in the next cycle.

loans.use: to buy fruits such as passion fruit to sell.

loans.name: Obumu Group Rwakiraita

texts.en: Beatrice is a member of a village bank, she is 35 years old and married, with children who live in Kyenjojo, Uganda.  She owns a retail shop selling bread, soft drinks like soda, sugar, soap, and cooking oil.  She obtains additional income from farming.  She began the retail business to be able to meet her family's needs and to have constant income.  She hopes to expand her retail shop but faces a challenge of little capital.  Beatrice is requesting a loan to buy sugar and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Zepyur

texts.en:
Zepyur is from Gay village where she lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law, and grandson. Zapyur's son is a migrant worker and other family members help her with farming activities. She raises cabbage, cucumbers, carrots, peppers, eggplants, and greens. 

To expand her farming activities, Zepyur asks lenders to support her with this loan to construct a greenhouse and enlarge her vegetable cultivation. 

As this is Zepyur's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not previously have access to credit products because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for construction of her greenhouse

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in Spandarian village with her mother-in-law and three sons. Her elder son is 23 years old and her little son is 13 years old and attends a local secondary school. Gayane and her sons work very hard to sustain their family. The main occupation of the family is agriculture. They keep two cows, a calf, and hens, as well as cultivating wheat, potatoes, and carrots.  They sell their harvest in a local market.

To be able to improve her farm, Gayane asks for this loan. She plans to purchase potato seeds, fertilizer, and forage for feeding the livestock. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to her hard work recently, Gayane has been able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments for this loan. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, fertilizer, and forage for feeding her livestock

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is an agronomist and caring mother of two children. Her son is 20 years old and a cook by profession. Anahit runs a farm, which includes cows, calves, hens, and one piglet. She also owns arable land where wheat, barley and potato are cultivated. Anahit's husband supports her to sell her agricultural products in the market.

To be able to purchase seeds and forage for feeding her livestock, Anahit has applied for this loan of US $1,500. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to her hard work recently, Anahit has been able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments for this loan. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and forage for feeding her livestock

loans.name: Meali

texts.en:
Meali is a married mother of six children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that does not have electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.  For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of capital to expand her business. 

With the 20,000 KES loan Meali wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over eight months, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Sixta

texts.es:
La socia Sixta se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere que sus hijos que terminen de estudiar, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant grande. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras, arroz y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sixta continues with the business of selling food.  She is an enterprising woman who, through this business, wants her children to complete their education.  Her dream is to a have a big restaurant.

She is requesting the loan to buy chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy chicken, vegetables, rice, and meat.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La socia Maria Del Carmen se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,la socia vende ceviche, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere que sus hijos que terminen de estudiar, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant grande. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pescado,limon y camote.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Del Carmen continues with the business of selling food.  She sells ceviche.  She is an enterprising woman who, through this business, wants her children to complete their education.  Her dream is to have a big restaurant.

She is requesting the loan to buy fish, lime, and sweet potatoes.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy fish, lime, and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Eberardo

texts.es:
El socio trabaja como profesor del nivel primario, el socio por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es tener su negocio propio. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar un equipo de sonido para su casa.
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member works as an elementary school teacher.  Through this work he wants to get his children ahead.  His dream is to have his own business.

The member is requesting the loan to buy a sound system for his house.

The member is happy about the loan, and he pledges to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy a sound system for his house.

loans.name: Joash

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Joash, a farmer in Nyamira. Joash is involved in maize, poultry and dairy farming. He is engaged in milk and egg production for commercial purposes as opposed to many rural farmers, who are in it for subsistence. Joash also grows maize for food and sales. These commercial activities place him in a better position to engage in other agriculture-related businesses, which, in fact, he does. 

Joash is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to construct a cow shed. This will help significantly in managing the animals’ health and hygiene. He has been in the farming business for at least 10 years. He has no plans to quit in the future as he finds farming to be both fulfilling and lucrative. However, his biggest challenges are the poor road network and lack of market. The cow shed, constructed through this loan, will later come in handy when Joash scales up and introduces zero-grazing. The long-term impact is an increase in productivity and improved animal health. The additional income from this development will go to Joash's children’s education.

loans.use: to construct a cow shed

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation at her place of business. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat to expand her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with five kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanamisi operates a stall where she sells vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenges of high transportation costs and seasonality at her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the KES 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 30,000 KES loan she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Travel Tours Group

texts.en:
Aged 54, Chipo is a widow and mother of seven living in the Glen Views suburb of Harare. Her husband passed away in 2007, and she became the breadwinner. Faced with such a situation and without a regular source of income, she found herself in the business of selling vegetables and fruits. She is currently selling groundnuts, peanut butter, mealie meal, and fruit. Chipo works hard to make sure she puts food on the table for her family.

With her friends Lydia, Josphine and Perpetual, Chipo formed a group called Travel Tours. They received training from Thrive on business management and savings. The ladies have lived in the same neighborhood for more than 5 years, encouraging each other to do income-generating activities for their families. Chipo is looking forward to improving her business by using her portion of the loan ($300) to purchase a variety of traditional foods to sell.

loans.use: To increase her range of traditional foods to sell.

loans.name: Sara Maria

texts.es:
El que persevera alcanza, dice un dicho popular. Doña Sara es una mujer emprendedora que a sus 50 años tiene las fuerzas y pericia para alcanzar sus metas. Ella desde hace cinco años se dedica a atender una pequeña pulpería en su casa junto a su esposo, quien es su único apoyo, luego de que dejara de dedicarse a la venta de comida los fines de semana como fresco, hamburguesas, sopa etc. 
Doña Sara solicita el crédito ya que desea invertir en la compra de productos de temporada escolar, granos básicos y medicamentos etc. para surtir su pulpería, con el objetivo de ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes, crecer y mejorar las ganancias de su negocio para lograr tener mejores condiciones de vida para su familia. Entre los planes de esta humilde señora esta poner una sala de juegos de video para diversificar su negocio y clientela. Además, desea mejorar su casa y acondicionar la pulpería.
texts.en:
"The person who perseveres achieves a goal", or so goes a popular saying. Doña Sara is an entrepreneurial woman who, at 50 years old, has the strength and skill to achieve her goals. For five years now, she has made a living managing a small grocery store out of her home with her husband, who is her only support, after she stopped selling food on the weekends such as fresh food, hamburgers, soup, etc.

Doña Sara is requesting a loan since she wants to buy school supplies, staple grains, medicine, etc. to stock her store inventory. Her objective is to offer a wider variety to her customers, and increase her earnings from the business in order to improve the living conditions of her family. Among the various plans of this humble woman, one of them is to add a video game room to diversify her business and clientele. In addition, she wants to improve her home and install air conditioning in her store.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, staple grains, and medicine.

loans.name: Jose Martin

texts.es: Jose de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 30 años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frijol, cuando ya está su cosecha la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarla a los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, El está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose is 55 years old, and he lives in his own house with his wife and their three children. For 30 years, he has made a living in agriculture cultivating corn and beans. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the granaries shown in the photo. Later, he goes around selling it in neighboring towns, and he now has many long-term customers.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc. to be able to continue with his crops because this is his only source of work, and to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, 59 years old, dreamed of becoming a successful athlete. Hailing from the Kapsowar area of Kenya, it isn't surprising that his career was destined to be elsewhere. Today, Charles has no regrets. He was persuaded by his father to stay in the village and start farming because there was a drop in crop yield and there was no one to look after their farm. For the past year, Charles has actively been involved in mixed farming; his primary sources of income have been crops and milk. He also engages in personal business to make ends meet. Charles sells crops to his neighbors and to the local market, although his work is not without challenges, he says. 

Of all the activities Charles is involved in, sheep farming is closest to his heart. The main challenge he faces is lack of funds to increase his flock of sheep. Sheep farming is a profitable business because wool prices have skyrocketed. Charles is an enterprising person and wants to take full advantage. From the loan he is seeking, he has already identified the breed of sheep he wants, a merino. The advantages of a merino sheep are their ease of care and that merino garments fetch high prices and are valued for their low propensity to smell bad. Through this loan, Charles will sell wool and be able to improve his living standards. Improved profits will be used to buy more stock and to secure his children's future. All that Charles waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a merino sheep

loans.name: Flavio

texts.en:
Flavio raises hogs and sheep on his farm, which he sells for their meat. He also works as a carpenter to supplement his income, as the operating expenses on his farm -- which mostly consist of LP gas, chemical fertilizers, and wood -- drastically reduce his available income. Flavio decided to invest in a biodigester in order to displace these expensive and unsustainable inputs, allowing him to reduce his expenses and improve his farm's productivity while protecting the environment. As he produces his own biogas and organic fertilizer from his animals' manure, he will be able to apply the nutrient-rich fertilizer on his corn field, his vegetables, and even the flowers he grows in his garden, making them grow taller and stronger in a natural way. The biogas will be connected to the cookstove and boiler in the house, making wood and LP gas unnecessary.
