By cooking with biogas instead of wood, Flavio's wife will no longer inhale the toxic smoke on a daily basis, improving her and her family's health. As he treats his animals' manure and generates savings, Flavio will be able to invest this money in the expansion of his farm and his family's well-being.

This loan represents 43% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en:
By investing in his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, Marcelino will reinvent the way he operates his farm. He will replace the expensive LP gas, chemical fertilizers, and wood he used to buy with renewable energy (biogas) and organic fertilizer. By treating his hogs' and poultry's manure inside the biodigester, he will avoid the contamination of underground water sources and the emission of greenhouse gases, as well as bad smells. As Marcelino displaces fossil fuels and protects the environment, he will also save money by producing his own energy and improve his corn field's yield by applying the nutrient-rich organic fertilizer. His wife will no longer cook with wood, thereby protecting the nearby forest and improving her health as she will not inhale the toxic smoke produced by burning wood on a daily basis anymore. Marcelino's farm will become a clean, sustainable, and comfortable place to live and work.

This loan represents 50% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to acquire a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Reymundo

texts.en:
The purchase of a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester will allow Reymundo to replace the expensive LP gas, chemical fertilizers and wood that he used to buy, with renewable energy (biogas) and organic fertilizer. 

He is a dairy farmer, and by inputting his cows' manure into the biodigester, he will avoid the contamination of underground water sources and the emission of greenhouse gases, as well as bad smells. Reymundo will transform manure into a productive resource for his farm. 

As Reymundo displaces fossil fuels and protects the environment, he will also save money by producing his own energy, thus improving his corn field's yield by applying the nutrient-rich organic fertilizer to it. His operating expenses will decrease, allowing him to further invest in the expansion of his farm by purchasing additional cows. 

He also plans to continue saving money in order to have the financial capacity to send his children to university.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 16 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Jose Isidro

texts.es:
Isidro, de 73 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería, está casado y tiene tres hijos, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos. 

Isidro, tiene 50 años de trabajar en la agricultura y la ganadería, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres, quienes lo educaron y lo crecieron con amor, eso lo ha llevado ser una persona de éxito en su vida y ser un ejemplo para su familia y su comunidad. 

El dinero será utilizado para pagar el alquiler de una maquina desgranadora y una maquina picadora de pasto para ganado, de esta manera podrá tener su cosecha en casa y en poco tiempo estará listas para poderla vender.

El sueño de Isidro es, comprar una maquina desgranadora y comprar ganado lechero, ya que cuenta con un terreno adecuado para el cuido de ganado.
texts.en:
Isidro is 73 years old and he works in agriculture and livestock. He's married with three children, and his wife does household chores.

Isidro has earned a living for fifty years working in agriculture and livestock. He learned the work from his parents, who raised him in a loving home. This   allowed him to grow up successfully in life and to become an example for his family and community.

The loan will be used to pay for the rental of a hulling machine and a grass cutter for cattle feed. This way, he will be able to process his harvest at home and in little time have it ready to sell.

Isidro's dream is to buy a hulling machine, and also to buy dairy cattle, since he has land suitable to raise livestock.

loans.use: to pay for the rental of a hulling machine and a cattle feed grass cutter.

loans.name: Good Hope Group

texts.en:
Clatin (in orange) is a young lady aged 22. She is an active single lady who runs a flea market at the Kambuzuma business center in Harare. After finishing her Ordinary Level exam in 2012, she started her business to generate income. She started the business with just $50 in capital, selling slopes, skirts, uniforms, and toothbrushes on her table. 

Clatin is a member of Good Hope Group, which includes two other ladies who sell groceries and vegetables. Thrive Microfinance helped them to run their small businesses by saving and working as a group. Clatin was advanced an initial loan of $300 in July 2014, which she used to increase her stock by adding a variety of products, and she managed to repay it on time. 

Clatin stays at her uncle’s home in Kambuzuma with her widowed mother and her young sister and brother, both of whom are going to school. She is the breadwinner, supporting the family in all of their needs including school fees for her siblings. She is proud of her group members who are so cooperative and help each other with ideas as well as implementing a group savings plan. She has requested a loan of $350 to sustain her business by restocking unique products so she can fight her competition.

loans.use: To restock her clothing retail business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repurpose the basement of her beauty and hair salon to provide more space to assist customers

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael has been drawn to cars for as long as he can remember. His cousins were in the car business for over 50 years, and cars have been a passion for him all his life. In order to share this appreciation with others, and help others make educated purchasing choices, Michael sold cars for over nine years before he started his own car-sales business. He currently employs three people, and receives occasional assistance at the company from his father.

He has run into the issue of not having enough capital to invest in the necessary inventory. This limits the services he can provide to his customers. This loan will be used to purchase more inventory and expand his car-sales business. It will help him get closer to his goal of expanding his company in the coming year, and increasing his customer base.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory and expand his car-sales business

loans.name: William

texts.en:
At GoalsCorp Media Inc., William works hard to provide businesses with media feature services. He has been working in this industry for 20 years, and started his own business because he realized that working for himself was best both for his own happiness and the well-being of his family. He currently lives with his wife and two children, whom he supports with his business.

However, he has encountered the difficulty of obtaining access to capital to finance his business. Working from client payment to client payment severely limits what William and his business can do. With this loan, he will be able to obtain working capital to provide media services for his clients.

loans.use: to obtain working capital to address the needs of his clients by providing them with media features services

loans.name: Push Group

texts.en:
Mabel was orphaned at an early age and has since had a keen interest in clothing design; she got into the fashion business. By the age of 18, she was designing the clothes that she sold. Business was fair for a couple of years but then it crumbled with the economic meltdown experienced in Zimbabwe.

Mabel has become an influential woman in her community. She has helped various women pioneer their own businesses. She and her group of 4 other women are taking their first loan at Thrive Microfinance in an attempt to grow their businesses. 

Mabel is now married and her family relies on her clothing business for survival. She hopes that a loan of $300 from Kiva will help her flea market stall to grow and to one day have her own fashion label.

loans.use: to increase the range of clothes she has for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 10 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: German

texts.es: Don Germán nació en una comunidad llamada Los Limones en San Nicolás de oriente en Estelí, desde pequeño se dedico a ayudarle al padre a labores de agricultura. Actualmente tiene 2 hijos y esta casado. Don Germán, trabaja en la propiedad en agricultura sembrando granos básicos y cosechando su café. En esta comunidad no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un panel solar y así instalarlo en la casa de habitación ya que será de gran provecho para toda la familia y mas que ahora el niño empezara a estudiar y la señora podrá hacer la comida por las madrugadas para los cortadores de café en tiempo de corte. Don Germán estaría muy agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este panel solar.
texts.en:
Don Germán was born in a community called Los Limones in San Nicolás of the east in Estelí. Since he was young, he has made a living helping his father in agriculture. Currently, he has 2 children and he is married. Don Germán, works on his property planting basic grains, and harvesting coffee beans. 

In this community, there is no electric light and it is for this reason that he is requesting a loan to buy a solar panel. He will install it at the house because it will be of great benefit for all of the family, especially now since one of the children will begin studying, and his wife will be able to make food in the early morning for the coffee pickers at picking time. Don Germán would be very grateful if given the opportunity through this loan to buy a solar panel.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire a 14-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Mercy City Group

texts.en:
Tsitsi is a 49-year-old mother of two who runs a poultry business. Her husband is a pensioner who has been out of work for 8 years. Tsitsi and her friend make up the Mercy City group. They are both hardworking women who have small businesses and are receiving their second loan from Thrive. Tsitsi's only problem, before hearing about Thrive, was the lack of adequate capital to be able to buy chickens and feed. Although she had a fowl run with the capacity to carry 300 birds at a time, Tsitsi was always limited to batches of 50 or 75 birds. 

Upon coming to Thrive and receiving business training, as well as funding for her first loan, Tsitsi was now keeping 150 chickens. Business has greatly improved to the extent that she is now doing double batches of 200 chickens. Tsitsi is now able to assist her husband in sending their children to school, and her family confidently relies on her to provide for them. 

Tsitsi notes that the training she received from Thrive helped her manage her business well and track its progress. She hopes that her relationship with Thrive will carry on. Her vision is to have a larger fowl run with the capacity to carry 500 chickens.

loans.use: to extend her fowl run.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene owns more than one hundred hogs; he dedicates himself to raising them and selling the younger ones for their meat. He used to pile their manure up outside his farm, but the smell was persistent and Rene was aware of the environmental challenges this was causing, mostly the emission of greenhouse gases and underground water contamination. In parallel, he was spending significant amounts of his income on LP gas and chemical fertilizers. 

By investing in a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, Rene will not only treat his pigs' waste, thereby protecting the environment, but also transform it into a precious resource that produces biogas and organic fertilizer. His whole farm will become more self-sufficient and cost-effective, as the biogas will be used to cook, heat water and to heat the piglets, completely displacing fossil fuels from the farm's operations. In addition, Rene will apply the nutrient-rich fertilizer on his corn field, which will increase its yield in a natural way, producing more on the long-term with healthy soils. 

With his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, Rene has the opportunity to transform a contaminating and costly hog farm into a model for sustainable farming - and save money at the same time. He plans to reinvest his savings in the expansion of his farm. This loan represents 70% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 40 cubic meter waste-to-energy biodigester.

loans.name: Sipho

texts.en:
Sipho, 48, is originally from Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three children in total who are currently in school. To make a living, she opened a grocery store to serve people in her community. So far, she has been in this business for two years and earns, on average, an income of USD $6.00 a day.

She is residing a little bit far from the water source, so it is hard and time-consuming for her to get water. Due to this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan to dig a well for household use. With the support of this loan, she hopes that she can get the water to use easier and spend less time doing so than before. 

She is thankful for the lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to dig a well

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia Juana  se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar,aceite, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana, the partner, continues to run her restaurant and grocery store, where she sells basic items such as rice, sugar, milk, and biscuits. Juana is a very entrepreneurial and hardworking woman who is striving to make a better life through her business. She hopes to expand the grocery store, and is applying for a loan for the purchase of rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk, and biscuits. 

Juana is pleased that she's able to receive a loan and committed to repaying it.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking oil, sugar, milk, and biscuits.

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Thou, 43, is a married woman and lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has only one child. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland which is located near her house. On her farmland, she grows cassava and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers. On average, she can generate an earning of USD 3.00 per day.

The current farmland, that she owns, is small and doesn't  provide much benefit to her. She wants to enlarge her farmland area, but she cannot afford it. 

Therefore, now she would like to get a Kiva loan to buy a plot of farmland.  She hopes this additional farmland will help to improve her living condition.

She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Rort

texts.en:
Rort, 42, lives in a small community of Kandal Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of three single children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland, which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for 15 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 3.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. 

By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Fely works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling seafood in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Fely is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to  buy more seafood such as shell oysters, seaweed, fish, etc. to sell for her business.

Fely has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seafood such as shell oysters, seaweed, fish, etc. to sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is married and has four children, three of them still in school. She works hard to support her family. For the past 2 years, Flora has operated a business buying and selling seafood in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a general store.

Flora has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more seafood to sell to her customers. She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more seafood to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jeva

texts.en:
Jeva is married and has three children. She works hard to support her family. For the past 3 years, Jeva has operated a business buying and selling seafood in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Jeva has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more seafood such as shells, oysters, fish, etc. to sell. She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seafood such as shells, oysters, fish, etc. to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 49 years old and married with eight children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Francisca has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years, and also earns an income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jemma works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and raising pigs.  

Jemma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  purchase an additional stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Jemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian works hard to support her family. She is married with five children, and has a buy and sell seafood business in the Philippines.

Lilian requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more seafood to sell like oysters, fish, etc..

She has been in this business for 21 years now, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more seafood to sell like oysters, fish, etc

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 46 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Mary Joy has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years, and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college, and to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Raquel is 26 years old, and has one child who is still in school.

Raquel has a buy and sell seafood business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional seafood to sell like shells, oysters, fish, etc.

Raquel has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional seafood to sell like shells, oysters, fish, etc

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 53 years old, and married with seven children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Alma is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Alma has been pig fattening for 10 years, and also earns additional income from fishing. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Siony

texts.en:
Siony is 42 years old and has three children. She is married, and has one child who is still in school. Siony is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. 

Siony has been in this business for 21 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional pigs, sacks of feed, and vitamins for her pigs.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs, sacks of feed, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Adelyn

texts.en:
Adelyn is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Adelyn is 22 years old now.

Adelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Adelyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Anabel is 36 years old, and has five children who are in school.

Anabel has a buy and sell beverage business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy beverages like coconut wine, etc..

Anabel has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy beverages like coconut wine, etc.

loans.name: Anavic

texts.en:
Anavic is 29 years old and has four children. Anavic is married, and three of her children are in school.

Anavic is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Anavic requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Anavic has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Anavic would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 54 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Alicia has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 68 years old and widowed with five children. Cresencia works very hard to provide for them.

Cresencia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, coffee, groceries, etc.

Cresencia has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Cresencia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, coffee, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda works hard to support her family. Emelinda is married and has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines.

Emelinda requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase raw materials like bamboo sticks, nipa leaves, etc.

Emelinda has been in this business for three years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like bamboo sticks, nipa leaves, etc.

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabella is 29 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school.  Anabella works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like spices, cooking oil, fermented shrimp, etc.

Anabella has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Anabella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like spices, cooking oil, fermented shrimp, etc

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Dioscora is 36 years old, and has three children who are in school.

Dioscora has a buy and sell used cloth business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy clothes to sell.

Dioscora has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Felipe has been working in fleet services for more than 13 years, he started working with his father and when he got married decided to become independent. They sold the truck and split the proceeds between them, with the money he bough a 1989 Truck and started working providing transportation services to a food company, five years later he was able to upgrade to a newer truck. Felipe has been an excellent client of Kbo Financiero, he payed his first loan on time and now is asking for a second loan to do some repairs and maintenance to his truck. He is married and has two sons, his wife works in the Ministry of Education.
texts.en:
Felipe has been working in fleet services for more than 13 years. He started out working with his father and, when he got married, Felipe decided to become independent. When he and his father sold the truck and split the proceeds between them, Felipe used the money to buy a 1989 truck. He then started providing transportation services to a food company and was able to upgrade to a newer truck five years later. 

Felipe has been an excellent client of Kbo Financiero. He repaid his first loan on time and now is asking for a second loan to carry out some repairs and maintenance on his truck. He is married and has two sons. His wife works in the Ministry of Education.

loans.use: to carry out some maintenance and repairs on his truck.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia owns cows and sheep. She dedicates herself to selling her cows' milk, and she cultivates corn for their forage in a field close to the farm. 

Eufemia decided to invest in a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester in order to replace the expensive LP gas and the chemical fertilizers that she used to buy, with renewable energy (biogas) and organic fertilizer. Eufemia will transform her cow and sheep manure into a productive resource, thus reducing her operating expenses and protecting the environment. 

Eufemia will displace fossil fuels and treat her animals' manure, avoiding the contamination of underground water sources and the emission of greenhouse gases. She will cook with renewable and free energy (the biogas is directly connected to the cookstove and boiler in the house), and improve her corn field's yield by applying the nutrient-rich organic fertilizer to it. 

Eufemia's operating expenses will decrease, allowing her to further invest in the expansion of her farm by acquiring additional cows. 

Eufemia also plans to buy a milking machine in order to improve the productivity of her operations.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester; the remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 16 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Santiago Alonso

texts.es:
Santiago, vive con su esposa y un hijo, su fuente de ingresos para darle el sustento diario a la familia es la compra y venta de ganado, la actividad la aprendió con el apoyo de sus padres, lo trabaja de forma  independiente hace más de 20 años y sin un horario fijo.
El capital será de utilidad para comprar ganado y posteriormente venderlo a sus clientes a mejores precios, espera tener mejores ingresos para que su vida y la de sus seres queridos sea más confortable.
Santiago sueña con lograr tener una lechería y remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Santiago lives with his wife and son, and supports his family by buying and selling livestock. Santiago's parents taught him to care for a herd, and he's managed his own livestock herd for more than 20 years. He doesn't have a set schedule, but instead works whatever hours his business requires. 

Santiago will use the loan funds to purchase livestock and then sell the animals to his customers at better prices. He hopes that the can boost his income and provide a more comfortable for himself and his loved ones. 

Santiago hopes one day to have a dairy and to make renovations to his home.

loans.use: to purchase livestock that he can then sell to his customers at a better price.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 36 years old and two of her children are in school.

Elizabeth has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for two years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet lives in Soweto, a township of Johannesburg in South Africa. She is 30 and lives with her mother and grandmother whom she supports.

Juliet is determined to start her own business after attending business training sessions conducted by Siza Loan officers. She noticed that no one in her location had a washing machine and that people would like access to one.  

Juliet wants to start a laundry business and she is seeking a loan to buy a washing machine.

Juliet will manage the accounts and the administration for her business, and her aunt will work with her. Her ambition is to be independent and to be able to help motivate people.

Juliet said, "I will believe in myself more, and it will make my family proud."

loans.use: To buy a washing machine

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun, 53, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has seven children in total; four are married and three are single. To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farming process, primarily growing cassava and selling her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in market. So far, she has been in this business for almost 30 years. On average, she is able to make earnings of USD $2.50 a day.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farming. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides. She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Luon

texts.en:
Luon, 52, is a married woman from Kampong Cham Province. She has two single children. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling her agriculture product to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this business for 30 years. She is able to make an income of USD $2 per day, on average.  

Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living place for the household. Due to the lack of funds, she has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to pay for her house renovation. She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funding to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation

loans.name: Yeap

texts.en:
Yeap, 45, is a married woman from Kampong Cham Province. She has four children. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling her agriculture product to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this business for 30 years. She is able to make an income of USD $5 per day, on average.  

Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living place for the household. Due to the lack of funds, she has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to pay for her house renovation. She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funding to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 42 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Jessica works very hard to provide for them.

Jessica runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Jessica has been in this business for six years now. 

In the future, Jessica would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.en:
Dorotea is 58 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Dorotea runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc..

Dorotea has been in this business for 13 years now. 

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, eggs, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Edna is 38 years old, and has four children who are in school.

Edna has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Edna has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish.

Analou has been in this business for three years now.  In the future, Analou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine works hard to support her family. Catherine is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an additional box of fish to sell.

Catherine has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, Catherine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maricel is 38 years old, and all four children are in school.

Maricel has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Maricel requested a 14,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her business.

Maricel has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Imelda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Imelda is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her fishing business.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials

loans.name: Mishel

texts.en:
Mishel is 28 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Mishel works very hard to provide for them.

Mishel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

Mishel has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Mishel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains and grocery products so that he can set up a small shop in his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 14 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Soklang

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Somrorng Torng district, Kampong Spue province, Soklang is 33 years old and married with one son who is still in school. Rice farming is the main source of her family’s income. She also sells various kinds of vegetables while her husband works as a garment worker to supplement their income. The current business earns her about 60,000 KHR per day. 

Soklang has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles already. Now she is applying for another loan to buy more vegetables to resell. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao, 32, lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He has only 1 child who is currently in school. 

To earn a living and support his family, Sao manages and operates a farming business on a small piece of farmland, where he primarily grows rice and sells his agricultural products to both customers at the market and local dealers. So far, he has been in this type of business for 15 years. On average, he is able to earn 7.00 USD each day. 

Now, Sao would like to request a Kiva loan via Hattha Kaksekar Limited to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow him to have a personal vehicle so that he can experience a convenient way of travelling. He is thankful to all lenders for their financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Nelly Florencia

texts.es:
La socia Nelly Florencia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de vinos y licores, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora y por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los vinos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar vinos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nelly Florencia continues to run her wine and liquor-selling business. She is an enterprising, tenacious woman and through this business she wants to carry her family forwards. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell the wines. She is asking for the loan to buy wines. 

She is glad about the loan and is committed to making all the repayments for her share of the loan.

loans.use: to buy wines

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
La socia Fanny se sigue dedicando al trabajo como asesora juridica, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora y por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar una computadora para su consultorio jurídico.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Fanny keeps dedicating herself to working as a legal advisor. She is an entrepreneurial and hard-working woman, and through this business she wants to get her family ahead. She requests the loan to buy a computer for her legal consultancy.

She is happy for the loan and promises to pay her loan.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her legal consultancy

loans.name: Genaline

texts.en:
Genaline sends you her thanks for your generosity, because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies which were needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

Genaline is very positive that she could improve her business even further if you were to allow her to take another 12,000 PHP loan. This new loan would go towards purchasing additional groceries, beverages, and toiletries. Simultaneously, she could continue to sustain the needs of her family with this assistance.

Genaline wants to expand her business so that she might be able to help support her children's educational needs. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell in her business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
From Taguig City, Analyn has been an active member of CCT for years now, and she was able to acquire several loans to make good profit from her business. At the age of 28, she is helping her husband to provide for their daily needs. She was inspired to improve their lives because she wants to give her children the best for their future. She works hard each day, and she is pretty sure that she is closer to reaching her goals.

Analyn owns a variety store. She believes that business is her stepping stone of making her dreams come to reality. She knows how important it is for her neighbors and daily consumers to have a nearby store where they can buy a sachet of shampoo, a bar of soap, 5 pesos' worth of cooking oil, an egg, toothpaste or even an ice tube. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price, then she will sell them per piece for a higher price to have a profit. She also offers personal product items and maintains and operates a tricycle unit for additional profit.

She desires to manage a bigger store someday, so she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy additional groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She is positive that she will become a successful businesswoman in the future, and she looks forward to seeing her children finish their studies through all her hard work and perseverance.

Analyn meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her variety store, buy additional direct selling products and pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 46 years old and has nine children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

Sarah is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Sarah has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Sarah has been in this business for 25 years years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Sarah would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is married and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store and raises livestock in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jessica has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Jessica aspires to save enough money in order to improve the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Shara

texts.en:
Shara is 32 years old and has four children. Shara is married and three of her children are in school.

Shara is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Shara successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.In the future, Shara would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Christy works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice grain business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Christy is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains for her business.

Christy has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains.

loans.name: Brenda Liz

texts.es:
Brenda, tiene instalada en su vivienda una mini tienda de productos de primera necesidad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos, sus hijos están en edades escolares, su proyecto nació hace cinco años, atiende a sus clientes de 7:00 a.m.  a 8:00 p.m., por el momento no ha tenido ningún problema en su negocio.
Surtirá la tienda con ayuda del crédito, comprara golosinas, aceite, huevos, pan, granos básicos, entre otros productos que le permitan tener venta mayores, espera tener un negocio más rentable y cancelar su deuda.
Los sueños que tiene Brenda son que sus hijos puedan estudiar en la universidad y mantener la continuidad de su progreso.
texts.en:
Brenda has a mini shop set up in her home, where she sells essential products. She is a single mother with four children who are of school age. She started her project five years ago and serves her customers from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm. So far she has not had any problems with her business. 

The loan will help her to stock her shop. She will buy candy, oil, eggs, bread, basic grains and other products which will allow her to increase her sales. She hopes to have a more profitable business and to pay off her debt.

Brenda dreams of her children being able to study at university and of continuing to make progress.

loans.use: to buy candy, oil, eggs, bread, basic grains and other products which will allow her to increase her sales

loans.name: Thouck

texts.en:
Thouck, 48, lives with her husband and 3 children in a rural village in the Somrong Tong district of Cambodia. 

To feed their family, Thouck earns a living by making and selling food, while her husband has been working as a garment worker for years. Together, they earn about 50,000 KHR per day to spend on their family’s needs. 

This is the fourth loan for Thouck with Kiva’s partner VisionFund, and she has been able to use the loans to improve her family’s livelihood. She is requesting this current loan in order to buy more ingredients and materials for making the food she sells. She hopes to generate more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients and materials for making and selling food.

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy concentrated pellet feed for her business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
From Manila, Philippines, Elvira has been an active member of CCT for years now and she was able to acquire several loans to make a good profit from her business. At age 55, she is helping her husband to provide for their daily needs and she was inspired to improve their lives because she wants to give her family a better future. She works hard each day and she is pretty sure that she is closer to reaching her goals.

Elvira owns a variety store. She believes that business is her stepping stone to making her dreams a reality. She knows how important it is for her neighbors and daily consumers to have a nearby store where they can buy shampoo, a bar of soap, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, an egg, toothpaste or even tube ice. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price and then sells them per piece for a higher price to make a profit.

She desires to become successful someday so she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She is positive that she will become a successful businesswoman in the future and she looks forward to seeing her children finish their studies through all of her hard work and perseverance.

Elvira meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries and other supplies she needs to expand her store and increase her profit.

loans.name: Makkhara

texts.en:
Makkhara, 21, lives in a small community in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is a garment factory worker and earns 3.00 USD a day on average. So far, she has been in this career for 3 years. 

This newlywed has no a child yet. Makkhara is married to Ty, 25, who is also employed as a garment factory worker. 

Since their house currently does not have one, Makkhara wants to build a latrine to improve the general living conditions of her entire family. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Kiva to build the latrine. 

By doing this, Makkhara can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through Hattha Kaksekar Limited with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Ernicita

texts.en:
Ernicita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant. Ernicita has been in this business for three years, and she earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

Ernicita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Kutheng

texts.en:
Kutheng, 26, is married with one son who is school. Her family lives in a house with a thatch roof and it is located in Kampong Spue province’s Somrong Torng district. The main source of her family’s income comes from selling various kinds of fruits in her village. She has been running her business for four years, earning about 43,000 KHR per day.
 
Kutheng received her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, three cycles ago and has effectively used it to sustain her family’s business, support her family’s needs and save some money from the earnings for the future. With a good business, she is applying for another loan to buy more fruits to sell. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell.

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 59 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Trinidad runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for one year now. 

In the future, Trinidad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a married woman with 4 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 28 years old, and 2 of her children are still in school.

Liza has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more food to sell.

Liza has been in this business for a year now. She would like to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more food to sell.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising chickens. Marita is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Marita has been sustaining her business activities through her past  loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 45 years old and has seven children. Rosario is married and has one child who is still in school.

Rosario is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Rosario requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Rosario has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to build house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em is 55 years old and married. She has two dependent children, and they live in a village of the Kos Krolo district. 

Em farms rice to make a living. Having also been in pig business for years, she manages to earn about 40,000 KHR per day to feed her family and children. This is the eighth loan for Em with VisionFund. She completely repaid the past seven loans, which have enabled her family to have enough food. With this loan, she is going to buy rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase the crops from her current business.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional vegetable and meat products which were needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expenses of her children and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stock of chicken and pork meat she needs in her business. Her customers will be likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her business, Elizabeth aims to give her family a better life someday. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more chicken and pork for her business.

loans.name: Adelmo Amin

texts.es: Adelmo de 33 años de edad se dedica desde hace 15 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los sacos que muestra en la fotografía para luego comercializarlos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en casa propia,  el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi seguir con sus siembras para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adelmo, aged 33, has worked farming corn and beans for fifteen years. When the harvest is brought in, it is stored in the bags shown in the photo, to then be sold in the different markets near to his home.

With the sales he makes, he is able to cover his household costs. He live with his spouse and three children in their own home. He is requesting the laon to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, pest control etc. so that he can continue with his farming to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, pest control etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 19 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada, vive en casa propia con sus madre y su hermano el quiere mejorar su vivienda encementando el piso y haciendo una fosa séptica en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero con lo que gana en su trabajo no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillos, tuberías y pago de mano de obra para que el y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos y en lo limpio.
texts.en:
The young man whose face has been obscured is 19 years old and lives in a high risk zone. He works as an employee in a private enterprise and lives in his mother's house with her and his brother. He needs to improve their dwelling, providing a cement floor and installing a septic tank in the space shown in the photograph. 

But what he earns in his work is insufficient to carry out the task. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase cement, sand blocks, and water pipe, and to pay construction workers so that he and his family may lives with greater comfort and improved sanitation.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, blocks, and water pipes, and to pay construction workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp for his business.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is 51 years old and married with two children.  She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, eggs, etc.  Jelly has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years, and also earns an income from raising livestock.

She aspires to saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 33 years old and married with two children.  She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc. Joyce has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years, and also earns an income from fish vending.

She aspires to saving enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 45 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Celia is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and other supplies.

Celia has been farming rice for 20 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other supplies.

loans.name: Jay Ann

texts.en:
Jay Ann works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Jay Ann requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing supplies like nets, gasoline, etc. She has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Jay Ann would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing supplies like nets, gasoline, etc

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marilou works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from being a beauty products dealer and raising pigs. Marilou is borrowing 24,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her business.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 47 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, etc.

Milagros has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from fish vending.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 60 years old and married with four children. Lolita works very hard to provide for them.

Lolita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items, like canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, shampoo, detergent soap, cooking oil, noodles, etc., to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items.

Lolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items, like canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, shampoo, detergent soap, cooking oil, noodles, etc., to sell

loans.name: Mylin

texts.en:
Mylin works hard to support her family. Mylin is married, and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish for her dried fish making.  Mylin has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Mylin would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish for her dried fish making.

loans.name: Sany

texts.en:
Sany, 48, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Ro Veang district. She has four children to take care of, three of whom are in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice, growing soybeans and raising pigs for 20 years. The current business earns her family about 50,000 KHR per day. 

Sany has been with VisionFund for four cycles. Now she is requesting a loan to buy soybean seeds and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to increase her family’s income from her current business so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy soybean seeds.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Hom

texts.en:
Hom is aged 54 and married with two children. Her family lives in a village of the Ro Veang district of Presh Vihea province. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice, growing soybeans and raising pigs. Having been in this business for more than 20 years, she is able to earn about 38,000 KHR per day. 

Hom is an existing client of VisionFund who has received loans for eight cycles. The past loans have helped relieve her family of financial burden to a great extent. Now she is applying for a new loan to buy soybean seeds and use a portion of the loan to pay for labor fees on plowing the field. With this loan, she hopes to grow her soybeans at the right time so as to sell it for a good price and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy soybean seeds.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Soun, 34, is married and lives with her husband and three children in a village of the Ro Veang district in Presh Vihea province. She has been farming rice and growing soybeans for 10 years, earning about 50,000 KHR per day to feed her family. 

Soun has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She has successfully paid back the past loans, which have helped relieve her family of financial burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is applying for another loan to buy soybean seeds for growing, and to use a portion of the loan to spend on labor fees. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to make her family’s living condition better.

loans.use: to buy soybean seeds for growing.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a hardworking entrepreneur from Quezon City, Philippines. She is 35 years old and has three children who are already schooling. Her husband is working as a seaman and they are helping each other to provide for the needs of their children. Michelle oversees the operation of their Jeepney unit, and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures.

She has a one unit (14-16 person capacity) Jeepney, from which she is paid *boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,500 every day. Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater Jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the Jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

*In the boundary system, the driver pays the Jeepney owner a fixed amount (the “boundary”) for driving a passenger vehicle for 12 hours. It is as if the driver is renting the vehicle. What he earns from passenger fares above the “boundary,” minus what he paid for the gas and oil, is his take-home pay.

Michelle is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan assistance to renew the franchise and pay for the maintenance of her Jeepney unit. She will use the profit to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In the future, she wants another Jeepney unit to be used for their business operation. She also hopes to open and manage new business opportunities to add to her profit. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance and renewal of her jeepney franchise so she can continue to operate her business.

loans.name: Heide

texts.en:
Heide works hard to support her family. Heide is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Heide requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production.

Heide has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income from vegetable farming.

She would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production

loans.name: Ielen

texts.en:
Ielen is 42 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Ielen is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ielen has been farming rice for four years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marietta is 43 years old, and has three children who are currently in school.

Marietta has a business buying and selling fruits in the Philippines. Marietta requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell to her customers.

Marietta has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Marietta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 35 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell plastic wares business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional plastic wares to sell.

Nancy has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell plastic wares business for two years and also earns an income from a general store.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional plastic wares to sell

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is 39 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Melodina works very hard to provide for them.

Melodina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Melodina has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as bath soap, canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits, milk, etc.

Melodina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Eris

texts.es: Un nuevo congelador y articulos de la canasta famliar en un ayor volumen,  son gran parte de la necesidad que tiene la tienda de Eris, madre de una pequeña quien con sus 3 años de edad es el motor de su vida. Su negocio inició hace 10 años cuando su suegro, hombre exerimentado en el negocio de tiendas durante 40 años, le sugirió emprender la misma actividad y así lo hizo ella, iniciando con poco capital y gradualmente creciendo con la venta diaria de víveres , ranchos, refrescos, bebidas, lácteos etc. An sus ventas las realiza con esta misma frecuecia de contado y a crédito, desde los lunes hasta los  domingos sin cesar, iniciando su labor a las 6 de la mañana y cerrando su negocio a las 9:30 de la noche; sus ventas las realiza directamente en su local, al consumidor final, quienes son principalmente las familias que habitan en el barrio donde se encuentra Eris ubicada y que compran cantidades precisas para preparar sus alimentos dia a dia.  Eris sostiene negociaciones con mayoristas, a quienes les comra para obtener precios que le permitar ser competitiva y abordar cada dia un mercado mas amplio.Su meta mas adelante es convertir su negocio en un autoservicio y remodelar su vivienda, aunque su mayor desafio es el de incrmentar sus ventas, fidelizar a su clientela ofreciendo buenos precios y un servicio inicgualable. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciemntoq ue hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual compará un nuevo congelador y víveres para tener unos buenos inventarios y mejorar la imagen de calidad frente a su clientela.
texts.en:
A new freezer and basic food and household items in larger quantities are a large part of what Eris' store needs. Eris is the mother of a three-year-old little girl who is what motivates her in her life. 

She started her business ten years ago when her father-in-law, who has 40 years of experience in retail stores, suggested this business to her. She decided to do so, starting with just a little capital and gradually growing the business with daily sales of groceries, typical fast food, soft drinks, beverages, dairy products, etc. She sells for cash and on credit equally and works ceaselessly from Monday through Sunday, starting at 6 a.m. and closing her shop at 9:30 p.m.  She sells directly to the consumer from her store, and the customers are mostly families who live in Eris' neighborhood. They buy just what they need each day to prepare the day's meals. Eris buys from wholesalers so she can get prices that allow her to be competitive with her own pricing and so that she can expand her market each day. 

Down the road, her goal is to convert her business to self-service and to remodel her home, although her biggest challenge is increasing sales and creating loyal customers by offering good prices and unparalleled service. She is currently asking for a Kiva loan which is the first time she is asking for financing from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy a new freezer and groceries to have a good inventory and to improve the image of quality for her customers.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and groceries.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans lives in Soweto, South Africa where he grew up. He is 33 and supports several of his sisters. Entrepreneurial Evans set up a business offering photocopying, printing and internet services. It is a business he knows as he used to work in an internet cafe. His day involves helping customers, fixing telephones and computers and updating his stock.

To expand the business Evans needs a loan to buy more computers to make internet services available to more customers. He is ambitious for greater success: he admits 'I want to own an international service technology company or buy shares in one'.

loans.use: to buy more computers

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Aged 46 years old, Kim is a married mother of one son living in a rural village of the Ro Veang district, Cambodia. To support her family, Kim has been farming rice and planting cassava for 16 years in the village. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day. 

Kim is an eighth-loan-cycle client with VisionFund. She has successfully used the past loans from VisionFund to better support her family. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers for her agribusiness. She hopes to increase her crop yield and sell it for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her agribusiness

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Lydmila

texts.en:
Lydmila is married and has two children. She is a nurse. Lydmila has been working at a hospital for 25 years. Also, she has a part-time job as a nurse at a local school. Lydmila is an active and friendly person.

Lydmila is asking for a loan of 8,000 UAH to buy a new fridge. She wants to buy a better quality and bigger sized fridge for her family.

loans.use: to buy a new fridge to be used by her family

loans.name: Agner Isaac

texts.es: Agner de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica desde hace 20 años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz, frijol y cafe, cuando ya está su cosecha la almacena en sacos como muestra en la fotografía para salir a comercializarlos en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc.  y asi poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Agner is 41 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and two children.
