He has been farming for 20 years, growing corn, beans, and coffee. When his harvest is ready he stores it in sacks like the one in the picture, and in this way, takes his products to sell in nearby towns. He already has many regular customers. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc., in order earn more income for better economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase perfumes for sale.

loans.name: Sitora

texts.en:
Sitora is a student, and was born in 1993. She lives in a small town. She is single. Sitora studies at a university, and is in the third year of her education. Her major is finance and credit. Sitora is a very active girl. She is an excellent student and is well known among her friends and classmates. 

She has no money to pay for her tuition. She is not allowed to take her exams, because she did not make a tuition payment. Sitora is asking for financial support to pay her university tuition fees. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Salvador  Alexander

texts.es: Salvador de 30 años de edad vive con su madre en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 5 años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; el necesita invertir por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, herbicida, etc. Salvador tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Salvador, 30 years old, lives with his mother in their own house. He works growing corn and beans and has worked in agriculture for 5 years and it has given him a lot of experience which allows him to get better harvests. He sells his crops in the areas near his community. He already has a lot of customers who prefer him because of the quality, good prices, and above all, for the good service. He needs to invest, so he asks for a loan that will allow him to purchase seeds, insecticide, herbicide, etc. Salvador has good payment references from his acquaintances and is very responsible. He affirms that he will be able to pay off the debt in the established time and also is confident that it will bring economic security to his household.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, insecticide, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Yajayra Dariela

texts.es:
La señora Yajayra de 27 años de edad es casada  tiene  dos  hijos  que dependen de ella  y vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 06  años  a la venta de ropa americana.
Doña Yajayra sus clientes son las personas que viven en su comunidad y amigos que le visitan  también vende de manera ambulante, es una joven muy trabajadora y emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña Yajayra está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de blusas, vestidos, camisas, pantalones, etc. ya que se acerca la semana santa y la demanda es grande, por tal razón desea tener suficiente producto que ofrecer a sus clientes. Es su tercer  préstamo que solicita a Prisma.
 Su sueño es tener salud y trabajo.

San Lorenzo, Honduras-  Enero del 2015.
texts.en:
Yajayra, 27 years old, is married and has two dependent children, and she lives in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. She has her own house and has worked for 6 years selling American clothing. 

Yajayra's customers are people who live in her community and friends who visit her. She also sells as a street vendor, she is a very hard-working and enterprising young woman with desires to get ahead. 

Yajayra is asking for the loan to purchase blouses, dresses, shirts, pants, etc. since Holy Week is approaching and the demand is high, so she wants to have enough products to offer to her customers. It is her third loan that she has requested from Prisma. 

Her dream is to have health and work. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras-  January 2015.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, dresses, shirts, pants, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Junmar

texts.en:
Junmar is 19 years old from Estrella, Rizal, Nueva Ecija. He is currently taking a certificate course on Mechatronics but his parents can’t provide for all of their needs especially when it comes to money. 

Despite poverty, Junmar is determined to finish his studies. That’s why he wants to seek financial assistance from Kiva lenders by requesting an education loan of 15,000 PHP. He wants to finish his studies and have a stable job to help his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Ghourlad

texts.en: Ghourlad is 18 years old from Estrella, Rizal, Nueva Ecija. He has two siblings and they are solely supported by their parents through farming. Sometimes what his parents earn is insufficient for all their daily expenditures, especially now that he is going to school. That’s why he wants to get an education loan of 15,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to finance his education. He is hopeful that lenders will approve his loan so that he can continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en: Mary Rose is 19 years old from Estrella, Rizal, Nueva Ecija. She has 3 siblings and their parents support them through farming and a sari-sari store. With their little income, they find it hard to make ends meet. That’s why Mary Rose wants to seek financial assistance of PHP 15,000 from the Kiva lenders so she can still continue her studies despite poverty. She is hopeful of finishing her studies to help her parents in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 30 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Regina works very hard to provide for them.

Regina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items, like cereals, coffee, sanitary pads, toothpaste, juice, soft drinks, biscuits, etc., to sell.

Regina has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Regina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items, like cereals, coffee, sanitary pads, toothpaste, juice, soft drinks, biscuits, etc., to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ruth is 46 years old, and one child is currently in school.

Ruth has a general store business in the Philippines. Ruth requested a 19,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Ruth has been in this business for 25 years. Ruth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Romark is 19 years old and is the third of the six children in the family. His mother, Marieta, is a member of NWTF. She supports the family through her buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines.

Romark is studying for a bachelor of science in marine engineering and is currently in his third year of this 4-year course.

Marieta is borrowing PHP 6,000 to pay for the tuition fees of her son Romark for the second semester of the school year 2014-15.

When he graduates, Romark plans to be gainfully employed so he can help improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda works hard to support her family. Nilda is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Nilda requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Nilda has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Nilda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Sakhorn

texts.en:
Sakhorn is aged 63 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in a rural area of the Ro Veang district of Presh Vihea province. All of her children are still in school. She and her husband are rice farmers, and they supplement their income by planting cassava. Having been in this business for 38 years, together they can earn about KHR 70,000 per day.
 
Sakhorn is a seventh-loan-cycle client with Kiva’s partner VisionFund, and she completely paid back the loans, which have helped her improve her family’s living conditions. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers for her cassava, and will use a portion of it to spend on household supplies. She hopes to timely grow her cassava so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her cassava

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es: Alexis es una mujer comerciante y productora de bolsos y ropa en diveras líneas. Ella  con mucha fortaleza,  ha sacado adelante a su hijo, hoy adulto, motor de su vida, a quien se propone ayudarlo mucho mas en sus estudios. Sus únicos ingresos provienen de su propio trabajo independiente, el cual realiza con mucho entusiasmo y con metas precisas para lograr avanzar póco a poco, pues su mayor desafio es no tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para invertir en infraestructura técnica, y aumentar la calidad e sus productos y tambien para comprar en materias primas en un mayor volumen, con el fin de obtener descuentos especiales. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una fileteadora y meteriales para aumentar su producción y el acabado de prendas. Alexis inició su actividad como confeccionista, trabajando en un taller hace 15 años, junto a su hermana, lugar donde aprendieron el oficio de confecciones,  ahorraron y posteriormente se independizaron. Hoy su actividad no se detiene y elaboran bolsos, ropa para las familias y vende mercancias como accesorios que acompañan con elegancia lo que produce. En el taller de Alexis se realizan todas las operaciones de las confección: preparación, ensamble y acabado de piezas, y produce para vender a crédito a una clientela que ha estructurado entre sus familiares, vecinos y amigos.
texts.en:
Alexis is a tradeswoman who makes different lines of bags and clothing. With great strength, she has provided for her son, now an adult, the driving-force of her life, whom she intends to support a lot more through his studies. Her only income comes from her own independent work, which she does with much enthusiasm and with clear goals to be able to advance step by step. Her greatest challenge is not having the sufficient working capital to invest in technical infrastructure, improve the quality of her products and also to buy greater quantities of primary materials so that she can get special discounts.

She is currently applying for a credikiva loan, the first funding she has applied for with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy a sewing machine and materials to improve her production and garment finishing. 

Alexis started her career as a seamstress by working in a workshop 15 years ago, along with her sister, where they learned the seamstress trade, saved up money and later became independent. To this day she has not stopped with this trade and makes bags, clothing for families and sells goods such as accessories that elegantly accompany her other products. In Alexis' workshop all sewing operations take place: preparation, assemblage and finishing. The workshop sells its products on credit to an established clientèle of family members, neighbours and friends.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabrics, threads and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase basic pantry items and establish a store in her house.

loans.name: So

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Ro Veang district of Presh Vihea province, So is a 47-year-old mother of one son who is still in school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and growing cassava. They have been in this business for almost 15 years, earning about 40,000 KHR per day. 

So has been with VisionFund for seven cycles, which has helped her improve her livelihood. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make healthier crops and earn more income to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Chopita

texts.en:
Chopita is 43 and living in Soweto, South Africa. He is not yet married and does not have children of his own. He, however, takes care of his two younger brothers aged 16 and 18 and his mother.

Chopita wants to start his own a small grocery shop that will sell foodstuff, toiletries and beverages. He has experience in this type of business as he works for his sister who is self-employed and has been successful in starting her own grocery shop.

Chopita is seeking a loan to buy foodstuff, toiletries and beverages to stock his new grocery shop in order to provide a variety of grocery items to customers. His grocery shop will be located in a busy location with many customers.

Chopita’s ambition is to expand the business by opening more shops in other places of Johannesburg and its environs.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff, toiletries and beverages.

loans.name: Soben

texts.en:
Soben, aged 34 years old, is married and has no kids. She lives with her husband in a rural village of the Kos Krolo district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She and her husband have earned a living through farming rice and selling grocery items for 13 years. Together, they can earn about 50,000 KHR per day from the current businesses. 

Soben has been with VisionFund for seven loan cycles. Now, she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizes and seeds for her farmland, and will use a portion of it to spend on buying more grocery items for resale. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current businesses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizes and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Ultuvoi

texts.en:
Ultuvoi is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1957, and she lives in a remote district. She is married and has two children. For about twelve years she has run a business. She has a yard where she plants agricultural products. She loves to work on the land. Ultuvoi is a gentle, communicative and patient person. 

Unfortunately, her son has become sick and she wants to treat him. Ultuvoi is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to treat her son in a medical clinic.

loans.use: To treat her son's illness

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase used clothing.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Ruben de 57 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia, actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son, maíz y frijol.  El desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía, para poder seguir con su trabajo, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Ruben is 57 years old. He is a very responsible man with his obligations at home, since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. He currently lives with his wife and two children. He works as a farmer, each year planting the main, basic grains of the region, such as corn and beans. He wishes to increase his sales and for this reason he visited the offices of INTEGRAL to apply for a loan which would permit him to buy: seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc. to better the land shown in the photograph, in order to continue with his work. In this way, he will continue providing for the daily needs of his home without limitation.

loans.use: to buy: seeds, fertilizer, pesticides etc. to better the land

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with seven children. Teresita is 51 years old, and has two children who are still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Teresita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.  Teresita has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Virgeta

texts.en:
Virgeta is 42 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Virgeta works very hard to provide for them.

Virgeta runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items, like canned goods, fabric conditioners, detergent, noodles, cereals, coffee, etc. to sell.  Virgeta has been in this business for three years, and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, fabric conditioners, detergent, noodles, cereals, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Virgeta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items, like canned goods, fabric conditioners, detergent, noodles, cereals, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay school expenses for his students.

loans.name: Simat

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house in the Ro Veang District of Presh Vihea Province, Simat is 27 years old and married with two children. The main sources of the family’s income are rice farming, growing cashews and raising pigs. She has been in this business for several years. With the current business, she can earn about  25,000 KHR per day. 

This is the fourth loan for Simat with VisionFund, and she successfully paid back the prior loans. She successfully used the loan proceeds to improve her livelihood. Now, she is applying for a loan to buy pig feed, and will spend a portion of it on growing cashews.  She hopes to increase her crop yield and to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and grow cashews.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Ro Veang District

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Chim is 42 years old and married with three children. She and her family live in a village of the Kos Krolor district of Battambang province. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming for 14 years, earning about 40,000 KHR per day. 

Chim is a seventh cycle client with VisionFund. Now, she is applying for a loan to buy rice seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her crops better, and produce higher yields in order for her to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
La señora Ruth de  47  años de edad, vive con sus  hijos  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 6 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería en general, en su negocio vende arroz, azúcar, maíz, café, frescos de todo tipo, manteca, frijoles, maseca, papel higiénico, y otros más.
Doña Ruth vive en una aldea  San Lorenzo,  al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de frescos, jugos, pollo, huevos, arroz y azúcar, aceite, harina, papel higiénico, café, etc. Para surtir su negocio y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, espera que con esta inversión su negocio mejore y le permita obtener los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia.  
Uno de sus sueños es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Enero del  2015
texts.en:
Ruth is 47 years old. She lives with her children in her own home. For the past 6 years she has made a living in the business of selling general groceries. At her business she sells rice, sugar, corn, coffee, soft drinks of all kinds, beans, maseca (which is used for making corn tortillas), toilet paper and more. 

Ruth lives in a small village called San Lorenzo, in the southern part of Honduras. She is an enterprising woman with desires to advance herself and struggles daily to better her quality of life.  

She is applying for the loan to buy soft drinks, juices, chicken, eggs, rice and sugar, oil, flour, toilet paper, coffee, etc. to supply her business and satisfy demand from her customers. She hopes that with this investment her business will improve and permit her to obtain earnings necessary to advance herself and her family. One of her dreams is to have a good business and increase her customer base. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras- January 2015

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, juices, chicken, eggs, rice and sugar, oil, flour, toilet paper, coffee, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy oranges and papayas.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique, tiene la necesidad de invertir en los trabajos de agricultura, ya que esta se lo demanda, invertirá en abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas y en pagar el alquiler del terreno en que realiza la siembra de granos básicos.
Con el crédito anterior pudo sacar una cosecha abundante de sus cultivos, las ganancias las utilizo para pagar la deuda y brindar a su familia una alimentación sana, mejor vestuario y salud, sus condiciones económicas han tenido un cambio positivo, pero sigue necesitando el  apoyo de créditos para continuar trabajando.
texts.en: Enrique needs to invest in agricultural work, since this requires investment in fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides, and payment of rent for the land he uses for the planting of basic crops. The previously mentioned loan could get him a bountiful crop. He would use the earnings to pay off debt and provide his family with healthy food, better clothing and health services. Economic conditions have had a positive effect, but he continues to need support from loans to continue working.

loans.use: to invest in seed, herbicides, pesticides, and rent payment for the land used to plant crops

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Akou vit à Adamavo aves ses deux enfants à charge. Elle est une femme veuve et âgée de  27 ans. Pour mieux subvenir aux besoins quotidiens qu’elle éprouve, Akou vend des charbons de bois afin d’avoir un revenu leur permettant de se nourrir. Akou s’approvisionne deux fois par semaine auprès de ses fournisseurs du quartier. Akou demande ce crédit pour acheter de nouveaux sacs de charbons d’où elle peut tirer du bénéfice pour relever les défis qu’elle affronte quotidiennement.
texts.en:
Akou lives in Adamavo with her two dependent children. She is a widow at twenty-seven.

To better provide for her daily needs, Akou sells charcoal to have revenues allowing her family to eat. Akou procures her supplies twice a week from local suppliers.

Akou is requesting this loan to purchase new charcoal bags, from which she can make the profit to meet the challenges she encounters daily.

loans.use: to buy three bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Djifa

texts.fr: Etant une femme mariée Djifa vit à Adamavo avec ses enfants. Elle est âgée de 57 ans et est très active pour la prospérité de sa famille. Ainsi pour contribuer à la survie de son foyer, Djifa vend des pagnes. Elle se promène de quartier en quartier pour répondre aux sollicitations de ses clients et réaliser ses gains. Djifa s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Pour commander des pagnes de très bonne qualité, Djifa nécessite ce crédit afin d’avoir un bénéfice pour investir dans la vie éducative de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Djifa is a married woman living in Adamavo with her children. She is 57 years old and very active for her family’s prosperity.

To contribute to her household’s survival, Djifa sells fabric. She goes from neighborhood to neighborhood to meet her clients and make her profit. Djifa procures her supplies four times a month from the great market in Lome.

To order high-quality fabric, Djifa needs this loan, which will allow her to make a profit to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy three pieces of fabric.

loans.name: Fermin Antonio

texts.es: Fermín de 52 años de edad es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su grupo familiar, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz y maicillo; sus productos son de muy buena calidad y los comercializa en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. Fermín solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, así como muestra en la fotografía, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Fermín is 52 years old and is very nice and hardworking. He lives with his family. He works very hard on his own parcel of land where he plants corn and sorghum; his products are of very good quality and he sells them in different markets close to his place of residence. Fermín is applying for this loan through INTEGRAL to have the money necessary to invest in agricultural supplies such as pesticides, fertilizers, and herbicides. As shown in the photograph, he longs to increase his sales to be able to obtain greater profits and give his family greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, such as pesticides, fertilizers, and herbicides

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Etant une femme mariée Djifa vit à Adamavo avec ses enfants. Elle est âgée de 57 ans et est très active pour la prospérité de sa famille. Ainsi pour contribuer à la survie de son foyer, Djifa vend des habits qu’elle coud. Elle se promène de quartier en quartier pour répondre aux sollicitations de ses clients et réaliser ses gains. Djifa s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Pour commander des pagnes de très bonne qualité, Djifa nécessite ce crédit afin d’avoir un bénéfice pour investir dans la vie éducative de ses enfants.
texts.en: Being a married woman, Djifa lives in Adamavo with her children. She is 57 years old and keeps very busy earning a living to make sure that her family prospers. So to contribute to the upkeep of her family, Djifa sells clothes that she makes. She walks around the local neighbourhoods to answer her customers' needs and make some money. Djifa stocks up four times per month at the grand market in Lome. To enable her to order very good quality pagne clothes, Djifa needs this loan to make a profit that she will invest in her children's education.

loans.use: to buy three units of pagne fabric.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 41 years old and lives in Soweto, Johannesburg, in South Africa. He and his wife have two children (16 and 19); one is working, and the other is still in school. Christopher's wife is employed as a cleaner, while Christopher is self-employed working as an electrical technician and digital satellite installer. He is seeking a loan to buy cable TV decoders and satellite dishes to expand his business.

The loan will enable Christopher's business to grow much faster, and his increased income will improve his family's livelihood. Christopher enjoys what he does and wants to specialize in his field - he hopes that the success of his business will enable him employ more young people.

loans.use: to buy cable TV decoders and satellite dishes

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making dried fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

Rosemarie requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inputs for the Cultivation and Fertilization of Coffee.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est mariée et âgée de 22 ans vivant à Adamavo. Elle est une femme qui a trois enfants à sa charge et désire activement travailler pour leur épanouissement. Afi est une revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale. Elle s’approvisionne deux fois par semaine au grand marché de Lomé pour équiper son étalage. Afi nécessite ce prêt pour l’achat des sacs de sucre et de gari afin augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour une meilleure rentabilité.
texts.en: Afi lives in Adamavo, she is 22 years old and married. She has three dependent children and wants to go to work herself to help them thrive. Afi is a saleswoman. She sells general food products. She stocks up twice a week at the big market in Lome to prepare her shelves. Afi needs this loan to buy sacks of sugar and of gari (manioc or cassava flour) in order to increase her turnover and to make for a better profitability.

loans.use: to buy 25 bowls of gari, 10 bowls of sugar and  05 bowls of groundnuts.

loans.name: Yawoavi

texts.fr: Yawoavi est une femme de 68 ans et vit Adamavo. Yawoavi est mariée et s’occupe de ses trois enfants. Elle est une commerçante qui vend des pagnes et parcoure tout le quartier en livrant ses tissus à ses clients. Son activité lui procure un résultat qu’elle ménage pour couvrir les charges de la famille. Yawoavi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au Ghana pour avoir la qualité préférée par ses clients. Yawoavi demande ce crédit pour lancer une nouvelle commande de pagnes et faire encore plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Yawoavi is a 68 year old woman who lives in Adamavo. She is married and takes care of her three children. She is a saleswoman who sells traditional pagne dresses and travels all around the neighbourhood delivering her fabrics to her customers. Her business results in an income that she uses sparingly in order to cover her family's expenses. She stocks up twice a month in Ghana in order to find the quality that her clients prefer. Yawoavi requests this loan to place a new order of pagne fabric and make more profits.

loans.use: to buy 06 units of pagne fabric.

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.en:
Dilfuza is a bright person. She was born in 1971. She is living in a village. She is married and has two children. 

Dilfuza has had a business for about six years and her husband helps to run the business. She is busy with planting vegetables in their yard. She gains a good harvest from each planting. She is satisfied with her activity. She is selling her vegetables to customers in a domestic market at accessible prices. 

Dilfuza is well-known among sellers, because her products are of good quality. She wants to renovate her house. She is requested financial support from Kiva for renovation of her house. Dilfuza awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To renovate her house

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 35 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Jane runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soft drinks, bread, eggs, canned goods, snack foods, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft drinks, bread, eggs, canned goods, snack foods, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Alba Lilian

texts.es:
Alba, tiene una tienda de consumo, vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos los cuales están estudiando, lo emprendió por su cuenta, al principio solo ofrecía bebidas, golosinas y boquitas, con el tiempo y la administración adecuada de las ganancias fue incorporando nuevos productos.
El préstamo le servirá para comprar lácteos, dulces, golosinas, bebidas, granos básicos, especias, etc., al fortalecer su negocio con más productos generara mayores ventas e ingresos para el hogar.
Alba tiene como visión la seguir mejorando el inventario del negocio para tener recursos con los que pueda abrir un nuevo punto de atención para sus clientes y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Alba has a general store and lives with her life partner and children, who are in school. She started the business on her own, and at first she only offered drinks, candy and snacks. With time and proper administration of her profits she has added new products. 

The loan will help her to buy dairy products, sweets, candies, beverages, grains, spices, etc. to build her business with more products and generate greater sales and earnings for her home. Her vision is to continue improving the inventory of her business to have resources with which she would be able to open a new store for her customers and pay her debts.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, sweets, candies, grains, spices, etc. to build her business with more products to generate greater sales and earnings for the home

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Zita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business of selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines.

She has been in this business for 18 years now.

Zita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ret

texts.en:
Ret is age 47 and she has three children. She is living in a rural village of the Kos Krolor district. She and her husband are rice farmers, which they have been doing for 16 years. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day. 

This is for the micro loan for Ret with VisionFund.  She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Webster

texts.en:
Webster is 21 year old and lives in Soweto, South Africa. He is a young entrepreneur and a single father of one child, aged 2.  As well as providing for his child, Webster helps to support his mother. At this young age, Webster has already shown his drive and motivation, and has gone from working in a barber’s shop to opening his own mobile phone and computer repair shop. 

It has been hard work; Webster works long weeks of sometimes 70+ hours, but the business has been doing well. He is seeking a loan to buy computer parts, phone chargers and new mobile phones to sell. This new stock will help his business attract a more diverse customer base, and increase its profits. 

With better business returns, Webster will be able to save for his daughter's education, and also finish constructing his house, which he says is currently in a poor state. His business ambitions for the future are "to have a phone shop that sells and repairs phones, and employ the many young guys sitting idle in this area."

loans.use: to buy computer parts, phone chargers, and new mobile phones.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée de 54 ans qui vit avec ses deux enfants à Kpogan dans la ville de Lomé. Afi est une commerçante de chaussures pour homme et femme au marché. Afi trouve régulière son profit dans ce commerce et arrive à venir en aide aux besoins de sa famille. Afi s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Afi demande ce microcrédit pour financer son achat de chaussure qu’elle pourra vendre dans d’autres marchés pour réaliser plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Afi is a married woman of 54 who lives with her two children in Kpogan in Lome. Afi sells shoes for men and women at the market. Afi makes a regular profit in this business and manages to help pay for her family's needs. Afi stocks up four times per month at the big market in Lome. Afi requests this micro-credit to finance her next purchase of merchandise that she will be able to sell at the other markets to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy 05 boxes of shoes.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Akou vit à Kpogan et est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est une femme et mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Akou  vend des ignames à la devanture de sa maison et arrive à faire une bonne épargne grâce à cette activité génératrice de revenu. Akou s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché d’Agbélouhoin. Akou nécessite ce financement pour commander des sacs d’ignames afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients.
texts.en: Akou lives in Kpogan and is 41 years old. She is a married woman with four children who all go to school. Akou sells yams in front of her home and manages to save up quite well thanks to this income generating business. Akou stocks up three times per month at the market in Agbelouhoin. Akou needs this loan to order sacks of yams to satisfy the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy 03 calabashes of yams.

loans.name: Phary's Group

texts.en:
Phary’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Phary makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each one of this group to safeguard the health of their families as well as save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is age 49 and happily married.  They’re blessed with five children. She has been selling fish at the public market for almost 35 years. Her net income on this business is usually spent on the school allowances of their children. 

Due to insufficient capital for her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase fish and seafoods to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase fish and seafoods to sell.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a married woman with eleven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Merlita is 48 years old and has three children who are currently in school. She has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

Merlita has requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. She has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Merlita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in shirts, pants, dresses, skirts, etc. to renew inventory so that her business maintains its competitiveness

loans.name: Sheilla Marie

texts.en:
Sheilla Marie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a computer services business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like bond paper, ink, etc. for her business.

Sheilla Marie has been in this business for 10 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like bond paper, ink, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support her family. Wilma is married and has a pig raising business in the Philippines.

Wilma requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Wilma has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Wilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Joy is 41 years old and has five children who are currently in school.

Joy has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Joy has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Joy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and has two children who are currently in school. Teresita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for four years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 52 years old and married with eight children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.

She has been raising pigs for 4 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Consolacion requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Kos Krolor district, Sitha, age 30, has two children. She and her husband are rice farmers who have been farming for 11 years to make a living. 

Sitha has been with VisionFund for three cycles and has completely paid back the loans, which have helped her improve her livelihood from cycle to cycle. 

Now she is applying for another loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthily and she also hopes to make more rice to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Rukhsana Bibi

texts.en:
Rukhsana Bibi is a 36-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past three years, and he is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. 

Rukhsana Bibi's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities like rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purposes. But due to financial constraints, he is not in suitable position to buy all of the above products for reselling purposes. Therefore, Rukhsana Bibi has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all of these commodities, and also help him to earn a maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. Rukhsana Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to increase his business.

loans.name: Khadija Bibi

texts.en:
Khadija bibi is a 57-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 5 children. Her husband is a government servant. He is the guardian of the family and manages the entire household. 

One of her sons has been running his own business as a rice wholesaler for the past 9 years. He needs to buy rice bags in bulk along with other commodities for reselling purposes, but due to financial constraints he is unable to purchase these commodities. 

Therefore Khadija bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will assist her son to buy these commodities to earn maximum profitable income, which will also help him to make savings to meet the needs of both family and business.

Khadija bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: her son wanted to increase his business.

loans.name: Samol's Group

texts.en: Samol’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Samol makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these persons to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Luch's Group

texts.en: Luch’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Luch makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these persons to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Don Rigoberto nació en una comunidad llamada Guacal pisque en el año de 1967.Desde pequeño se dedico a trabajar con el padre en la propiedad aprendió las labores de agricultura y ganadería. Actualmente esta casado y tiene 7 hijods. El con mucho esfuerzo compro sus tierra y también heredo por parte de su padre y poco a poco ha podido tener su ganado pero en la zona donde él vive es caliente y el tiene poca área de bosque que es de ahí donde extrae la leña para cocinar pero el cuenta que no quiere seguir despaldando su pequeña área de bosque y por eso el solicita un préstamo para la compra de un Biodigestor para la producción de gas y así que la señora doña Domitila cocine con mayor facilidad y sin exposición de la salud producida por el humo al cocinar con leña, además comenta que además de no ahumársele la casa ya no ocasionara mucho despale al bosque y lo que hará será reforestar para así tener leña disponible si acaso ocupara un poco. El estaría agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para poder instalar este Biodigestor.
texts.en:
Rigoberto was born in a community called Guacal pisque in the year 1967. From a young age he has worked with his father from whom he learned the work of agriculture and growing livestock. He is now married and has 7 children. 

Through much effort, he bought his land and also inherited the land of his father, and little by little he has been able to raise his livestock. However, in the area where he lives it is hot and he has little forested area where he can obtain firewood to cook. He does not want to continue depleting his small area of forest and for this reason he is applying for a loan to buy a Biodigester for the production of gas in order for Domitila to cook with greater ease and without exposure to health risks caused by the smoke from cooking with firewood. 

He also states that in addition to not filling the home with smoke, he will no longer cause deforestation and the area will be reforested so that firewood is available if some is needed. He would be thankful if he is provided with the opportunity to have this loan to be able to set up the Biodigester.

loans.use: to buy a Biodigester

loans.name: Yean's Group

texts.en:
Yean’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Yean makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families as well as save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their families.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: corn, vegetables, chicken, banana leaves, etc. for the preparation and sale of delicious tamales.

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano is a generous woman. She was born in 1970. She is living in remote district and she is married. She has two children. Rano is a kind, communicative, hardworking and gentle person. She is busy with buying and selling stationery and nutrition products. 

She wants to better her standard of living and tries to work hard, serving clients very well to gain more income. Rano is requesting 10,000 TJS loan for buying additional products to store and to increase working capital.

loans.use: to buy nutrition products.
